sustainable energy solutions importance of choosing the right solar panels for optimal efficiency and costeffectiveness efficiency different types of solar panels for home have varying efficiencies in converting sunlight into electricity higher efficiency panels generate more electricity per square metre and are ideal for homes with limited roof space durability and longevity when it comes to solar panel manufacturers in india highquality panels are built to last and withstand various weather conditions choosing reputable solar panel companies in india with longer warranties ensures longevity and reliability costeffectiveness while higher efficiency solar panels often come with a higher initial cost they can result in greater longterm savings by producing more electricity over their lifespan its essential to consider the balance between upfront cost and longterm savings adaptability and aesthetics some types of solar panels are designed for specific roof or aesthetic preferences choosing panels that suit your roof structure and design preferences can enhance the overall appeal of your home installation and maintenance choosing solar panels for home that are easier to install and require minimal maintenance can save you time and additional costs in the long run how solar panels work photon absorption sunlight consists of tiny particles called photons when sunlight hits different types of solar panels the panels photovoltaic cells typically made of silicon absorb these photons electron excitation when the photons are absorbed they transfer their energy to the electrons in the silicon atoms of the solar cells this energy absorption excites the electrons causing them to break free from their atoms electric field generation the structure of the best solar panels in india for homes has an electric field across the layers of silicon this field acts as a force that drives the loose electrons towards a particular direction creating a flow of electricity electrical conductors conductive metal plates within different types of solar panels capture these moving electrons forming an electric current this current is then drawn out of the solar panel via metal conductors to be used as electricity inverter conversion the electricity generated by the solar panels is in direct current dc form which is converted into alternating current ac by an inverter ac is the standard form of electricity used in homes and businesses utilisation or storage the converted ac electricity can be used to power devices and appliances in the home or can be stored in batteries for later use especially when sunlight is not available such as during nighttime different types of solar panels available in the indian market monocrystalline solar panels polycrystalline also known as multicrystalline solar panels thinfilm solar panels factors to consider when buying solar panels efficiency rating type of solar cells durability and build quality temperature coefficient contact us for the best consultation warranty and performance guaranteepay attention to warranties offered by manufacturers a longer warranty especially for performance indicates the manufacturers confidence in their products durabilityperformance warranties ensure that the panel will produce a certain percentage of its rated power over time testing and certificationlook for certifications and testing compliance such as iec international electrotechnical commission certifications ul underwriters laboratories listings or certifications from local regulatory bodiescertified panels often undergo rigorous testing for performance and safety standards degradation ratesolar panels degrade over time losing efficiency gradually the degradation rate indicates how much efficiency is lost per yearlower degradation rates mean the panels will maintain higher efficiency levels for a longer period compatibility and system designensure that the panels you choose are compatible with your existing or planned solar system components inverters batteries etcoptimal system design and component compatibility can significantly impact overall system efficiency estimating your households energy consumption and determining the size of the solar panel system required keep in mind that these calculations provide a general guideline factors like future energy needs changes in lifestyle or advancements in technology can influence your decision regarding the size and solar panel cost consulting with experts ensures a tailored solution that maximises the benefits when choosing solar energyefficient and comfortable living spaces with that in mind heres a personalised guide for individual home builders helping you understand construction materials to achieve cooler homes before selecting construction materials its essential to understand the climate of the region where the home will be built india experiences a range of climates from hot and humid in coastal areas to hot and dry in desert regions and temperate in hilly areas materials should be tailored to the specific environment to optimise thermal comfort insulation materials insulation is crucial in keeping homes cool in hot climates by minimising heat transfer from outside to inside consider materials with high thermal resistance rvalue such as expanded polystyrene eps foam extruded polystyrene xps foam or mineral wool these materials can be installed in walls roofs and floors to reduce heat gain and loss have queries get a consultation from our experts reflective roofing materials roofs can absorb significant solar heat in hot climates making the interior spaces uncomfortably warm opt for reflective roofing materials such as white tiles cool roof coatings or metal sheets with reflective coatings these materials reflect solar radiation instead of absorbing it keeping the roof surface and the interior cooler natural ventilation incorporate materials and design features that promote natural ventilation allowing cool air to flow through the home and flush out hot air use breathable wall finishes operable windows louvres and ventilated facades to facilitate cross ventilation and promote air circulation high thermal mass materials materials with high thermal mass such as concrete stone or clay can help regulate indoor temperatures by absorbing heat during the day and releasing it slowly at night incorporate these materials strategically in the building envelope such as in walls or floors to stabilise indoor temperatures and reduce the need for mechanical cooling green building materials consider using ecofriendly and sustainable materials with natural insulating properties and low embodied energy examples include bamboo straw bales rammed earth and compressed earth blocks these materials help keep homes more relaxed contribute to environmental conservation and reduce carbon footprint shading devices use shading devices such as overhangs pergolas awnings and trellises to block direct sunlight from entering windows and doors especially on the south and westfacing facades choose materials for shading devices that provide adequate solar protection while allowing diffused natural light to enter the interior spaces centrally placed courtyards position courtyards centrally within the home layout to maximise cross ventilation and airflow courtyards act as natural air wells drawing in cool air from the surrounding spaces and facilitating air movement throughout the interior design the home with taller openings or skylights around the courtyard to encourage the stack effect where warm air rises and escapes through vents or openings at higher levels creating a natural cooling effect and improving air circulation proper siting and orientation consider the homes orientation and relationship to the suns path throughout the day orient the building to maximise natural shading and ventilation opportunities use landscaping elements such as trees shrubs and green roofs to provide additional shading and improve microclimate conditions around the home integrating water bodies thoughtful landscaping and centrally placed courtyards into home design allows individual builders to create cooler more comfortable living environments that promote passive cooling energy efficiency and connection with nature these design strategies enhance thermal comfort and contribute to sustainable and resilient homes that harmonise with their surroundings make the smart choice for your next construction project contact jsw one homes today to learn more about our services and how we can help you build a cooler home that lasts a lifetime our team understands the importance of selecting the right construction materials to achieve optimal thermal comfort in indias diverse climates from insulation materials to reflective roofing and natural ventilation solutions weve got you covered share wooden flooring has become a popular choice for home decor in recent years and with good reason it offers a classic timeless look that can elevate any room in your house however the question arises does wooden flooring work in india india has diverse weather conditions and varied temperatures throughout the year as a natural product wood flooring is affected by temperature and humidity changes it is essential to consider these factors before investing in wooden flooring for your home the climate in india is primarily tropical which means it can be hot and humid in most parts of the country this can cause problems for wooden flooring as it is sensitive to humidity and moisture excessive humidity can lead to swelling and warping of the wooden planks damaging the flooring and making it look unsightly however with proper care and maintenance wooden flooring can work in india here are a few factors to consider before investing in wooden flooring for your home need help picking the right paint well break it down for you choose the correct type of wood the type of wood you choose for your flooring is crucial some types of wood like oak and teak are more resistant to humidity and moisture than others these hardwoods have a tighter grain and are less prone to swelling and warping on the other hand softwood floorings like pine and cedar can be more prone to damage from humidity and moisture it is crucial to choose the right type of wood for the climate you live in choose the right finish the finish you choose for your wooden flooring is also important a good finish will help protect the wood from moisture and humidity and keep it looking beautiful for years to come oilbased finishes are a popular choice for wooden flooring in india as they provide a protective layer on the wood and prevent it from absorbing moisture maintain the humidity levels in your home maintaining the humidity levels in your home is crucial for the longevity of your wooden flooring the humidity levels should be between 3555 to prevent swelling and warping of the wooden planks investing in a dehumidifier can help regulate the humidity levels in your home additionally it is essential to avoid spilling liquids on the wooden flooring and to clean up any spills immediately to prevent damage regular maintenance regular maintenance is key to keeping your wooden flooring looking beautiful for years to come sweeping or vacuuming the floors regularly can prevent dirt and debris from accumulating and scratching the surface of the wood it is also important to avoid dragging heavy furniture across the wooden flooring as this can cause scratches and damage to the surface using furniture pads or coasters can help prevent this in conclusion wooden flooring can work in india with proper care and maintenance choosing the right type of wood and finish is important maintaining humidity levels in your home and regularly cleaning and maintaining your flooring to prevent damage apart from the functional aspect wooden flooring also offers several aesthetic benefits it is versatile and can be used to create various styles from traditional to contemporary it can also add warmth and texture to any room and make it feel more inviting moreover wooden flooring is also an ecofriendly option as it is a renewable resource and can be recycled at the end of its life it is a sustainable option for those looking to reduce their carbon footprint in conclusion wooden flooring can be a great choice for homes in india it offers a timeless classic look that can elevate any room in your house with proper care and maintenance wooden flooring can last for many years and provide a beautiful and sustainable flooring option for your home share gypsum is a naturally occurring mineral used in construction for centuries it is a soft sulfate mineral composed of calcium sulfate dihydrate with the chemical formula caso42h2o gypsum is abundant worldwide and it is mined and processed to create a wide range of products used in construction including drywall plaster and cement gypsum has several unique properties that make it an ideal material for use in construction here are some of the main reasons why gypsum is used in your home construction fire resistance one of the essential properties of gypsum is its fire resistance gypsum contains water molecules in its crystal structure which helps it to resist high temperatures and prevent the spread of flames this makes gypsum an ideal material for walls and ceilings where fire resistance is a critical factor sound insulation gypsum is also an excellent sound insulator its porous structure helps to absorb sound waves and reduce noise levels making it an ideal material for use in walls and ceilings to create a quieter and more comfortable living environment durability gypsum is a very durable material that can withstand much wear and tear it is resistant to mould mildew and pests making it less likely to require repairs or replacements this makes it a costeffective and longlasting material for use in construction versatility gypsum is a very versatile material that can be used in various applications it can be moulded into different shapes and sizes to create custom designs and painted or textured to create different finishes this makes it a popular choice for residential and commercial construction sustainability gypsum is a natural material that can be recycled and reused it is also nontoxic and safe for human use which makes it a sustainable and ecofriendly choice for use in construction want to know more about selecting the right materials get an expert consultation with jsw one homes now that we have covered some of the reasons why gypsum is used in home construction lets take a closer look at some of the specific products made from gypsum drywall drywall also known as gypsum board or plasterboard is one of the most common building materials made from gypsum it is a flat panel made from a core of gypsum sandwiched between two layers of paper or fibreglass drywall creates interior walls and ceilings in homes offices and other buildings drywall is easy to install and can be cut to fit any size or shape it is also very costeffective making it a popular choice for use in construction in addition to its fireresistant and soundinsulating properties drywall is also an effective barrier against moisture which helps prevent mould and mildew growth plaster plaster is another popular building material made from gypsum it is a mixture of gypsum powder and water applied to walls and ceilings to create a smooth surface plaster is typically applied in several layers and can be sanded and painted to create a finished look plaster is a very versatile material that can be used to create custom designs and finishes it is also very durable and resistant to wear and tear making it a popular choice in hightraffic areas like hallways and staircases cement gypsum is also used in the production of cement cement is a binding agent used in construction to hold materials like bricks and stones together it is made from a mixture of limestone clay and gypsum which is ground into a fine powder and heated to high temperatures to create a chemical reaction that forms the cement gypsum is used in cement production because it helps regulate the cements setting time making it easier to work with in conclusion gypsum is an essential material in the construction industry due to its numerous unique properties such as fire resistance sound insulation durability versatility and sustainability it is used in various products such as drywall plaster and cement which are commonly used in homes offices and other buildings the use of gypsum in construction has contributed to the creation of safer more comfortable and ecofriendly living spaces as such gypsum will continue to be a vital material in the construction industry for years to come share your home can become the home of your dreams with the promoting strong cement as a discerning user you should have some knowledge of cement especially if you are planning to construct a new house mentioned below are some facts that will help you in selecting the best cement for house construction which cement is best for house construction there are three primary types of cement that are generally used for residential house construction 1 ordinary portland cement opc and 2 portland pozzolana cement ppc and 3 portland slag cement psc opc it is one of the most common types of cement that is used to construct houses it is manufactured via a chemical combination of calcium iron aluminium silicon and other ingredients in highly controlled conditions opc cement that is used in residential construction is available in three different grades 33 grade 43 grade and 53 grade 33 grade this grade of opc cement is predominantly used for smallscale construction wherein the strength of concrete does not really matter for example smallhouse construction 43 grade this grade of cement is used in mediumscaled construction activities wherein strength is needed and the concrete must take loads of weight above it for instance a threefloor house 53 grade this cement grade is used in construction activities wherein an enormous strength of concrete is needed this grade of opc cement is primarily used in mass constructions or special projects rather than house construction let the experts help you select the right material ppc the use of ppc is increasing in present times in house construction because it contains pozzolana materials as its active constituents which successfully impart enhanced properties to this type of cement it is manufactured by using pozzolanic materials as one of the primary constituents the percentage of this material should lie in the range of 1030 in contrast to opc cement ppc cement does not have different grades the eventual strength of ppc cement can be compared to opc 43 grade cement ppc is ideal for house construction because it offers a much better performance in the long term in comparison with opc cement psc portland slag cement or psc is a type of blended cement slag is basically a nonmetallic product that is comprised of more than 90 glass along with silicates as well as aluminosilicates of lime psc is produced with a combination of approximately 4550 of slag 4550 of clinker and 35 of gypsum the chemical composition of psc offers numerous advantages over other types of cement besides being ecofriendly it possesses ultimate compressive strength while offering phenomenal resistance to sulphate and chloride attacks this specific feature improves workability while significantly lowering the risks of cracking it is known for its superior finish and minimised shrinkage cracks psc can be successfully used for all types of residential as well as commercial projects it complements the construction of dams and other waterretaining structures because of its high resistance to alkalisilica reactions and amazingly fewer shrinkage cracks it is also used in special structures such as prestressed concrete because of its excellent resistance power to corrosion it is widely used in coastal regions to summarise when it comes to cement required for house construction both opc and ppc are efficient the only factors that play a definitive role while choosing between the two are the setting time and durability while opc has a low setting time ppc requires more setting time so if you want to get rid of the scaffolding in a lesser time then you should opt for opc 43 or 53 grade cement that said if you are ready and willing to extend this setting time ppc would be your ideal bet the sole advantage that ppc has in comparison with opc is durability home construction executed with ppc cement is much more durable than that with opc cement the final word always remember that the cement you select is of utmost significance because it will eventually determine your homes quality life durability and structural integrity if you require expert guidance you can contact jsw one homes share tiles continue to be one of the most desirable so its important to choose wisely share a wide array of tests is conducted on bricks to ascertain their quality for the purpose of construction brick testing is carried out in the laboratory as well as at the construction site bricks are arguably one of the oldest and most vital construction materials due to their strength reliability and durability the tests that are needed to determine the suitability of bricks for construction work are discussed below 1 absorption test this test is conducted on bricks to know the total amount of moisture that is absorbed by the brick under extreme conditions during this test a dry brick is taken and weighed post weighing the brick is placed in water for 24 hours after this the wet brick is weighed the difference in the weight of the dry brick and the wet brick is calculated which gives the amount of water absorption for a highquality brick the amount of water absorption must not exceed 20 of the dry brick weight 2 crushing or compressive strength test the crushing strength is determined by placing a brick in a compression testing machine that applies pressure on the brick until it breaks the pressure at which the brick shatters should exceed a minimum of 350 nmm2 any value lower than that indicates that the brick is not suitable for construction get an expert consultation on brick selection for your home 3 hardness test the ideal brick must be able to resist any scratches induced by sharp objects so for this specific test a sharp tool or fingernail is used to create scratches on bricks if there are no impressions of any scratches then the brick is considered to be a hard brick 4 shape and size test all bricks used for the purpose of construction must be of identical size when it comes to shape each brick should be rectangular with distinct sharp edges to carry out this test 20 bricks are selected randomly and stacked along their dimensions for comparison if all bricks are of the same size then they are suitable for construction activity 5 soundness test this is another way of testing bricks this test demonstrates the nature of bricks during sudden impact to perform this test two bricks are chosen randomly and struck against each other the bricks should not crack or break and the sound that is produced must be a clear bellringing sound learn how to select the right brick from experts 6 structure of bricks to successfully determine a bricks structure one brick is randomly picked from a group and is broken close attention is paid to the inner portion of the brick the brick must be smooth and free from lumps the final word bricks are the building blocks of any structure there are specific tests that you can subject the bricks to in order to determine if they are fit or unfit for house building a new home or undertaking a renovation project one of the most important decisions youll have to make is what type of cement to use while traditional portland cement is the most widely used option blended cement is quickly becoming a popular choice among builders and homeowners alike this blog will look at blended cement and explain why its the best choice for your home construction 1 blended cement has an improved strength and durability adding materials such as fly ash and slag to the cement mixture increases its compressive and tensile strength making it more resistant to cracking and damage over time this means that buildings constructed with blended cement are less likely to experience structural issues and will have a longer lifespan this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more durable and last longer saving you money in the long run 2 blended cement is also a more costeffective option than traditional portland cement including materials such as fly ash and slag in the cement mixture means that less portland cement is required reducing the cements overall cost additionally blended cement is often more readily available than traditional portland cement which can further reduce costs this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more affordable and costeffective 3 blended cement is a more sustainable and environmentallyfriendly option than traditional portland cement the production of portland cement is a significant contributor to greenhouse gas emissions as it requires high temperatures to produce and releases carbon dioxide blended cement on the other hand is made by mixing traditional portland cement with other materials such as fly ash slag or limestone this reduces the energy required to produce the cement and its carbon footprint by using blended cement youll make a more sustainable choice for your home construction which is better for the environment and future generations 4 in terms of versatility blended cement is a better choice than traditional portland cement blended cement can be tailored to specific needs by adjusting the proportions of the materials used this allows for a broader range of applications this means that blended cement can be used for various construction projects including foundations walls floors and more this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it is more versatile and can be used for many applications want to know more about selecting the right materials get an expert consultation with jsw one homes 5 finally blended cement is also a better choice for the indian construction industry because it is more resistant to the weathering effects of the indian climate the indian climate is characterized by high humidity and extreme temperature fluctuations which can cause traditional portland cement to crack and degrade over time blended cement however is less affected by these weathering effects and is better able to withstand the rigors of the indian climate this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more resistant to the weathering effects of the indian climate making your home more durable and longlasting in conclusion blended cement is more sustainable durable costeffective versatile and weatherresistant than traditional portland cement using blended cement in your home construction can ensure that your building will be stronger more energyefficient and more environmentally friendly with blended cement youll be able to enjoy a home that is built to last and that will stand up to the challenges of the indian climate blended cement is the way to go if youre looking for a highquality longlasting and affordable building material share when it comes to building a custom home choosing the right materials for your countertops is an important decision countertops are one of home construction project share concrete is a mixture of cement coarse and fine aggregates and water it plays a crucial role in building infrastructure the cost of concrete is accredited to these ingredients which are not only expensive but also scarce concrete manufacturing emits a considerable amount of carbon dioxide co2 the pursuit of an alternate material which is economical and sustainable ended with the discovery of ground granulated blastfurnace slag ggbs ggbs is a nonmetallic product obtained as a byproduct from the blast furnaces used to make iron it consists of silicates and aluminates of bases such as calcium blast furnace varies in physical structure and composition depending on the cooling method of the slag it is obtained by the rapid chilling of the molten ash with the help of water the slag is transformed into the glass during this process and eventually refined to the required fineness for the uninformed ggbs is identifiable by its colour conventional portland cement is grey while the ggbs is white in colour there are two methods of using ggbs in concrete you can integrand the ggbs with the cement clinker and gypsum or mix the blast furnace with cement separately apart from that ggbs can also be used as the direct replacement of ordinary portland cement the replacement may vary between 3080 of cement in india generally ggbs is used by adding it to batching plants along with the portland cement water and aggregates uses of ggbs producing portland blast furnace cement pbfc and high slag blast furnace cement hsbfc producing ready mixed concrete used in ready mix concrete plants used in constructing structures which are vulnerable to chloride and sulfate attacks for eg marine and substructures want to know more about selecting the right materials get an expert consultation with jsw one homes advantages of ggbs ggbs concrete has better ultimate strength and a higher proportion of the strengthenhancing calcium silicate hydrates than portland cement concrete it also contains a lesser amount of free lime the other advantages of ggbs include 1 due to reactive silica in ggbs replacing cement with ggbs in concrete mixes enhances the structural performance in terms of strength and durability 2 the reactivity of ggbs with cement offers an increase in the compressive strength for different concrete mixes made with partial replacement of cement by ggbs 3 reduction in the energy consumption in cement manufacturing 4 one tonne of portland cement manufacturing requires around 15 tons of mineral extraction along with 5000 mj of energy and would generate around 095 tons of co2 equivalent in contrast ggbss global warming potential is at 6021 kg co2 equivalent among the lowest in the industry 5 use of ggbs in concrete generates less heat than cement it also helps reduce the hydration heat reducing shrinkage and temperature cracks 6 lesser void hence decreased permeability in concrete 7 increased resistance to sulphate attacks ggbs applications ggbs in combination with portland cement is used to make longlasting structures such as 1 concrete roads and flyovers 2 dams 3 residential houses 4 solution share book a visit now with jsw one homes home building should not be a nightmare for any query related to home building talk to our experts today sublime systems makes lowcarbon cement using electrochemistry instead of heat and combustion to transform minerals into the building material cement the binding ingredient in concrete is the most widely used manufactured materialand its responsible for 8 percent of the worlds carbon emissions to make cement limestone is put in a kiln and heated to 2500 degrees fahrenheit 1400 degrees celsius requiring a huge amount of energy and fossil fuel thats the first way cement production generates carbon dioxide then the heat causes the limestone to decompose emitting yet more of the greenhouse gas sublime has put an ecofriendly spin on the traditional method using an electrochemical approach powered by renewable electricity to break down the minerals the result is a cement powder that reacts with water to gel and harden into the same concrete that has been used for millennia the process can virtually eliminate the carbon dioxide output of cement production on a global scale sublimes technology can resolve the clash between ambitious climate goalsreducing greenhouse gas emissions to zero by 2050 a deadline set by the international energy agencyand the increasing rate of building construction were more urban than weve ever been and the amount of cement we need is staggering said cofounder and ceo leah ellis we dont just have to make green cement now were going to have to make green cement forever cement the binding ingredient in concrete is responsible for 8 percent of the worlds carbon emissions back in 2018 ellis was a postdoctoral fellow at mit studying with inventor and repeat entrepreneur yetming chiang kyocera professor in the department of materials science and engineering chiang got ellis thinking about the growing problem of cement production emissions and the opportunity to decarbonize the industry using increasingly abundant and lowcost renewable energy soon after she and another mit student began working backward from the notion of electrifying cement production to develop a sustainable material that could be costeffective easily scalable and just as durable as traditional cement with support from chiang and investors the idea of designing a zerocarbon cement became a reality and sublime systems was born swift and massive impact on global co2 emissions is the companys goal ellis said sublime raised more than 45 million in funds to accelerate production at its somerville massachusetts plant which can produce up to 250 tons of cement a year as the company scales up productionto 100 tons a day and beyondits looking to take its business international if you look at where the most cement is going to be used in the coming years its places of burgeoning urban populations like india africa and southeast asia green cement also known as sustainable cement is an ecofriendly alternative to traditional portland cement which is responsible for approximately 8 of global carbon dioxide emissions green cement is made from sustainable materials and uses less energy in the production process making it a more environmentally friendly option the use of traditional cement has been a significant contributor to climate change due to its high carbon footprint cement production is responsible for emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere which contributes to the greenhouse effect and global warming however the production of green cement uses up to 40 less energy and produces up to 80 fewer carbon dioxide emissions compared to traditional cement green cement is made from a variety of sustainable materials such as fly ash slag and recycled aggregates which are byproducts of other industries for example fly ash is a waste product of coalfired power plants and slag is a byproduct of iron and steel manufacturing using these materials in the production of green cement not only reduces waste but also reduces the amount of greenhouse gases produced green cement has several applications including use in construction road building and other infrastructure projects the properties of green cement are similar to those of traditional cement and it can be used in a range of applications in fact many of the worlds largest infrastructure projects such as highways bridges and dams have been built using green cement one of the benefits of using green cement is that it can contribute to leed certification for building projects the leadership in energy and environmental design leed certification is a rating system for green buildings and infrastructure projects using sustainable materials such as green cement can contribute to leed certification and help building projects to achieve higher ratings green cement is also costeffective as it is often cheaper to produce than traditional cement this is because the materials used in its production are often waste products from other industries making them readily available and less expensive in conclusion green cement is a sustainable alternative to traditional cement that has numerous benefits it has a lower carbon footprint is made from sustainable materials and is costeffective its applications are numerous and it can contribute to the leed certification of building projects as the world continues to move towards a more sustainable future the use of green cement is likely to increase and become more prevalent in the construction industry to view or industry definition and major segments green cement is an environmentally friendly substitute for conventional cement which is produced utilising industrial byproducts such fly ash blast furnace slag and recovered industrial waste although it is a vital raw material in the construction industry and a powerful binder cement production is one of the main sources of greenhouse gas emissions on the basis of producttypes the industry is classified into fly ashbased slagbased limestonebased silica fumebased based on enduse the market is segmented into residential nonresidential others key regions covered include brazil argentina mexico others market trends rising number of building codes and policies mandating energyefficient structures have led to the growth of green cement in the residential sector with increasing demand for sustainable products and enactment of stringent carbon emission regulations emphasis on developing zero waste regions is increasing furthermore growing awareness among consumers regarding the energy benefits associated with green homes is expected to drive the green cement market in the residential sector over the forecast period the growth in demand for green cement in the commercial segment is due to the increase in its application in commercial establishments such as office spaces shopping malls theaters and hospitals furthermore certain properties of cement such as greater resistance to extreme weather conditions compressive strength and short setting time are expected to boost the industry growth key market players the major players in the market consumption automated blinds motorised window treatments for light control and energy efficiency made from singlecrystal silicon these panels are known for their high efficiency and spaceefficiency they have a uniform black hue and a rounded edge appearance the best monocrystalline solar panels in india tend to perform better in lowlight conditions compared to other types created from multiple silicon crystals hence their name these solar panels in india for home are recognisable by their speckled blue appearance they are costeffective due to their manufacturing process which involves melting raw silicon while slightly less efficient than monocrystalline panels they offer a good balance between cost and performance thinfilm panels use various materials like amorphous silicon cadmium telluride or copper indium gallium selenide deposited in thin layers onto a substrate they are lighter and more flexible allowing for unique applications like curved surfaces or portable solar panels these panels are less efficient in terms of energy conversion but are more costeffective to produce the best solar panels in india for homes can convert sunlight into electricity higher efficiency panels generate more power per square metre when choosing solar panels for your home look for ones with higher efficiency ratings as they can maximise energy production especially if space for installation is limited the best monocrystalline solar panels in india generally offer higher efficiency compared to polycrystalline or thinfilm panels monocrystalline cells are made from single silicon crystals and are known for their efficiency and spacesaving design consider choosing solar panels for your home that have build quality and materials used panels with robust construction and highquality materials tend to last longer look for panels with durable frames tempered glass and weatherresistant coatings to withstand harsh weather conditions solar panels experience reduced efficiency as temperatures rise the temperature coefficient indicates how much the panels efficiency decreases with higher temperatures lower temperature coefficients imply better performance in hot before installation to check if the cement is fresh visually inspect the packaging for damage and look for a uniform grey colour fresh cement feels powdery and freeflowing while stale cement may feel clumpy or have hardened chunks it should have a characteristic earthy smell conduct a small test batch of concrete to observe its setting time ensuring it meets expectations store cement in a cool dry place away from moisture for optimal freshness place a few drops of water on the surface of the wood if the water beads and remains on the surface the wood is likely wellsealed and protected from moisture if the water soaks into the wood quickly it may indicate that it lacks proper sealing and could be prone to rot or decay apply a strip of painters tape firmly onto the painted surface after letting it sit for a few minutes quickly peel off the tape if the paint comes off with the tape it suggests poor adhesion and may require sanding and priming before repainting place a level tool on various parts of the floor or surface to check for evenness if the bubble in the level rests within the marked lines the surface is level uneven surfaces may require additional levelling compounds or adjustments during construction use a voltage tester to ensure electrical outlets are wired correctly and safely check for proper grounding and polarity and ensure the outlets function correctly open and close windows and doors to ensure smooth operation and proper alignment look for any sticking or dragging which may indicate issues with installation or framing use a screwdriver to press against drywall lightly if the drywall feels firm and doesnt give easily its likely wellinstalled soft spots or areas that give easily may indicate improper installation or water damage bamboo construction coimbatore chennai kochi bamboo is a fastgrowing renewable resource that can be used as a structural material its lightweight strong and versatile making it suitable for various construction applications such as roofing flooring and wall panels bamboo construction also offers excellent thermal insulation properties which can help reduce energy consumption for heating and cooling fly ash bricks hyderabad chennai fly ash a byproduct of coal combustion can be used to manufacture bricks these bricks are lightweight durable and require less production energy than traditional clay bricks rapid urbanisation and population growth in cities like hyderabad and chennai have led to a high demand for affordable and sustainable building materials by using fly ash bricks builders can reduce the demand for clay and minimise the environmental impact of brick manufacturing rammed earth construction bangalore salem hubli rammed earth is an ancient building technique that involves compressing layers of earth within a frame to create walls this method utilises locally available soil reducing the need for transportation and minimising carbon emissions bangalore salem and hubli experience relatively dry climates with hot summers and mild winters they absorb heat during the day and release it slowly at night recycled materials all regions incorporating recycled materials into construction can significantly reduce waste and energy consumption for example recycled concrete aggregate can be used instead of virgin aggregate for concrete production reducing the demand for natural resources similarly recycled steel and reclaimed wood can be used for structural elements and interior finishes respectively offering both environmental and aesthetic benefits green roofs bangalore chennai consist of vegetation planted on a waterproof membrane installed atop a building they provide numerous environmental benefits including improved insulation reduced stormwater runoff and enhanced biodiversity green roofs in urban areas like bangalore and chennai can help mitigate the urban heat island effect and improve air quality solar passive design all regions implementing solar passive design principles can optimise energy efficiency and reduce reliance on artificial heating and cooling systems this approach involves orienting buildings to maximise natural light and ventilation utilising shading devices to control solar gain and incorporating thermal mass to moderate indoor temperatures passive solar techniques can effectively reduce energy consumption in regions like coimbatore hyderabad and kochi where sunlight is abundant cavity wall construction with insulated concrete blocks bangalore coimbatore in regions with temperature variations like bangalore and coimbatore cavity wall construction using insulated concrete blocks can help improve thermal performance and energy efficiency insulated concrete blocks feature a layer of insulating material sandwiched between two layers of concrete reducing heat transfer through the walls durability slate is highly durable and can withstand diverse weather conditions making it a reliable choice for the long term heat resistance lighter shades of slate reflect heat reducing indoor temperatures low maintenance slates robust nature requires minimal maintenance cost slate can be expensive to purchase and install weight the heavy weight of slate tiles may require reinforced roof structures heat reflective the light colour of terracotta tiles helps reflect heat keeping interiors cooler aesthetic appeal offers a classic attractive look that complements many architectural styles weather resistant baked terracotta is challenging and can withstand various weather conditions fragility terracotta tiles can be brittle and may break under heavy impact maintenance regular maintenance is required to keep them in good condition affordability concrete tiles are costeffective compared to other materials heat resistance can be treated with reflective coatings to enhance heat resistance durability concrete tiles are robust and durable weight unlike slate concrete tiles are heavy and may require structural support colour fading over time colours may fade due to exposure to sunlight cooling efficiency reflects sunlight effectively reducing cooling costs durability metal roofing is longlasting and requires minimal maintenance lightweight more straightforward to install and does not require reinforced structures cost higher initial cost compared to traditional materials noise can be noisy during rain unless adequately insulated reflective white colour effectively reflects heat and light durability made from durable materials such as ceramic maintenance high maintenance is required to keep tiles clean and reflective staining susceptible to staining which can reduce reflectivity weather resistant designed to withstand extreme weather conditions flexibility suitable for various roof shapes and designs durability longlasting with minimal maintenance installation complexity requires professional installation cost can be expensive depending on the type and membrane quality used energy generation converts solar energy into electricity providing a sustainable energy source aesthetic blends well with traditional roofing materials cost high initial investment for both shingles and installation efficiency efficiency can be lower compared to traditional solar panels heat resistance designed specifically for hot climates reflecting sunlight effectively variety available in various colours and styles durability may not be as durable as other materials like slate or metal maintenance regular maintenance is required to ensure longevity heat reflective reflects more sunlight reducing roof temperatures versatile can be applied to various roofing materials reapplication this may require reapplication over time to maintain effectiveness cost additional cost for coating application insulation excellent insulation capabilities durability resistant to corrosion and extreme weather conditions lightweight reduces the structural load on buildings initial cost polysius green technologies polysius activated clay polysius booster mill polysius pure oxyfuel polysius fuel substitution nox reduction almacenamiento de dixido de carbono en cemento este artculo forma parte de una lista anual de las que a nuestro juicio son las 10 tecnologas emergentes ms importantes la lista completa se puede ver haciendo clic aqu la fabricacin de cemento para hormign consiste en calentar piedra caliza pulverizada arcilla y arena a 1450 c usando un combustible como el carbn o el gas natural el proceso genera una gran cantidad de dixido de carbono la fabricacin de una tonelada mtrica de cemento portland de uso general libera entre 650 y 920 kilogramos de dicho componente los 28 millones de toneladas mtricas de cemento producidas en todo el mundo en 2009 generaron alrededor del 5 por ciento de todas las emisiones de dixido de carbono nikolaos vlasopoulos cientfico jefe en la startup novacem con sede en londres est tratando de eliminar las emisiones con un cemento que absorba ms dixido de carbono del que libere durante su fabricacin logra retener hasta 100 kilogramos de gas de efecto invernadero por tonelada vlasopoulos descubri la receta del cemento de novacem cuando era estudiante de postgrado en el imperial college de londres estaba investigando cementos producidos por la mezcla de xidos de magnesio con cemento portland afirma no obstante al aadir agua a los compuestos de magnesio sin ningn tipo de portland en la mezcla descubri que an as poda hacer un tipo de cemento slido y que no estuviese basado en piedra caliza rica en carbono y a medida que se endureca el dixido de carbono en la atmsfera reaccionaba con el magnesio para crear carbonatos fortalecientes del cemento que al mismo tiempo ayudaban a la captura del gas novacem est en la actualidad refinando la frmula para que el rendimiento mecnico del producto sea igual al del cemento portland ese trabajo afirma vlasopoulos debera estar hecho de aqu a un ao otras nuevas empresas tambin estn tratando de reducir la huella de carbono del cemento incluyendo a calera en los gatos california que ha recibido cerca de 50 millones de dlares en inversiones de riesgo sin embargo los cementos de calera se encuentran actualmente destinados a ser aditivos para el cemento portland en lugar de ser un reemplazo como en el caso de novacem afirma franzjosef ulm director del centro de sostenibilidad del cemento en mit novacem podra as conseguir ventaja en la reduccin de emisiones aunque todas las startups se enfrentan al reto de escalar su tecnologa a niveles industriales sin embargo segn afirma ulm esto no significa que una empresa deba desplazar miles de millones de toneladas de cemento portland para tener xito se puede comenzar por la explotacin de nichos de mercado especializados dentro de la construccin si novacem es capaz de producir 500000 toneladas al ao segn cree vlasopoulos puede alcanzar el mismo precio del cemento portland incluso llegar hasta ese punto va a ser difcil ellos estn introduciendo un material muy nuevo en una industria muy conservadora seala hamlin jennings profesor en el departamento de ingeniera civil y ambiental de la universidad northwestern habr cuestiones que responder novacem comenzar a tratar de persuadir a la industria trabajando con laing orourke la mayor empresa constructora de propiedad privada en el reino unido en 2011 y con 15 millones de dlares en efectivo procedentes de la real sociedad y otras fuentes novacem tiene programado comenzar a construir una nueva planta piloto para fabricar su nueva formulacin de cemento los investigadores se basan en los anillos de los rboles los glaciares y los registros fsiles para situar el clima actual en su contexto por casey crownhart a medida que el aire se vuelve ms limpio el mundo tambin pierde un importante efecto refrigerante por james temple un parque nuclear envejecido an puede contribuir a reducir las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero por casey crownhart ms informacin sobre cambio climtico es un concreto con 3050 menos contenido de carbono incorporado esta solucin utiliza cemento reducido en co2 y tiene un diseo de mezcla optimizado para reducir su huella de carbono con un nivel de reduccin de co2 entre 5070 es un producto tcnicamente ms demandante que proporciona una reduccin significativamente mayor que el estndar general disponible en un mercado determinado con este concreto explotan las posibilidades tcnicas al mximo para ofrecer un producto de primera con una reduccin de co2 mayor al 70 es una combinacin de excelencia tecnolgica en concreto y accin climtica este producto otorga la oportunidad de eliminar hasta el 100 la huella de carbono del concreto y reducir en gran medida la huella de carbono general de las estructuras de concreto dos empresas argentinas lderes se han asociado para construirla primera planta productora de cemento basada en el bajo consumo de energa y en el cuidado del medio ambiente el emprendimiento ecocemento sa tiene adems un ingrediente econmicoambiental ms que interesante este cemento ecolgico tienecomo insumo esencial un residuo la escoria de la industria siderrgicay los resultados de su uso son muy satisfactorios en relacin a otros cementos la nueva planta con capacidad inicial para producir 300000 toneladas anuales demand una inversin de 25 millones de dlares y ocupa un predio de 335 hectreas ubicado en las cercanas de las ciudades de ramallo y san nicols en la provincia de buenos aires uno de sus propietarios es la principal empresa del grupo fortabat loma negra en un 85 el 15 restante pertenece a siderar del grupo techint quien adems estuvo a cargo de la obra el suministro de equipamiento tecnolgico correspondi a la firma dinamarquesa f l smidth loma negra aporta su experiencia en tecnologa de produccin su capacidad de distribucin y la principal materia prima del cemento el clinker que llega a la planta en ferrocarril proveniente de sus fbricas en olavarra y barker provincia de buenos aires por su parte siderar suministra desde su planta lindante con ecocemento la escoria de alto horno un subproducto de la industria siderrgica disminuyendo de este modo la utilizacin de los recursos no renovables y del consumo de energa en relacin al cemento comn el cemento elaborado con escoria de alto horno tiene excelentes caractersticas ya que posee mayor resistencia final y gran durabilidad lo que lo constituye en el producto ms indicado para aquellas obras en las que el hormign puede verse sometido a condiciones agresivas como son los pavimentos las fundaciones los emprendimientos hidrulicos y las estructuras portuarias entre otras cuando se construy el aeropuerto de ushuaia ejemplificaron en ecocemento el cemento debi ser traido desde alemania en el futuro obras deese estilo podrn desarrollarse con cemento argentino otra ventaja es el menor calor de hidratacin con lo cual se evita la fisura por causas de origen trmico aseste cemento resulta ideal para obras masivas por su mayor resistencia a aguas sulfatadas aguas de mar o ataques de cidos ecocemento sa cuenta con el primer molino vertical para la mezcla de cemento de amrica del sur especialmente diseado para la molienda de cementos con y de escoria aplicando tecnologa de punta y logrando con este tipo de equipamiento un menor consumo especfico de energa el proceso que se realiza en esta planta comprende el almacenaje transporte y dosificacin de materias primas como as tambin la molienda el embolsado y despacho del producto final desde loma negra se asegura que el nuevo producto posee un nivel de calidad que excede con holgura los requisitos de la norma iram 1636 superando en muchos aspectos las caractersticas del cemento normal de esta manera afirman loma negra empresa lder en el mercado de cementos de argentina se mantiene a la vanguardia de los procesos productivos de cemento con especiales ventajas competitivas en consumo energtico y proteccin ambiental la presidente de loma negra amalia lacroze de fortabat seal durante el acto de inauguracin de la planta este proyecto se enmarca dentro de una poltica que ha mantenido nuestra empresa cuidar el medio ambiente dentro de los avances tecnolgicos es necesario respetar al hombre las fbricas son algo bello porque crean para el hombre pero no deben transformarse en destructoras de l por eso agreg este emprendimiento es un orgullo para loma negra ya que no slo puede brindar un excelente suministro de cemento con escoria sino que adems brinda una nueva muestra del compromiso ambiental y conciencia ecolgica con los cuales siempre ha encarado sus procesos productivos revista ecologa negocios n 13 tu direccin de correo electrnico no ser publicada los campos obligatorios estn marcados y en ese trnsito el mundo necesitar construir el equivalente a la ciudad de nueva york cada mes empresas como holcim vienen innovando para responder a esa demanda y contribuir a la transicin hacia un futuro incluyente y net zero para afrontar este reto lanz ecoplanet la lnea ms amplia de cemento verde del mundo que permite reducir sus emisiones hasta un 50 por ciento es decir 38 kg de co2 por tonelada de material cementante con un desempeo igual o superior al del cemento tradicional marco maccarelli presidente ejecutivo de holcim colombia explica que ecoplanet ofrece ventajas circulares y de bajas emisiones de carbono al introducir un novedoso sistema de molienda separada reconocido por el ministerio de ciencia tecnologa e innovacin adems cuenta con la descarbonizacin en su proceso de produccin al hacer uso de combustibles alternativos mediante estas acciones damos pasos firmes en nuestra estrategia 2025 acelerando de forma contundente el crecimiento ecolgico precis ecoplanet soluciones ecoinnovadoras que holcim desarrolla desde hace unos aos en 2020 introdujo en el mercado ecopact una amplia y avanzada gama de concreto ecolgico para crear edificaciones sostenibles y de alto desempeo esta lnea con propiedades iguales o superiores a los concretos convencionales aporta a la construccin sostenible y circular ecopact cuenta con una huella de carbono desde 30 por ciento hasta ciento por ciento ms baja en comparacin con el concreto estndar su perfil de sostenibilidad est impulsado por materias primas bajas en emisiones al igual que ecoplanet por la descarbonizacin de sus operaciones incluido el uso de combustibles alternativos esta lnea de concretos cuenta con cuatro presentaciones segn el nivel de reduccin de co2 ecopact 3050 por ciento menos ecopact prime pueden ayudar a disminuir el uso de cemento y reducir las emisiones de co2 lo ramoslas cenizas del bagazo de caa de la cscara de arroz y los residuos de la industria cermica pueden entrar en la preparacin del hormign y disminuir la cantidad de cemento en la elaboracin de ese producto la reduccin del uso y la consiguiente limitacin de su industrializacin constituyen un factor importante para el ambiente pues adems de aprovechar esos materiales que muchas veces son de difcil descarte y reutilizacin contribuyen a disminuir las emisiones de dixido de carbono co2 en la atmsfera la industria cementera es responsable de un 7 de las emisiones de co2 en el mundo segn datos utilizados por el painel intergubernamental de cambios climticos ipcc por su sigla en ingls por cada tonelada t de cemento producido va a parar a la atmsfera 1 t de co2 en brasil ese dato corresponde a 067 t pues parte de la materia prima que se usa en el pas para la produccin de cemento se obtiene con el aprovechamiento de la escoria arcilla separada del material ferroso de los altos hornos de las siderrgicas y la matriz energtica o la energa elctrica gastada en el proceso es renovable proveniente de las hidroelctricas explica el profesor romildo toledo filho de la coordinacin de los programas de posgrado de ingenieras coppe de la universidad federal de ro de janeiro ufrj coordinador del equipo que desarroll estudios para la incorporacin de los residuos al cemento en el 2007 se produjeron 44 millones de t de cemento en brasil que resultaron en 294 millones de t de co2 toledo estima que con la incorporacin de los residuos ser posible reducir las emisiones brasileas en casi 6 millones de t al sustituir un 20 de la produccin de cemento los datos analizados por el grupo del coppe indican la existencia de alrededor de 10 millones de t de residuos disponibles para la utilizacin por parte de la industria del cemento entre 15 y 2 millones son de cenizas de la quema del bagazo de caa que sobran de las calderas y los generadores para la produccin de energa elctrica para el abastecimiento de los propios centrales las cenizas del bagazo son ricas en slice amorfo diferente de la forma cristalina encontrada por ejemplo en la arena en la forma amorfa puede reaccionar a temperatura ambiente con el hidrxido de calcio uno de los productos de hidratacin del cemento esa misma estructura es encontrada en la cscara de arroz calcinada de cada 1t de arroz cosechada sobran 200 kilos de cscara en brasil la produccin alcanz 11 millones de t de arroz en la cosecha 20062007 por ende se produjeron 22 millones de t de cscara tanto la ceniza del bagazo de caa como la de la cscara del arroz para integrar el concreto deben pasar por un proceso de micronizacin en que el material es reducido a partculas mucho menores lo ramosla industria brasilea de cermica produce aproximadamente de 5 a 6 millones de t de residuos en la produccin de tejas ladrillos y pisos ese material despus de calcinado y molido puede sustituir hasta un 20 del total de cemento un estudio especfico sobre el aprovechamiento de los residuos de esa industria fue realizado por el grupo de la coppe y presentado en la edicin de septiembre de 2007 de la revista cientfica cement and concrete research otro producto no aprovechable que surge como alternativa pero alcanza un ndice menor de sustitucin del cemento preocupaciones demostradas tanto en el ipcc como en los mecanismos de desarrollo limpio presentados en el protocolo de kyoto y aparece en momentos en que crece el consumo de cemento en el mundo mil millones de t por ao l saltar para 65 mil millones de t en 50 aos porque es y continuar siendo el material ms usado del mundo en infraestructura dice toledo elemento vinculante el principal los residuos an no tiene perspectivas de ser absorbida por la industria del cemento nuestro trabajo es acadmico y apunta a la bsqueda de soluciones cabe a la industria implementar dichas soluciones la regin sudeste es el mayor centro consumidor de cemento y tambin el mayor productor de residuos en este momento estamos realizando un estudio para identificar las reas productoras de ceniza de bagazo y desde 2017 cornare viene apoyando y supervisando el desarrollo del proyecto de la empresa argos presentado hoy en la maana en medelln con el que la compaa iniciar la fabricacin y distribucin de cemento verde en su planta roclaro proceso que cont con una inversin superior a los usd 78 millones se trata de una actividad en la cual se disminuye el uso del tradicional clnker material base para la elaboracin del cemento gracias a la incorporacin de arcillas activadas trmicamente puzolana artificial lo que hace que el cemento sea ms amigable con el medioambiente con este proyecto estamos siendo protagonistas de la industria y sembrando las semillas del argos del futuro que arranca hoy una nueva lnea de produccin en roclaro pero que tiene un potencial gigantesco de crecimiento en todas las geografas no solo desde el punto de vista del producto sino porque es una accin concreta por la sostenibilidad de nuestra industria explic juan esteban calle presidente de cementos argos por su parte javier parra bedoya director general de cornare manifest su complacencia por el proyecto y expres que se trata de una muestra del ejercicio de la gestin ambiental en la regin y en colombia esta iniciativa de argos hace que se disminuyan los indicadores de impacto en la generacin de energa necesaria para la produccin del cemento y los consumos de agua requeridos por eso felicitamos a la empresa por ese trabajo tan representativo en materia de crecimiento verde puntualiz segn manifest la compaa esta innovacin hace que durante el proceso de produccin se reduzcan hasta 38 las emisiones de co2 y 30 el consumo de energa en comparacin con el estndar de la industria para el tradicional cemento portland tambin indicaron que este nuevo producto mantiene la calidad y el desempeo que siempre los ha caracterizado la empresa argos especficamente la planta roclaro ha venido evidenciando un importante liderazgo en el uso de combustibles alternativos y bsqueda de sustitutos de sus materias primas con el fin de disminuir los impactos ambientales generados en el desarrollo de su actividad productiva y realizar un aporte a la sostenibilidad a travs de la disposicin final de algunos residuos slidos acciones que cornare como autoridad ambiental ha venido validando y controlando permanentemente esta y otras iniciativas de la empresa como el coprocesamiento de llantas es decir la sustitucin parcial del combustible convencional por un residuo llantas y el reciente licenciamiento ambiental para el coprocesamiento de residuos peligrosos en 2019 son para cornare motivo de satisfaccin y reconocimiento toda vez que su proceso productivo se desarrolla desde el cumplimiento de los estndares medioambientales ms exigentes con la implementacin de las tecnologas ms limpias e innovadoras y aportan al desarrollo socioeconmico de la regin a las urbes popularmente se les llama junglas de concreto pero de verde tienen poco hoy en da el desarrollo de cemento ecolgico podra institucional y polticas activas por parte de los diferentes gobiernos definitions and scopes from standards initiatives and policies around the world authors ali hasanbeigi and adam sibal the cement and concrete industry is one of the most energy and carbonintensive industries worldwide the cement industry accounts for around 7 of global co2 emissions with a global production volume of 41 billion tonnes of cement and 140 billion m3 of concrete produced in 2020 in the concrete production process the creation of cement is responsible for approximately 88 of the co2 emissions through the direct emissions in the calcination step and fuel combustion demand growth is anticipated in the sector globally despite a slowdown in many countries including china as demand in developing nations continues to grow since 2015 the emissions intensity of cement production has increased globally despite slowing slightly to a 1 increase in 2022 the iea estimates that the emissions intensity of cement production needs to reverse its current trend and see an annual emissions intensity decrease of 4 through 2030 to remain on track for the world to reach the target of the paris climate agreement in decarbonizing the global cement and concrete industry standards protocols initiatives and government policies have a significant role to play in recent years major growth has been seen in the number of standards protocols initiatives and policies focused on decreasing the emissions from cement and concrete production an additional level of complexity is introduced into the current efforts to decarbonize the cement and concrete industry whereby the standards protocols initiatives and policies tend to focus on either the producers of cement and concrete the demand side of cement and concrete procurement the finance and funding side or some combination thereof however through the sheer number of standards protocols initiatives and policies and the variation and complexity in features target audience assessment boundaries targets pathways requirements reporting certifications and validation procedures there has not yet been a cohesive report that compiles the information in one place to support industry government and other stakeholders in achieving the goal to decarbonize the cement and concrete industry in this report what are green cement and concrete we aim to address this information gap and bring together a summary of the current major standards protocols initiatives and government policies focused on reaching the goal of greenlowcarbon cement and concrete production and decarbonization of this sector additionally we provide a clear indication of whether a standard initiative or policy directs its focus on the cement and concrete producers the demand side of cement and concrete procurement andor the finance and funding sectors we assessed five different standards and protocols eg wris ghg protocols for cement climate bonds initiatives criteria for climate bonds for the cement and concrete industry fifteen different initiatives and benchmarks eg industrial deep decarbonization initiative iddi science based target initiative for cement sbti first movers coalition initiative and the concretezero initiative and several selected policies from some of the worlds largest cement and concrete producing countriesregions ie the eu us china india japan south korea and canada we also review the whole lifecycle building embodied carbon policies currently enacted in various countries us states and cities we additionally present a firstofitskind crosscomparison matrix that compiles the currently disaggregated standards protocols initiatives and policies key information into one table to aid industry government nongovernment organizations and academia in quickly comparing major standards protocols initiatives and policies that are currently in place or soontobereleased at the time of writing this report this indepth review of the global standards protocols and initiatives related to the decarbonization of the global cement and concrete industry also investigates the cement and concrete market focus areas table 1 each of these is discussed in detail in the body of this report table 1 summary of the focus of the current cement and concrete industry standards protocols and initiatives as can be seen in the table there are a significant number of standards protocols and initiatives that focus on cement and concrete producers and to a significantly lesser extent on the demand and finance side additionally we find that there is a lack of agreement on the definition of green cement and concrete across the standard initiative and policy landscape the current lack of agreement may lead to confusion in the market for both producers and consumers of cement and concrete as well as policymakers about what greenlow carbon cement and concrete are a summary comparison of the definitions adopted by various standards protocols initiatives and policies is summarized in table 2 for cement and figure 1 for concrete table 2 emissions intensity definition for cement as stated by standards protocols initiatives and policies with stated numerical quantity targets figure 1 emissions intensity definition for concrete at varied compressive strengths for standard high early strength and lightweight mixes as stated by standards protocols initiatives and policies with stated numerical quantity targets lightweight and high earlystrength concretes are denoted with dashed lines for cement these definitions also differ in that only the iea and iddi who adopted the iea framework consider the clinker ratio utilized iea classification of green cement set one of the lowest co2 intensity levels compared to other standards and initiatives for concrete the first movers coalition has set the most ambitious targets for lowcarbon concrete followed closely by the concretezero initiative the california buy clean program if formally signed into law will utilize the first movers coalitions definition and would be the most ambitious lowcarbon concrete emissions intensity requirement it should be noted however that the lowest definitions of lowcarbon concrete adopted by concrete zero targets 30 50 and 100 of concrete procurement under this threshold by 2025 2030 and 2050 respectively while the first movers coalition requires 10 of the procurement to fall under their target values while other requirements apply to all procurement additionally of the definitions of low carbon concrete all of the standards initiatives and policies have adopted a stepwise emissions intensity increase as compressive strength increases except for concretezero also shown in figure 1 many of the policy requirements for procurement of low carbon concrete set by the us general services administration and inflation reduction act ira requirements and those of many state and county levels policies follow closely with or exceed the us national average concrete emissions intensities additionally some standards protocols initiatives and policies have no set target number stated others such as the science based targets initiative climate action 100 and concrete sustainability council utilize a relative approach to an industry baseline some align closer with the paris agreements 15 c target while others do not there are also apparent differences in the disclosure requirements and verification processes across the board this report also finds that the policies of the worlds major cement and concreteproducing countries vary significantly for example the us canada and japan have stated targets of obtaining net zero cement and concrete production by 2050 and china by 2060 india has a goal to reach carbon neutrality in 2070 to obtain these goals individual nations can drive down their cement and concrete industry emissions by implementing green public procurement gpp programs with emissions intensity thresholds for the cement and concrete they procure as is being done currently in the us and many of its states california new york and colorado with planned gpp programs more broadly in development in canada for cement and concrete we find that in many of the nations assessed in this study the primary emissions reduction policies are being carried out through energy efficiency legislation as seen in india japan south korea and china nations can additionally implement other policies and regulations andor incentive programs to lower their cement and concrete production emissions intensities through the adoption of technologies and measures such as material efficiency fuel switching to lownocarbon fuels decreasing clinker ratios increased utilization of supplemental cementitious materials and ccus upon completing a thorough analysis of the various cement and concrete industry decarbonization standards protocols initiatives and policies the following four key focus areas were identified as crucial to meeting paris agreement goals and decarbonizing the cement and concrete industry 1 a standard protocol initiative or policy should be aligned with the paris agreement 15c target deep decarbonization of the cement and concrete industry is crucial to achieving the paris agreement target 2 standards protocols initiatives and policies should consider scope 1 2 and 3 emissions and provide clear boundary definitions for the calculation of their emissions guidelines this will allow the industry to move forward consistently in achieving the deep decarbonization targets 3 definitions of greenlow carbon cement and concrete should be harmonized to limit confusion for producers consumers and policymakers 4 the reliability and availability of product and plantlevel data should be increased which will be very important to continue to monitor the progress of the industry and help in the identification of areas for approvement to achieve deep decarbonization it should be noted that cement and concrete companies and plants and most governments collect and have all the data needed to comply with the requirements of the standards protocols initiatives and policies listed in this report although such data and information may not be publicly available our study shows that there are several standards and protocols and many initiatives and policies related to the decarbonization of the cement and concrete industry these standards protocols initiatives and government policies often serve different purposes and address different segments or aspects of the cement and concrete value chain some target the demand side while others target the supply side of the cement and concrete value chain some may be targeted toward the finance community while some are for green public procurement policies therefore it may not be possible to only have one standard for all purposes these initiatives and policies are trying to serve in addition given the different contexts in which the cement and concrete industry operates in different countries it is impractical to assume that a single standard would be used in all countries for all purposes around the world instead we may need a few highquality standards and protocols that are aligned with each other as much as possible it is imperative that these few standards and protocols communicate and coordinate with each other to align their requirement and reduce the burden on the cement and concrete industry and other stakeholders such as policy makers as much as possible also it is critical to bring developing countries perspectives into decarbonization standards and initiatives in chapter 2 of this report we present a firstofitskind crosscomparison matrix that compiles the currently disaggregated standards protocols initiatives and policies key information into one table to help industry government nongovernment organizations and other stakeholders quickly compare major standards protocols initiatives and policies currently in place or soon to be released at the time of writing this report this crosscomparison matrix is followed by an emissions boundary comparison figure comparing the emissions boundary of several standards and initiatives to read the full report and see complete results and analysis of this new study download the full report from the link
