publications grant quasha ceo of eco material technologies at one of the companys manufacturing facilities picture the pantheon in rome considering that it was built in ce 128 it has held together remarkably well under the footsteps of hundreds of millions of visitors over the centuries if the ancient romans could build something so longlasting why on earth do our modern roads have so many potholes the answer lies in the romans ingenious selfhealing concretethe science of which was recently revealed by researchers at mit now a team out of texas and utah eco material technologies is building on ancient romes knowhow with advances in modern material science to create a strong erosionresistant and quicksetting concrete that practically eliminates carbon emissions associated with what has always been known as a hardtoabate industry eco material technologies is a hightech cement companya combination of words that seems incongruous but is nonetheless completely appropriate the company has a goal of reducing and eventually eliminating the 8 of global carbon emissions stemming from the production of cement which acts as the key ingredient in our civilizations most important building material concrete eco material was cofounded by john t prestona respected leader from mits licensing officeis led by grant quashaa harvardeducated businessman with a deep history in materials businessesand received funding from a consortium of smartmoney private equity players the companys technology allows for what would otherwise be hazardous landfill materialthe ash waste of coalfired power plantsto be treated in such a way as to create a strong durable and quicksetting cement that has already proven itself on the sundrenched highways of texas the amazing thing about eco materials technology from a climate perspective is that it avoids virtually all the carbon emissions related to manufacturing cementa big win in the fight to restore our planets carbon cycle imbalance if this sounds like a company you would like to invest in hold on quasha expects the firm to ipo within the next few years eco material was formed in 2022 the product of a bold privateequity backed buyout of the north american assets of australian firm boral ltdan operation with decades of history in the statesby an innovative texas startup called green cement green cement had been developing low and zerocarbon cement technology for over a decade the private equity groups involved in the buyout are smart money playersone equity partners formerly part of jp morgan and global private equity giant warburg pincus green cements ceo at the time of eco materials founding grant quasha is a harvard grad twice over and is a seasoned executive with deep experience in materials and in infrastructure investing the boral assets that quashas venture acquired were focused on the management and harvesting of fly asha byproduct of the coal combustion process that has long been used as a component of many concrete blends borals history goes back decades and you can think of it as the old economy pillar of the eco material house the green cement side of the business was cofounded in 2010 by john t preston a venture capitalist and entrepreneur who previously ran technology licensing at mit and worked there as the interface between research and industry for 30 years preston has said that he has founded something like 300 companies and that he believed the concept and impact of green cement was so attractive he became ceo of the company at its founding the green cement part of the business forms eco materials hightech pillar the merger of green cement and borals north american assets was also partly funded by the issuance of a green bond based on eco material technologys ability to reduce cementrelated carbon emissions to appreciate the astounding breakthrough made by eco material its helpful to understand something about cement in general you can think of cement as something like powdered glue civil engineers call it a binding agent mix that powdered glue with sand and pebbles known as aggregates in the business and add water and you create a very handy synthetic stone that can be poured like gravy in any shape you like this moldable synthetic stone is so handy that it has its own name concrete concrete you might be surprised to learn is the second most widely used substance on earth after h2o the most widely used binding material for concrete today is something known as ordinary portland cement opc there are two important things to know about opc first it is a very old technologyit was first invented around the time george washington was cutting down cherry trees second it is a very dirty technology from a carbon footprint perspective for reasons i discuss in the climate impact section below eco material has discovered an improved way to manufacture a lowcarbon pozzolanic cement that is similar but better than the pozzolanic cement the ancient romans used pozzolans are a broad class of materials containing silica and alumina the most commonly available commercial source of pozzolans is the fly ash that borals business specialized in by themselves and without special treatment pozzolans like fly ash possess almost no value as a cement component however one of the waste byproducts of the opc manufacturing process is a compound that turns fly ash into a strong durable cement when mixed with water as such fly ash has long been mixed with opc to increase the durability of concrete produced with it the carbon footprint of the pozzolanic portion of opc is zero so if you add 10 fly ash to opc you decrease the opcs carbon footprint by 10 one problem with adding fly ash is that there is only so much waste within opc to react with so the maximum amount of zerocarbon pozzolans able to be added to opc was typically around 20 percent old roman cement used 100 pozzolans mined from volcanoes using a different manufacturing process the problem with that type of pozzolanic cement is that it takes a long time to curethat might have been okay for people without cars or email like emperor octavian but is not great for modern builders the big innovation pioneered by green cement and taken up now by eco material is a proprietary physical and chemical pretreatment of fly ash that turns it into an excellent powdered glue and thus allows it to make up a much larger proportion of cement the company says that using its special process the proportion of fly ash in cement can increase to between 50 and 100 percent increasing the proportion of fly ash in cement mixtures by this much generates an enormous reduction of the carbon footprint of infrastructure projects using concretehighways airports buildings docks etc as the amount of fly ash increases the concrete created with it is less water permeable making it more durable and resistant to road salt and other erosive chemicals in an industry not usually associated with technological innovation eco materials product represents nothing less than a stepchange revolution eco materials innovation with regards to reduced carbon footprints should be obvious from the discussion above but its fly ash harvesting business also enables impressive environmental benefits as well on the climate side roughly 8 of global carbon dioxide emissions come from cement manufacturing opc is created by superheating limestone caco3usually by burning coaluntil its chemical bonds crack and the resultant chemicals combine with other compounds to form the powdered glue we know as cement burning coal to heat the limestone actually generates only about half the carbon dioxide that cracking the limestone does as such even if heating the limestone could be done by a cleaner fuel which is something like impossible the very process of creating opc would still create huge amounts of carbon dioxide currently opc manufacturing results in approximately one ton of co2 emissions for every ton of cement produced no heating is involved in the manufacturing of eco materials green cement so no coal or other fossil fuels need to be burned the use of fly ash as a feedstock eliminates the need to use limestone at all let alone to superheat it the result of eco materials innovation is that the company can manufacture a cement for use in strong durable concrete that can reduce the carbon footprint associated with its production by an amazing 99 considering the large footprint of cement manufacturing and the ubiquity of concrete in building projects the world over this large of a reductionif the process could be scaled and propagated globally as an industry best practicewould have a four times greater carbon footprint effect than the complete abolition of air travel eco materials technology also confers some impressive ecological and public safety benefits as well eco material is mining ash that otherwise would simply sit in landfills until the end of time and putting it to productive use as such it is turning a linear industrial revolution paradigm model into a circular one coalfueled power plants burn coal and create electricity co2 and ash more than 2 billion tons of ash have been disposed in the united states in landfills sometimes these ash reservoirs burst as happened disastrously in tennessee in 2008 so communities do not like them in their backyards electricity generators are under steadily increasing regulatory scrutiny regarding these ash ponds and landfills which means steadily increasing operating costs for them eco materials boral acquisition gives it the ability to source fly ash from existing coalfueled power plants and to harvest previously disposed ash at utility sites for instance eco material just announced an expanded partnership with georgia power to remove millions of tons of fly ash from two of their landfills for use in concrete thereby permanently removing the ash from a disposal setting to manufacture the most important building material of the modern age this arrangement is good for georgia power good for the health of the communities near the disposal sites and once the ash is turned into green cement good for the planet as well eco materials main product line is a legacy of the boral purchase that supplies fly ash from coalfueled power plants to concrete producers nationwide through this activity eco material calculates that it has brought about carbon reductions in the concrete sector on the order of 6 million tons per year for decades the green cement part of the business adds significant intellectual property to the process and allows for fly ash to be processed in a way that paves the way to a 100 opc replacement eco material has been bringing the cost of production down with years of research and development so now a cement that is 50 comprised of fly ash which the company calls pozzoslag is priced the same as unalloyed opc because of the greenhouse gas reduction discussed above projects that eco material has already done with the department of transportation in my old home state of texashave generated half the carbon footprint they would have 20 years ago simply because they used explore all categories blending traditional and modern styles in indian home construction going green and sustainability have become more than just buzzwords its a way of business that pays off climate change and pollution are exerting an overarching impact on the earths socioeconomic and ecosystems but what does it mean to go green or ecofriendly and how important is the sustainability quotient when using construction materials for home construction these days sustainability is essentially making something that lasts long it improves the quality of life protects the ecosystem and is a key to a better future the primary idea behind using sustainable building materials is to construct a structure that lasts a longerlasting structure or home means lower maintenance costs the idea of sustainable construction integrates a variety of strategies during the design construction and operation of the building concrete is a building material that is used the most in any construction most of the infrastructure in the world has been built using concrete in some or the other form the chemical processes that convert limestone into calcium oxide are the major cause of the co2 emissions as per the reports traditional cement production of 42 billion tons amounts to about 8 of the global co2 emissions this number can be reduced to a significant extent by replacing the traditional cement with green cement roughly 60 less thermal energy is consumed in green cement production than the ordinary portland cement it also reduces the urban heat island effect by increasing the concrete reflectivity green cement uses a carbonnegative process of manufacturing the major raw materials used to produce green cement include mostly the discarded waste from the industry the slag from the blast furnace and fly ash are the chief materials used in the manufacturing of green cement this is also the reason why the cost of green cement is way less than traditional cement want to know more about selecting the right materials get an expert consultation with jsw one homes types of green cement geopolymer cement also called alkaliactivated cement geopolymer cement is made by reacting aluminate and silicatebearing materials with activators like fly ash or slag from iron and metal production it is the most suitable substitute for ordinary portland cement opc and emits 95 less co2 calcium sulfoaluminate cement csa this cement is produced by burning csa clinker from limestone bauxite and calcium sulfate at around 1250 degrees celsius and blending the clinker with 1525 gypsum because of its early strength development the setting time of this kind of cement is rapid it is known for its remarkable performance in aggressive exposure conditions magnesium oxychloride cement sorel cement or magnesium oxychloride cement is manufactured from the aqueous reaction between the two byproducts of magnesium mining namely magnesium oxide powder and a concentrated solution of magnesium chloride although moc has excellent mechanical properties its poor water resistance reduces its strength however that can be offset by using additives like fly ash sequestrated carbon cement this cement is made by using seawater and brine compounded with co2 in the manufacturing process the gases that consist of co2 are filtered through seawater the compressive strength of concrete with sequestration of co2 gas is higher than that of concrete without sequestration ekkomaxx cement ekkomaxx cement is a rigorously engineered cement with better durability corrosion resistance higher early strength development improved volume stability and low retained moisture as per the united states green building council this cement has nearly zero carbon footprint ferrocrete ferrocrete or ferrocement is a relatively thin structural composite material made by switching layers of welded steel wire meshes and cement mortar ferrocement is a widely used cement alternative in the construction industry due to low selfweight lack of skilled workers and no need for a framework cement is largely the most essential resource for constructing homes however cement manufacturing is extremely energy intensive and contributes significantly to the global warning which needs immediate cutback in this endeavor the implementation of green production practices and technologies in the cement sector is imperative for india because the country is the second biggest producer worldwide when choosing building materials it is also important to consider the lifespan of the material a good design is achievable only with quality materials and hence materials are the solution to a good functioning building at jsw cement is produced from the slag produced during the steelmaking process slag is extremely effective in reducing permeability and adds to the concrete durability this can replace 7080 of ordinary portland cement in most constructions jsw green cement is indias first cement to receive the coveted green pro certification for portland slag cement from the confederation of indian industry indian green building council construction is responsible for a substantial amount of material and energy consumption there are so many ecofriendly materials in construction available these days long dismissed for being costlier the myth has finally started to bust and green materials sustainable energy solutions importance of choosing the right solar panels for optimal efficiency and costeffectiveness efficiency different types of solar panels for home have varying efficiencies in converting sunlight into electricity higher efficiency panels generate more electricity per square metre and are ideal for homes with limited roof space durability and longevity when it comes to solar panel manufacturers in india highquality panels are built to last and withstand various weather conditions choosing reputable solar panel companies in india with longer warranties ensures longevity and reliability costeffectiveness while higher efficiency solar panels often come with a higher initial cost they can result in greater longterm savings by producing more electricity over their lifespan its essential to consider the balance between upfront cost and longterm savings adaptability and aesthetics some types of solar panels are designed for specific roof or aesthetic preferences choosing panels that suit your roof structure and design preferences can enhance the overall appeal of your home installation and maintenance choosing solar panels for home that are easier to install and require minimal maintenance can save you time and additional costs in the long run how solar panels work photon absorption sunlight consists of tiny particles called photons when sunlight hits different types of solar panels the panels photovoltaic cells typically made of silicon absorb these photons electron excitation when the photons are absorbed they transfer their energy to the electrons in the silicon atoms of the solar cells this energy absorption excites the electrons causing them to break free from their atoms electric field generation the structure of the best solar panels in india for homes has an electric field across the layers of silicon this field acts as a force that drives the loose electrons towards a particular direction creating a flow of electricity electrical conductors conductive metal plates within different types of solar panels capture these moving electrons forming an electric current this current is then drawn out of the solar panel via metal conductors to be used as electricity inverter conversion the electricity generated by the solar panels is in direct current dc form which is converted into alternating current ac by an inverter ac is the standard form of electricity used in homes and businesses utilisation or storage the converted ac electricity can be used to power devices and appliances in the home or can be stored in batteries for later use especially when sunlight is not available such as during nighttime different types of solar panels available in the indian market monocrystalline solar panels polycrystalline also known as multicrystalline solar panels thinfilm solar panels factors to consider when buying solar panels efficiency rating type of solar cells durability and build quality temperature coefficient contact us for the best consultation warranty and performance guaranteepay attention to warranties offered by manufacturers a longer warranty especially for performance indicates the manufacturers confidence in their products durabilityperformance warranties ensure that the panel will produce a certain percentage of its rated power over time testing and certificationlook for certifications and testing compliance such as iec international electrotechnical commission certifications ul underwriters laboratories listings or certifications from local regulatory bodiescertified panels often undergo rigorous testing for performance and safety standards degradation ratesolar panels degrade over time losing efficiency gradually the degradation rate indicates how much efficiency is lost per yearlower degradation rates mean the panels will maintain higher efficiency levels for a longer period compatibility and system designensure that the panels you choose are compatible with energyefficient and comfortable living spaces with that in mind heres a personalised guide for individual home builders helping you understand construction materials to achieve cooler homes before selecting construction materials its essential to understand the climate of the region where the home will be built india experiences a range of climates from hot and humid in coastal areas to hot and dry in desert regions and temperate in hilly areas materials should be tailored to the specific environment to optimise thermal comfort insulation materials insulation is crucial in keeping homes cool in hot climates by minimising heat transfer from outside to inside consider materials with high thermal resistance rvalue such as expanded polystyrene eps foam extruded polystyrene xps foam or mineral wool these materials can be installed in walls roofs and floors to reduce heat gain and loss have queries get a consultation from our experts reflective roofing materials roofs can absorb significant solar heat in hot climates making the interior spaces uncomfortably warm opt for reflective roofing materials such as white tiles cool roof coatings or metal sheets with reflective coatings these materials reflect solar radiation instead of absorbing it keeping the roof surface and the interior cooler natural ventilation incorporate materials and design features that promote natural ventilation allowing cool air to flow through the home and flush out hot air use breathable wall finishes operable windows louvres and ventilated facades to facilitate cross ventilation and promote air circulation high thermal mass materials materials with high thermal mass such as concrete stone or clay can help regulate indoor temperatures by absorbing heat during the day and releasing it slowly at night incorporate these materials strategically in the building envelope such as in walls or floors to stabilise indoor temperatures and reduce the need for mechanical cooling green building materials consider using ecofriendly and sustainable materials with natural insulating properties and low embodied energy examples include bamboo straw bales rammed earth and compressed earth blocks these materials help keep homes more relaxed contribute to environmental conservation and reduce carbon footprint shading devices use shading devices such as overhangs pergolas awnings and trellises to block direct sunlight from entering windows and doors especially on the south and westfacing facades choose materials for shading devices that provide adequate solar protection while allowing diffused natural light to enter the interior spaces centrally placed courtyards position courtyards centrally within the home layout to maximise cross ventilation and airflow courtyards act as natural air wells drawing in cool air from the surrounding spaces and facilitating air movement throughout the interior design the home with taller openings or skylights around the courtyard to encourage the stack effect where warm air rises and escapes through vents or openings at higher levels creating a natural cooling effect and improving air circulation proper siting and orientation consider the homes orientation and relationship to the suns path throughout the day orient the building to maximise natural shading and ventilation opportunities use landscaping elements such as trees shrubs and green roofs to provide additional shading and improve microclimate conditions around the home integrating water bodies thoughtful landscaping and centrally placed courtyards into home design allows individual builders to create cooler more comfortable living environments that promote passive cooling energy efficiency and connection with nature these design strategies enhance thermal comfort and contribute to sustainable and resilient homes that harmonise with their surroundings make the smart choice for your next construction project contact jsw one homes today to learn more about our the climate you live in choose the right finish the finish you choose for your wooden flooring is also important a good finish will help protect the wood from moisture and humidity and keep it looking beautiful for years to come oilbased finishes are a popular choice for wooden flooring in india as they provide a protective layer on the wood and prevent it from absorbing moisture maintain the humidity levels in your home maintaining the humidity levels in your home is crucial for the longevity of your wooden flooring the humidity levels should be between 3555 to prevent swelling and warping of the wooden planks investing in a dehumidifier can help regulate the humidity levels in your home additionally it is essential to avoid spilling liquids on the wooden flooring and to clean up any spills immediately to prevent damage regular maintenance regular maintenance is key to keeping your wooden flooring looking beautiful for years to come sweeping or vacuuming the floors regularly can prevent dirt and debris from accumulating and scratching the surface of the wood it is also important to avoid dragging heavy furniture across the wooden flooring as this can cause scratches and damage to the surface using furniture pads or coasters can help prevent this in conclusion wooden flooring can work in india with proper care and maintenance choosing the right type of soft sulfate mineral composed of calcium sulfate dihydrate with the chemical formula caso42h2o gypsum is abundant worldwide and it is mined and processed to create a wide range of products used in construction including drywall plaster and cement gypsum has several unique properties that make it an ideal material for use in construction here are some of the main reasons why gypsum is used in your home construction fire resistance one of the essential properties of gypsum is its fire resistance gypsum contains water molecules in its crystal structure which helps it to resist high temperatures and prevent the spread of flames this makes gypsum an ideal material for walls and ceilings where fire resistance is a critical factor sound insulation gypsum is also an excellent sound insulator its porous structure helps to absorb sound waves and reduce noise levels making it an ideal material for use in walls and ceilings to create a quieter and more comfortable living environment durability gypsum is a very durable material that can withstand much wear and tear it is resistant to mould mildew and pests making it less likely to require repairs or replacements this makes it a costeffective and longlasting material for use in construction versatility gypsum is a very versatile material that can be used in various applications it can be moulded into different shapes and sizes to create custom designs and painted or textured to create different finishes this makes it a popular choice for residential and commercial construction sustainability gypsum is a natural material that can be recycled and reused it is also nontoxic and safe for human use which makes it a sustainable and ecofriendly choice for use in construction want to know more about selecting the right materials get an expert consultation with jsw one homes now that we have covered some of the reasons why gypsum is used in home construction lets take a closer look at some of the specific products made from gypsum drywall drywall also known as gypsum board or plasterboard is one of the most common building materials made from gypsum it is a flat panel made from a core of gypsum sandwiched between two layers of paper or fibreglass drywall creates interior walls and ceilings in homes offices and other buildings drywall is easy to install and can be cut to fit any size or shape it is also very costeffective making it a popular choice for use in construction in addition to its fireresistant and soundinsulating properties drywall is also an effective barrier against moisture which helps prevent mould and mildew growth plaster plaster is another popular building material made from gypsum it is a mixture of gypsum powder and water applied to walls and ceilings to create a smooth surface plaster is typically applied in several layers and can be sanded and painted to create a finished look plaster is a very versatile material that can be used to create custom designs and finishes it is also very durable and resistant to wear and tear making it a popular choice in hightraffic areas like hallways and staircases cement gypsum is also used in the production of cement cement is a binding agent used in construction to hold materials like bricks and stones together it is made from a mixture of limestone clay and gypsum which is ground into a fine powder and heated to high temperatures to create a chemical reaction that forms the cement gypsum is used in cement production because it helps regulate the cements setting time making it easier to work with in conclusion gypsum is an essential material in the construction industry due to its numerous unique properties such as fire resistance sound insulation durability versatility and sustainability it is used in various products such as drywall plaster and cement which are commonly used in homes offices and other buildings the use of gypsum in construction has contributed to the creation of safer more comfortable and ecofriendly living spaces as such gypsum will continue to be a vital material in the construction industry for years to come share your home can become the home of your dreams with the promoting strong cement as a discerning user you should have some knowledge of cement especially if you are planning to construct a new house mentioned below are some facts that will help you in selecting the best cement for house construction which cement is best for house construction there are three primary types of cement that are generally used for residential house construction 1 ordinary portland cement opc and 2 portland pozzolana cement ppc and 3 portland slag cement psc opc it is one of the most common types of cement that is used to construct houses it is manufactured via a chemical combination of calcium iron aluminium silicon and other ingredients in highly controlled conditions opc cement that is used in residential construction is available in three different grades 33 grade 43 grade and 53 grade 33 grade this grade of opc cement is predominantly used for smallscale construction wherein the strength of concrete does not really matter for example smallhouse construction 43 grade this grade of cement is used in mediumscaled construction activities wherein strength is needed and the concrete must take loads of weight above it for instance a threefloor house 53 grade this cement grade is used in construction activities wherein an enormous strength of concrete is needed this grade of opc cement is primarily used in mass constructions or special projects rather than house construction let the experts help you select the right material ppc the use of ppc is increasing in present times in house construction because it contains pozzolana materials as its active constituents which successfully impart enhanced properties to this type of cement it is manufactured by using pozzolanic materials as one of the primary constituents the percentage of this material should lie in the range of 1030 in contrast to opc cement ppc cement does not have different grades the eventual strength of ppc cement can be compared to opc 43 grade cement ppc is ideal for house construction because it offers a much better performance in the long term in comparison with opc cement psc portland slag cement or psc is a type of blended cement slag is basically a nonmetallic product that is comprised of more than 90 glass along with silicates as well as aluminosilicates of lime psc is produced with a combination of approximately 4550 of slag 4550 of clinker and 35 of gypsum the chemical composition of psc offers numerous advantages over other types of cement besides being ecofriendly it possesses ultimate compressive strength while offering phenomenal resistance to sulphate and chloride attacks this specific feature improves workability while significantly lowering the risks of cracking it is known for its superior finish and minimised shrinkage cracks psc can be successfully used for all types of residential as well as commercial projects it complements the construction of dams and other waterretaining structures because of its high resistance to alkalisilica reactions and amazingly fewer shrinkage cracks it is also used in special structures such as prestressed concrete because of its excellent resistance power to corrosion it is widely used in coastal regions to summarise when it comes to cement required for house construction both opc and ppc are efficient the only factors that play a definitive role while choosing between the two are the setting time and durability while opc has a low setting time ppc requires more setting time so if you want to get rid of the scaffolding in a lesser time then you should opt for opc 43 or 53 grade cement that said if you are ready and willing to extend this setting time ppc would be your ideal bet the sole advantage that ppc has in comparison with opc is durability home construction executed with ppc cement is much more durable than that with opc cement the final word always remember that the cement you select is of utmost significance because it will eventually determine your homes quality life durability and structural integrity if you require expert guidance you can contact jsw one homes share tiles continue to be one of the most desirable so its important to choose wisely share a wide array of tests is conducted on bricks to ascertain their quality for the purpose of construction brick testing is carried out in the laboratory as well as at the construction site bricks are arguably one of the oldest and most vital construction materials due to their strength reliability and durability the tests that are needed to determine the suitability of bricks for construction work are discussed below 1 absorption test this test is conducted on bricks to know the total amount of moisture that is absorbed by the brick under extreme conditions during this test a dry brick is taken and weighed post weighing the brick is placed in water for 24 hours after this the wet brick is weighed the difference in the weight of the dry brick and the wet brick is calculated which gives the amount of water absorption for a highquality brick the amount of water absorption must not exceed 20 of the dry brick weight 2 crushing or compressive strength test the crushing strength is determined by placing a brick in a compression testing machine that applies pressure on the brick until it breaks the pressure at which the brick shatters should exceed a minimum of 350 nmm2 any value lower than that indicates that the brick is not suitable for construction get an expert consultation on brick selection for your home 3 hardness test the ideal brick must be able to resist any scratches induced by sharp objects so for this specific test a sharp tool or fingernail is used to create scratches on bricks if there are no impressions of any scratches then the brick is considered to be a hard brick 4 shape and size test all bricks used for the purpose of construction must be of identical size when it comes to shape each brick should be rectangular with distinct sharp edges to carry out this test 20 bricks are selected randomly and stacked along their dimensions for comparison if all bricks are of the same size then they are suitable for construction activity 5 soundness test this is another way of testing bricks this test demonstrates the nature of bricks during sudden impact to perform this test two bricks are chosen randomly and struck against each other the bricks should not crack or break and the sound that is produced must be a clear bellringing sound learn how to select the right brick from experts 6 structure of bricks to successfully determine a bricks structure one brick is randomly picked from a group and is broken close attention is paid to the inner portion of the brick the brick must be smooth and free from lumps the final word bricks are the building blocks of any structure there are specific tests that you can subject the bricks to in order to determine if they are fit or unfit for house building a new home or undertaking a renovation project one of the most important decisions youll have to make is what type of cement to use while traditional portland cement is the most widely used option blended cement is quickly becoming a popular choice among builders and homeowners alike this blog will look at blended cement and explain why its the best choice for your home construction 1 blended cement has an improved strength and durability adding materials such as fly ash and slag to the cement mixture increases its compressive and tensile strength making it more resistant to cracking and damage over time this means that buildings constructed with blended cement are less likely to experience structural issues and will have a longer lifespan this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more durable and last longer saving you money in the long run 2 blended cement is also a more costeffective option than traditional portland cement including materials such as fly ash and slag in the cement mixture means that less portland cement is required reducing the cements overall cost additionally blended cement is often more readily available than traditional portland cement which can further reduce costs this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more affordable and costeffective 3 blended cement is a more sustainable and environmentallyfriendly option than traditional portland cement the production of portland cement is a significant contributor to greenhouse gas emissions as it requires high temperatures to produce and releases carbon dioxide blended cement on the other hand is made by mixing traditional portland cement with other materials such as fly ash slag or limestone this reduces the energy required to produce the cement and its carbon footprint by using blended cement youll make a more sustainable choice for your home construction which is better for the environment and future generations 4 in terms of versatility blended cement is a better choice than traditional portland cement blended cement can be tailored to specific needs by adjusting the proportions of the materials used this allows for a broader range of applications this means that blended cement can be used for various construction projects including foundations walls floors and more this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it is more versatile and can be used for many applications want to know more about selecting the right materials get an expert consultation with jsw one homes 5 finally blended cement is also a better choice for the indian construction industry because it is more resistant to the weathering effects of the indian climate the indian climate is characterized by high humidity and extreme temperature fluctuations which can cause traditional portland cement to crack and degrade over time blended cement however is less affected by these weathering effects and is better able to withstand the rigors of the indian climate this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more resistant to the weathering effects of the indian climate making your home more durable and longlasting in conclusion blended cement is more sustainable durable costeffective versatile and weatherresistant than traditional portland cement using blended cement in your home construction can ensure that your building will be stronger more energyefficient and more environmentally friendly with blended cement youll be able to enjoy a home that is built to last and that will stand up to the challenges of the indian climate blended cement is the way to go if youre looking for a highquality longlasting and affordable building material share when it comes to building a custom home choosing the right materials for your countertops is an important decision countertops are one of one of the most popular countertop materials it is durable scratchresistant and can withstand heat granite is also available in various colours and patterns so you can choose a style that complements your homes decor 2 marble countertops marble is a luxurious and timeless option for countertops it has a unique veining pattern adds character to any kitchen or bathroom like granite marble is also heatresistant but more susceptible to scratches and staining therefore it is recommended that you stick with white marble for kitchen coutertops since scratches are more noticeable on colored marble than on white marble 3 quartz countertops quartz countertops are made from engineered stone and are a popular choice for homeowners who want a lowmaintenance option quartz is durable stainresistant and available in various colors and patterns however quartz can be expensive and may have a different visual appeal than natural stone let the experts help you select the right material 4 solid surface countertops solid surface countertops are made from a mixture of polyester or acrylic resins and natural minerals they are available in various colours and patterns and can be customised to fit any space solid surface countertops are nonporous and resist staining but they can scratch easily and are not heatresistant 5 laminate countertops laminate countertops are affordable for homeowners on a budget they are made from a thin layer of plastic laminate material that is glued to a particleboard base laminate countertops come in a wide range of colours and patterns and are easy to clean however they are less durable than other countertop materials and can be easily scratched or damaged 6 concrete countertops concrete countertops are popular for homeowners who want a modern industrial look they are durable heatresistant and can be customised to fit any space concrete countertops can be stained or stamped to create unique patterns and designs however they require higher maintenance to prevent staining and can be prone to cracking over time 6 concrete countertops concrete countertops are popular for homeowners who want a modern industrial look they are durable heatresistant and can be customised to fit any space concrete countertops can be stained or stamped to create unique patterns and designs however they require higher maintenance to prevent staining and can be prone to cracking over time 7tile countertops tile countertops are costeffective for homeowners who want a customised look they are available in a wide range of colours and patterns and can be customised to fit any space tile countertops are durable and heatresistant but can be prone to cracking and chipping over time choosing the right countertop materials for your custom home depends on your personal preferences budget and the maintenance you are willing to do granite and quartz countertops are durable and lowmaintenance while marble and concrete countertops require more upkeep laminate and tile countertops are affordable options but may have a different visual appeal than natural stone butcher block countertops offer a warm natural look but require regular oiling solid surface countertops are customisable and stainresistant but can scratch easily we hope that this article will be helpful to you while making a choice of a kitchen countertop material during your next home construction project share concrete is a mixture of cement coarse and fine aggregates and water it plays a crucial role in building infrastructure the cost of concrete is accredited to these ingredients which are not only expensive but also scarce concrete manufacturing emits a considerable amount of carbon dioxide co2 the pursuit of an alternate material which is economical and sustainable ended with the discovery of ground granulated blastfurnace slag ggbs ggbs is a nonmetallic product obtained as a byproduct from the blast furnaces used to make iron it consists of silicates and aluminates of bases such as calcium blast furnace varies in physical structure and composition depending on the cooling method of the slag it is obtained by the rapid chilling of the molten ash with the help of water the slag is transformed into the glass during this process and eventually refined to the required fineness for the uninformed ggbs is identifiable by its colour conventional portland cement is grey while the ggbs is white in colour there are two methods of using ggbs in concrete you can integrand the ggbs with the cement clinker and gypsum or mix the blast furnace with cement separately apart from that ggbs can also be used as the direct replacement of ordinary portland cement the replacement may vary between 3080 of cement in india generally ggbs is in concrete generates less heat than cement it also helps reduce the hydration heat reducing shrinkage and temperature cracks 6 lesser void hence decreased permeability in concrete 7 increased solution share book a visit now with jsw one homes home building should not be a nightmare for any query related to home building talk to our experts today sublime systems makes lowcarbon cement using electrochemistry instead of heat and combustion to transform minerals into the building material cement the binding ingredient in concrete is the most widely used manufactured materialand its responsible for 8 percent of the worlds carbon emissions to make cement limestone is put in a kiln and heated to 2500 degrees fahrenheit 1400 degrees celsius requiring a huge amount of energy and fossil fuel thats the first way cement production generates carbon dioxide then the heat causes the limestone to decompose emitting yet more of the greenhouse gas sublime has put an ecofriendly spin on the traditional method using an electrochemical approach powered by renewable electricity to break down the minerals the result is a cement powder that reacts with water to gel and harden into the same concrete that has been used for millennia the process can virtually eliminate the carbon dioxide output of cement production on a global scale sublimes technology can resolve the clash between ambitious climate goalsreducing greenhouse gas emissions to zero by 2050 a deadline set by the international energy agencyand the increasing rate of building construction were more urban than weve ever been and the amount of cement we need is staggering said cofounder and ceo leah ellis we dont just have to make green cement now were going to have to make green cement forever cement the binding ingredient in concrete is responsible for 8 percent of the worlds carbon emissions back in 2018 ellis was a postdoctoral fellow at mit studying with inventor and repeat entrepreneur yetming chiang kyocera professor in the department of materials science and engineering chiang got ellis thinking about the growing problem of cement production emissions and the opportunity to decarbonize the industry using increasingly abundant and lowcost renewable energy soon after she and another mit student began working backward from the notion of electrifying cement production to develop a sustainable material that could be costeffective easily scalable and just as durable as traditional cement with support from chiang and investors the idea of designing a zerocarbon cement became a reality and sublime systems was born swift and massive impact on global co2 emissions is the companys goal ellis said sublime raised more than 45 million in funds to accelerate production at its somerville massachusetts plant which can produce up to 250 tons of cement a year as the company scales up productionto 100 tons a day and beyondits looking to take its business international if you look at where the most cement is going to be used in the coming years its places of burgeoning urban populations like india africa and southeast asia green cement also known as sustainable cement is an ecofriendly alternative to traditional portland cement which is responsible for approximately 8 of global carbon dioxide emissions green cement is made from sustainable materials and uses less energy in the production process making it a more environmentally friendly option the use of traditional cement has been a significant contributor to climate change due to its high carbon footprint cement production is responsible for emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere which contributes to the greenhouse effect and global warming however the production of green cement uses up to 40 less energy and produces up to 80 fewer carbon dioxide emissions compared to traditional cement green cement is made from a variety of sustainable materials such as fly ash slag and recycled aggregates which are byproducts of other industries for example fly ash is a waste product of coalfired power plants and slag is a byproduct of iron and steel manufacturing using these materials in the production of green cement not only reduces waste but also reduces the amount of greenhouse gases produced green cement has several applications including use in construction road building and other infrastructure projects the properties of green cement are similar to those of traditional cement and it can be used in a range of applications in fact many of the worlds largest infrastructure projects such as highways bridges and dams have been built using green cement one of the benefits of using green cement is that it can contribute to leed certification for building projects the leadership in energy and environmental design leed certification is a rating system for green buildings and infrastructure projects using sustainable materials such as green cement can contribute to leed certification and help building projects to achieve higher ratings green cement is also costeffective as it is often cheaper to produce than traditional cement this is because the materials used in its production are often waste products from other industries making them readily available and less expensive in conclusion green cement is a sustainable alternative to traditional cement that has numerous benefits it has a lower carbon footprint is made from sustainable materials and is costeffective its applications are numerous and it can contribute to the leed certification of building projects as the world continues to move towards a more sustainable future the use of green cement is likely to increase and become more prevalent in the construction industry to view or industry definition and major segments green cement is an environmentally friendly substitute for conventional cement which is produced utilising industrial byproducts such fly ash blast furnace slag and recovered industrial waste although it is a vital raw material in the construction industry and a powerful binder cement production is one of the main sources of greenhouse gas emissions on the basis of producttypes the industry is classified into fly ashbased slagbased limestonebased silica fumebased based on enduse the market is segmented into residential nonresidential others key regions covered include brazil argentina mexico others market trends rising number of building codes and policies mandating energyefficient structures have led to the growth of green cement in the residential sector with increasing demand for sustainable products and enactment of stringent carbon emission regulations emphasis on developing zero waste regions is increasing furthermore growing awareness among consumers regarding the energy benefits associated with green homes is expected to drive the green cement market in the residential sector over the forecast period the growth in demand for green cement in the commercial segment is due to the increase in its application in commercial establishments such as office spaces shopping malls theaters and hospitals furthermore certain properties of cement such as greater resistance to extreme weather conditions compressive strength and short setting time are expected to boost the industry growth key market players the major players in the market they have a uniform black hue and a rounded edge appearance the best monocrystalline solar panels in india tend to perform better in lowlight conditions compared to other types created from multiple silicon crystals hence their name these solar panels in india for home are recognisable by their speckled blue appearance they are costeffective due to their manufacturing process which involves melting raw silicon while slightly less efficient than monocrystalline panels they offer a good balance between cost and performance thinfilm panels use various materials like amorphous silicon cadmium telluride or copper indium gallium selenide deposited in thin layers onto a substrate they are lighter and more flexible allowing for unique applications like curved surfaces or portable solar panels these panels are less efficient in terms of energy conversion but are more costeffective to produce the best solar panels in india for homes can convert sunlight into electricity higher efficiency panels generate more power per square metre when choosing solar panels for your home look for ones with higher efficiency ratings as they can maximise energy production especially if space for installation is limited the best monocrystalline solar panels in india generally offer higher efficiency compared to polycrystalline or thinfilm panels monocrystalline cells are made from single silicon crystals and are known for their efficiency and spacesaving design consider choosing solar panels for your home that have build quality and materials used panels with robust construction and highquality materials tend to last longer look for panels with durable frames tempered glass and weatherresistant coatings to withstand harsh weather conditions solar panels experience reduced efficiency as temperatures rise the temperature coefficient indicates how much the panels efficiency decreases with higher temperatures lower temperature coefficients imply better performance in hot insulation with a high rvalue per inch indicating better thermal resistance ensure it is correctly installed without gaps or compression spray foam insulation consider closedcell foam for better insulation and moisture resistance check for proper application thickness to achieve the desired rvalue cellulose insulation ensure it is made from recycled materials and treated for fire resistance verify proper installation density for effective thermal performance hardwood flooring check for hardwood species known for durability such as oak maple or cherry look for hardwood with a thick wear layer for longevity porcelain tile choose tiles with a high pei porcelain enamel institute rating for durability especially in hightraffic areas ensure proper installation to prevent cracking engineered wood flooring verify the plywood bases quality and the hardwood veneers thickness look for brands known for stability and resistance to warping vinyl windows look for multichambered frames for better insulation and durability ensure proper weatherstripping and energyefficient glazing wood windows check for solid wood construction with tight joints to prevent air leakage look for windows with lowemissivity lowe coatings for improved energy efficiency fibreglass windows choose thick frames and sashes for strength and durability knocking in tiles involves tapping the surface lightly to assess its quality a clear crisp sound indicates a wellfired and structurally sound tile dull thuds or hollow sounds suggest defects like air pockets or cracks visually inspect for any visible defects before installation to check if the cement is fresh visually inspect the packaging for damage and look for a uniform grey colour fresh cement feels powdery and freeflowing while stale cement may feel clumpy or have hardened chunks it should have a characteristic earthy smell conduct a small test batch of concrete to observe its setting time ensuring it meets expectations store cement in a cool dry place away from moisture for optimal freshness place a few drops of water on the surface of the wood if the water beads and remains on the surface the wood is likely wellsealed and protected from moisture if the water soaks into the wood quickly it may indicate that it lacks proper sealing and could be prone to rot or decay apply a strip of painters tape firmly onto the painted surface after letting it sit for a few minutes quickly peel off the tape if the paint comes off with the tape it suggests poor adhesion and may require sanding and priming before repainting place a level tool on various parts of the floor or surface to check for evenness if the bubble in the level rests within the marked lines the surface is level uneven surfaces may require additional levelling compounds or adjustments during construction use a voltage tester to ensure electrical outlets are wired correctly and safely check for proper grounding and polarity and ensure the outlets function correctly open and close windows and doors to ensure smooth operation and proper alignment look for any sticking or dragging which may indicate issues with installation or framing use a screwdriver to press against drywall lightly if the drywall feels firm and doesnt give easily its likely wellinstalled soft spots or areas that give easily may indicate improper installation or water damage bamboo construction coimbatore chennai kochi bamboo is a fastgrowing renewable resource that can be used as a structural material its lightweight strong and versatile making it suitable for various construction applications such as roofing flooring and wall panels bamboo construction also offers excellent thermal insulation properties which can help reduce energy consumption for heating and cooling fly ash bricks hyderabad chennai fly ash a byproduct of coal combustion can be used to manufacture bricks these bricks are lightweight durable and require less production energy than traditional clay bricks rapid urbanisation and population growth in cities like hyderabad and chennai have led to a high demand for affordable and sustainable building materials by using fly ash bricks builders can reduce the demand for clay and minimise the environmental impact of brick manufacturing rammed earth construction bangalore salem hubli rammed earth is an ancient building technique that involves compressing layers of earth within a frame to create walls this method utilises locally available soil reducing the need for transportation and minimising carbon emissions bangalore salem and hubli experience relatively dry climates with hot summers and mild winters they absorb heat during the day and release it slowly at night recycled materials all regions incorporating recycled materials into construction can significantly reduce waste and energy consumption for example recycled concrete aggregate can be used instead of virgin aggregate for concrete production reducing the demand for natural resources similarly recycled steel and reclaimed wood can be used for structural elements and interior finishes respectively offering both environmental and aesthetic benefits green roofs bangalore chennai consist of vegetation planted on a waterproof membrane installed atop a building they provide numerous environmental benefits including improved insulation reduced stormwater runoff and enhanced biodiversity green roofs in urban areas like bangalore and chennai can help mitigate the urban heat island effect and improve air quality solar passive design all regions implementing solar passive design principles can optimise energy efficiency and reduce reliance on artificial heating and cooling systems this approach involves orienting buildings to maximise natural light and ventilation utilising shading devices to control solar gain and incorporating thermal mass to moderate indoor temperatures passive solar techniques can effectively reduce energy consumption in regions like coimbatore hyderabad and kochi where sunlight is abundant cavity wall construction with insulated concrete blocks bangalore coimbatore in regions with temperature variations like bangalore and coimbatore cavity wall construction using insulated concrete blocks can help improve thermal performance and energy efficiency insulated concrete blocks feature a layer of insulating material sandwiched between two layers of concrete reducing heat transfer through the walls durability slate is highly durable and can withstand diverse weather conditions making it a reliable choice for the long term heat resistance lighter shades of slate reflect heat reducing indoor temperatures low maintenance slates robust nature requires minimal maintenance cost slate can be expensive to purchase and install weight the heavy weight of slate tiles may require reinforced roof structures heat reflective the light colour of terracotta tiles helps reflect heat keeping interiors cooler aesthetic appeal offers a classic attractive look that complements many architectural styles weather resistant baked terracotta is challenging and can withstand various weather conditions fragility terracotta tiles can be brittle and may break under heavy impact maintenance regular maintenance is required to keep them in good condition affordability concrete tiles are costeffective compared to other materials heat resistance can be treated with reflective coatings to enhance heat resistance durability concrete tiles are robust and durable weight unlike slate concrete tiles are heavy and may require structural support colour fading over time colours may fade due to exposure to sunlight cooling efficiency reflects sunlight effectively reducing cooling costs durability metal roofing is longlasting and requires minimal maintenance lightweight more straightforward to install and does not require reinforced structures cost higher initial cost compared to traditional materials noise can be noisy during rain unless adequately insulated reflective white colour effectively reflects heat and light durability made from durable materials such as ceramic maintenance high maintenance is required to keep tiles clean and reflective staining susceptible to staining which can reduce reflectivity weather resistant designed to withstand extreme weather conditions flexibility suitable for various roof shapes and designs durability longlasting with minimal maintenance installation complexity requires professional installation cost can be expensive depending on the type and membrane quality used energy generation converts solar energy into electricity providing a sustainable energy source aesthetic blends well with traditional roofing materials cost high initial investment for both shingles and installation efficiency efficiency can be lower compared to traditional solar panels heat resistance designed specifically for hot climates reflecting sunlight effectively variety available in various colours and styles durability may not be as durable as other materials like slate or metal maintenance regular maintenance is required to ensure longevity heat reflective reflects more sunlight reducing roof temperatures versatile can be applied to various roofing materials reapplication this may require reapplication over time to maintain effectiveness cost additional cost for coating application insulation excellent insulation capabilities durability resistant to corrosion and extreme weather conditions lightweight reduces the structural load on buildings initial cost polysius green technologies polysius activated clay polysius booster mill polysius pure oxyfuel polysius fuel substitution nox reduction almacenamiento de dixido de carbono en cemento este artculo forma parte de una lista anual de las que a nuestro juicio son las 10 tecnologas emergentes ms importantes la lista completa se puede ver haciendo clic aqu la fabricacin de cemento para hormign consiste en calentar piedra caliza pulverizada arcilla y arena a 1450 c usando un combustible como el carbn o el gas natural el proceso genera una gran cantidad de dixido de carbono la fabricacin de una tonelada mtrica de cemento portland de uso general libera entre 650 y 920 kilogramos de dicho componente los 28 millones de toneladas mtricas de cemento producidas en todo el mundo en 2009 generaron alrededor del 5 por ciento de todas las emisiones de dixido de carbono nikolaos vlasopoulos cientfico jefe en la startup novacem con sede en londres est tratando de eliminar las emisiones con un cemento que absorba ms dixido de carbono del que libere durante su fabricacin logra retener hasta 100 kilogramos de gas de efecto invernadero por tonelada vlasopoulos descubri la receta del cemento de novacem cuando era estudiante de postgrado en el imperial college de londres estaba investigando cementos producidos por la mezcla de xidos de magnesio con cemento portland afirma no obstante al aadir agua a los compuestos de magnesio sin ningn tipo de portland en la mezcla descubri que an as poda hacer un tipo de cemento slido y que no estuviese basado en piedra caliza rica en carbono y a medida que se endureca el dixido de carbono en la atmsfera reaccionaba con el magnesio para crear carbonatos fortalecientes del cemento que al mismo tiempo ayudaban a la captura del gas novacem est en la actualidad refinando la frmula para que el rendimiento mecnico del producto sea igual al del cemento portland ese trabajo afirma vlasopoulos debera estar hecho de aqu a un ao otras nuevas empresas tambin estn tratando de reducir la huella de carbono del cemento incluyendo a calera en los gatos california que ha recibido cerca de 50 millones de dlares en inversiones de riesgo sin embargo los cementos de calera se encuentran actualmente destinados a ser aditivos para el cemento portland en lugar de ser un reemplazo como en el caso de novacem afirma franzjosef ulm director del centro de sostenibilidad del cemento en mit novacem podra as conseguir ventaja en la reduccin de emisiones aunque todas las startups se enfrentan al reto de escalar su tecnologa a niveles industriales sin embargo segn afirma ulm esto no significa que una empresa deba desplazar miles de millones de toneladas de cemento portland para tener xito se puede comenzar por la explotacin de nichos de mercado especializados dentro de la construccin si novacem es capaz de producir 500000 toneladas al ao segn cree vlasopoulos puede alcanzar el mismo precio del cemento portland incluso llegar hasta ese punto va a ser difcil ellos estn introduciendo un material muy nuevo en una industria muy conservadora seala hamlin jennings profesor en el departamento de ingeniera civil y ambiental de la universidad northwestern habr cuestiones que responder novacem comenzar a tratar de persuadir a la industria trabajando con laing orourke la mayor empresa constructora de propiedad privada en el reino unido en 2011 y con 15 millones de dlares en efectivo procedentes de la real sociedad y otras fuentes novacem tiene programado comenzar a construir una nueva planta piloto para fabricar su nueva formulacin de cemento los investigadores se basan en los anillos de los rboles los glaciares y los registros fsiles para situar el clima actual en su contexto por casey crownhart a medida que el aire se vuelve ms limpio el mundo tambin pierde un importante efecto refrigerante por james temple un parque nuclear envejecido an puede contribuir a reducir las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero por casey crownhart ms informacin sobre cambio climtico es un concreto con 3050 menos contenido de carbono incorporado esta solucin utiliza cemento reducido en co2 y tiene un diseo de mezcla optimizado para reducir su huella de carbono con un nivel de reduccin de co2 entre 5070 es un producto tcnicamente ms demandante que proporciona una reduccin significativamente mayor que el estndar general disponible en un mercado determinado con este concreto explotan las posibilidades tcnicas al mximo para ofrecer un producto de primera con una reduccin de co2 mayor al 70 es una combinacin de excelencia tecnolgica en concreto y accin climtica este producto otorga la oportunidad de eliminar hasta el 100 la huella de carbono del concreto y reducir en gran medida la huella de carbono general de las estructuras de concreto dos empresas argentinas lderes se han asociado para construirla primera planta productora de cemento basada en el bajo consumo de energa y en el cuidado del medio ambiente el emprendimiento ecocemento sa tiene adems un ingrediente econmicoambiental ms que interesante este cemento ecolgico tienecomo insumo esencial un residuo la escoria de la industria siderrgicay los resultados de su uso son muy satisfactorios en relacin a otros cementos la nueva planta con capacidad inicial para producir 300000 toneladas anuales demand una inversin de 25 millones de dlares y ocupa un predio de 335 hectreas ubicado en las cercanas de las ciudades de ramallo y san nicols en la provincia de buenos aires uno de sus propietarios es la principal empresa del grupo fortabat loma negra en un 85 el 15 restante pertenece a siderar del grupo techint quien adems estuvo a cargo de la obra el suministro de equipamiento tecnolgico correspondi a la firma dinamarquesa f l smidth loma negra aporta su experiencia en tecnologa de produccin su capacidad de distribucin y la principal materia prima del cemento el clinker que llega a la planta en ferrocarril proveniente de sus fbricas en olavarra y barker provincia de buenos aires por su parte siderar suministra desde su planta lindante con ecocemento la escoria de alto horno un subproducto de la industria siderrgica disminuyendo de este modo la utilizacin de los recursos no renovables y del consumo de energa en relacin al cemento comn el cemento elaborado con escoria de alto horno tiene excelentes caractersticas ya que posee mayor resistencia final y gran durabilidad lo que lo constituye en el producto ms indicado para aquellas obras en las que el hormign puede verse sometido a condiciones agresivas como son los pavimentos las fundaciones los emprendimientos hidrulicos y las estructuras portuarias entre otras cuando se construy el aeropuerto de ushuaia ejemplificaron en ecocemento el cemento debi ser traido desde alemania en el futuro obras deese estilo podrn desarrollarse con cemento argentino otra ventaja es el menor calor de hidratacin con lo cual se evita la fisura por causas de origen trmico aseste cemento resulta ideal para obras masivas por su mayor resistencia a aguas sulfatadas aguas de mar o ataques de cidos ecocemento sa cuenta con el primer molino vertical para la mezcla de cemento de amrica del sur especialmente diseado para la molienda de cementos con y de escoria aplicando tecnologa de punta y logrando con este tipo de equipamiento un menor consumo especfico de energa el proceso que se realiza en esta planta comprende el almacenaje transporte y dosificacin de materias primas como as tambin la molienda el embolsado y despacho del producto final desde loma negra se asegura que el nuevo producto posee un nivel de calidad que excede con holgura los requisitos de la norma iram 1636 superando en muchos aspectos las caractersticas del cemento normal de esta manera afirman loma negra empresa lder en el mercado de cementos de argentina se mantiene a la vanguardia de los procesos productivos de cemento con especiales ventajas competitivas en consumo energtico y proteccin ambiental la presidente de loma negra amalia lacroze de fortabat seal durante el acto de inauguracin de la planta este proyecto se enmarca dentro de una poltica que ha mantenido nuestra empresa cuidar el medio ambiente dentro de los avances tecnolgicos es necesario respetar al hombre las fbricas son algo bello porque crean para el hombre pero no deben transformarse en destructoras de l por eso agreg este emprendimiento es un orgullo para loma negra ya que no slo puede brindar un excelente suministro de cemento con escoria sino que adems brinda una nueva muestra del compromiso ambiental y conciencia ecolgica con los cuales siempre ha encarado sus procesos productivos revista ecologa negocios n 13 tu direccin de correo electrnico no ser publicada los campos obligatorios estn marcados empresa suiza holcim busca contribuir a la transicin hacia un futuro incluyente sostenible y net zero se estima que para el ao 2050 el 80 por ciento de la poblacin mundial podra vivir en zonas urbanas y en ese trnsito el mundo necesitar construir el equivalente a la ciudad de nueva york cada mes empresas como holcim vienen innovando para responder a esa demanda y contribuir a la transicin hacia un futuro incluyente y net zero para afrontar este reto lanz ecoplanet la lnea ms amplia de cemento verde del mundo que permite reducir sus emisiones hasta un 50 por ciento es decir 38 kg de co2 por tonelada de material cementante con un desempeo igual o superior al del cemento tradicional marco maccarelli presidente ejecutivo de holcim colombia explica que ecoplanet ofrece ventajas circulares y de bajas emisiones de carbono al introducir un novedoso sistema de molienda separada reconocido por el ministerio de ciencia tecnologa e innovacin adems cuenta con la descarbonizacin en su proceso de produccin al hacer uso de combustibles alternativos mediante estas acciones damos pasos firmes en nuestra estrategia 2025 acelerando de forma contundente el crecimiento ecolgico precis ecoplanet soluciones ecoinnovadoras que holcim desarrolla desde hace unos aos en 2020 introdujo en el mercado ecopact una amplia y avanzada gama de concreto ecolgico para crear edificaciones sostenibles y de alto desempeo esta lnea con propiedades iguales o superiores a los concretos convencionales aporta a la construccin sostenible y circular ecopact cuenta con una huella de carbono desde 30 por ciento hasta ciento por ciento ms baja en comparacin con el concreto estndar su perfil de sostenibilidad est impulsado por materias primas bajas en emisiones al igual que ecoplanet por la descarbonizacin de sus operaciones incluido el uso de combustibles alternativos esta lnea de concretos cuenta con cuatro presentaciones segn el nivel de reduccin de co2 ecopact 3050 por ciento menos ecopact prime pueden ayudar a disminuir el uso de cemento y reducir las emisiones de co2 lo ramoslas cenizas del bagazo de caa de la cscara de arroz y los residuos de la industria cermica pueden entrar en la el ambiente pues adems de aprovechar esos materiales que muchas veces son de difcil descarte y reutilizacin contribuyen a disminuir las emisiones de dixido de carbono co2 en la atmsfera la industria cementera es responsable de un 7 de las emisiones de co2 en el mundo segn datos utilizados por el painel intergubernamental de cambios climticos ipcc por su sigla en ingls por cada tonelada t de cemento producido va a parar a la atmsfera 1 t de co2 en brasil ese dato corresponde a 067 t pues parte de la materia prima que se usa en el pas para la produccin de cemento se obtiene con el aprovechamiento de la escoria arcilla separada del material ferroso de los altos hornos de las siderrgicas y la matriz energtica o la energa elctrica gastada en el proceso es renovable proveniente de las hidroelctricas explica el profesor romildo toledo filho de la coordinacin de los programas de posgrado de ingenieras coppe de la universidad federal de ro de janeiro ufrj coordinador del equipo que desarroll estudios para la incorporacin de los residuos al cemento en el 2007 se produjeron 44 millones de t de cemento en brasil que resultaron en 294 millones de t de co2 toledo estima que con la incorporacin de los residuos ser posible reducir las emisiones brasileas en casi 6 millones de t al sustituir un 20 de la produccin de cemento los datos analizados por el grupo del coppe indican la existencia de alrededor de 10 millones de t de residuos disponibles para la utilizacin por parte de la industria del cemento entre 15 y 2 millones son de cenizas de la quema del bagazo de caa que sobran de las calderas y los generadores para la produccin de energa elctrica para el abastecimiento de los propios centrales las cenizas del bagazo son ricas en slice amorfo diferente de la forma cristalina encontrada por ejemplo en la arena en la forma amorfa puede reaccionar a temperatura ambiente con el hidrxido de calcio uno de los productos de hidratacin del cemento esa misma estructura produjeron 22 millones de t de cscara tanto la ceniza del bagazo de caa como la de la cscara del arroz para integrar el concreto deben pasar por un proceso de micronizacin en que el material es reducido a partculas mucho menores lo ramosla industria brasilea de cermica produce aproximadamente de 5 a 6 millones de t de residuos en la produccin de tejas ladrillos y pisos ese material despus de regin sudeste es el mayor centro consumidor de cemento y tambin el mayor productor de residuos en este momento estamos realizando un estudio para identificar las reas productoras de ceniza de bagazo y
