construction this steel is reinforcement steels latest generation with a higher strength and ductility in comparison with its predecessors they are further graded as fe415 and fe500 which is the yield strength of 415 and 500 nmm2 respectively higher grades too are available what is tmt steel tmt steel is highstrength reinforcement bars produced using the thermomechanical method these bars have a firm outer core in addition to a soft inner core tmt steel bars are renowned for their high tensile strength which is of paramount importance when it comes to withstanding extreme weather conditions the durability of tmt bars largely depends on their corrosion and rustresistant features ribbed tmt bars offer enhanced reinforcement to concrete structures thus lowering the chances of any damage during any potential seismic activity tmt bars demonstrate their quality via their flexibility and toughness how to select steel for construction some of the most important factors to consider while selecting the most ideal steel for your house are mentioned below for expert guidance contact jsw one homes latest stateoftheart technology the manufacturing world of steel bars is constantly evolving so new technological innovations are always brewing always ensure that you select your manufacturer in a wise manner someone who uses the latest stateoftheart technologies some of the sturdiest tmt bars are constructed from pure raw materials choose between primary and secondary steel primary steel is obtained from a process that is known as bof basic oxygen furnace method in this steelmaking process iron ore which is the raw material is transformed into iron billets that are used to produce steel bars on the contrary secondary steel is generally produced in an electric arc furnace the main raw material that is used to produce these steel bars is scrap steel crosscheck for certification prior to purchasing tmt bars you need to check for relevant certifications such as iso international organisation for standardisation bis bureau of indian standards and others these certifications are a reassurance that your choice of tmt bars strictly adheres to good manufacturing practices and safety protocols choose from a wide variety the strength of a steel bar is inversely proportional to its flexibility higher grades of steel ensure enhanced performance some of the diverse steel grades include fe415 fe550 fe600 and fe500sd it is a good idea to check the gradations before purchasing tmt bars corrosion and rustresistance in indias hot and humid conditions it is a smart move to opt for those steel bars that are highly resistant to corrosion arising from rust humidity and heat this resistance significantly improves the durability of each tmt bar that is needed for concrete structures the final word in most forms of house construction tmt bars play a vital role the entire strength of your house and its support system rest on these bars a little bit of building a new home or undertaking a renovation project one of the most important decisions youll have to make is what type of cement to use while traditional portland cement is the most widely used option blended cement is quickly becoming a popular choice among builders and homeowners alike this blog will look at blended cement and explain why its the best choice for your home construction 1 blended cement has an improved strength and durability adding materials such as fly ash and slag to the cement mixture increases its compressive and tensile strength making it more resistant to cracking and damage over time this means that buildings constructed with blended cement are less likely to experience structural issues and will have a longer lifespan this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more durable and last longer saving you money in the long run 2 blended cement is also a more costeffective option than traditional portland cement including materials such as fly ash and slag in the cement mixture means that less portland cement is required reducing the cements overall cost additionally blended cement is often more readily available than traditional portland cement which can further reduce costs this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more affordable and costeffective 3 blended cement is a more sustainable and environmentallyfriendly option than traditional portland cement the production of portland cement is a significant contributor to greenhouse gas emissions as it requires high temperatures to produce and releases carbon dioxide blended cement on the other hand is made by mixing traditional portland cement with other materials such as fly ash slag or limestone this reduces the energy required to produce the cement and its carbon footprint by using blended cement youll make a more sustainable choice for your home construction which is better for the environment and future generations 4 in terms of versatility blended cement is a better choice than traditional portland cement blended cement can be tailored to specific needs by adjusting the proportions of the materials used this allows for a broader range of applications this means that blended cement can be used for various construction projects including foundations walls floors and more this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it is more versatile and can be used for many applications want to know more about selecting the right materials get an expert consultation with jsw one homes 5 finally blended cement is also a better choice for the indian construction industry because it is more resistant to the weathering effects of the indian climate the indian climate is characterized by high humidity and extreme temperature fluctuations which can cause traditional portland cement to crack and degrade over time blended cement however is less affected by these weathering effects and is better able to withstand the rigors of the indian climate this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more resistant to the weathering effects of the indian climate making your home more durable and longlasting in conclusion blended cement is more sustainable durable costeffective versatile and weatherresistant than traditional portland cement using blended cement in your home construction can ensure that your building will be stronger more energyefficient and more environmentally friendly with blended cement youll be able to enjoy a home that is built to last and that will stand up to the challenges of the indian climate blended cement is the way to go if youre looking for a highquality longlasting and affordable building material share when it comes to building a custom home choosing the right materials for your countertops is an important decision countertops are one of the most heavily used surfaces in a home so choosing materials that are durable easy to maintain and look great is important with so many options available deciding which countertop materials are right for your custom home can be overwhelming in this blog post well look at some of the most popular countertop materials and their pros and cons 1 granite countertops for a good reason granite is one of the most popular countertop materials it is durable scratchresistant and can withstand heat granite is also available in various colours and patterns so you can choose a style that complements your homes decor 2 marble countertops marble is a luxurious and timeless option for countertops it has a unique veining pattern adds character to any kitchen or bathroom like granite marble is also heatresistant but more susceptible to scratches and staining therefore it is recommended that you stick with white marble for kitchen coutertops since scratches are more noticeable on colored marble than on white marble 3 quartz countertops quartz countertops are made from engineered stone and are a popular choice for homeowners who want a lowmaintenance option quartz is durable stainresistant and available in various colors and patterns however quartz can be expensive and may have a different visual appeal than natural stone let the experts help you select the right material 4 solid surface countertops solid surface countertops are made from a mixture of polyester or acrylic resins and natural minerals they are available in various colours and patterns and can be customised to fit any space solid surface countertops are nonporous and resist staining but they can scratch easily and are not heatresistant 5 laminate countertops laminate countertops are affordable for homeowners on a budget they are made from a thin layer of plastic laminate material that is glued to a particleboard base laminate countertops come in a wide range of colours and patterns and are easy to clean however they are less durable than other countertop materials and can be easily scratched or damaged 6 concrete countertops concrete countertops are popular for homeowners who want a modern industrial look they are durable heatresistant and can be customised to fit any space concrete countertops can be stained or stamped to create unique patterns and designs however they require higher maintenance to prevent staining and can be prone to cracking over time 6 concrete countertops concrete countertops are popular for homeowners who want a modern industrial look they are durable heatresistant and can be customised to fit any space concrete countertops can be stained or stamped to create unique patterns and designs however they require higher maintenance to prevent staining and can be prone to cracking over time 7tile countertops tile countertops are costeffective for homeowners who want a customised look they are available in a wide range of colours and patterns and can be customised to fit any space tile countertops are durable and heatresistant but can be prone to cracking and chipping over time choosing the right countertop materials for your custom home depends on your personal preferences budget and the maintenance you are willing to do granite and quartz countertops are durable and lowmaintenance while marble and concrete countertops require more upkeep laminate and tile countertops are affordable options but may have a different visual appeal than natural stone butcher block countertops offer a warm natural look but require regular oiling solid surface countertops are customisable and stainresistant but can scratch easily we hope that this article will be helpful to you while making a choice of a kitchen countertop material during your next home construction project share concrete is a mixture of cement coarse and fine aggregates and water it plays a crucial role in building infrastructure the cost of concrete is accredited to these ingredients which are not only expensive but also scarce concrete manufacturing emits a considerable amount of carbon dioxide co2 the pursuit of an alternate material which is economical and sustainable ended with the discovery of ground granulated blastfurnace slag ggbs ggbs is a nonmetallic product obtained as a byproduct from the blast furnaces used to make iron it consists of silicates and aluminates of bases such as calcium blast furnace varies in physical structure and composition depending on the cooling method of the slag it is obtained by the rapid chilling of the molten ash with the help of water the slag is transformed into the glass during this process and eventually refined to the required fineness for the uninformed ggbs is identifiable by its colour conventional portland cement is grey while the ggbs is white in colour there are two methods of using ggbs in concrete you can integrand the ggbs with the cement clinker and gypsum or mix the blast furnace with cement separately apart from that ggbs can also be used as the direct replacement of ordinary portland cement the replacement may vary between 3080 of cement in india generally ggbs is used by adding it to batching plants along with the portland cement water and aggregates uses of ggbs producing portland blast furnace cement pbfc and high slag blast furnace cement hsbfc producing ready mixed concrete used in ready mix concrete plants used in constructing structures which are vulnerable to chloride and sulfate attacks for eg marine and substructures want to know more about silicate hydrates than portland cement concrete it also contains a lesser amount of free lime the other advantages of ggbs include 1 due to reactive silica in ggbs replacing cement with ggbs in concrete mixes enhances the structural performance in terms of strength and durability 2 the reactivity of ggbs with cement offers an increase in the compressive strength for different concrete mixes made with partial replacement of cement by ggbs 3 reduction in the energy consumption in cement manufacturing 4 one tonne of portland cement manufacturing requires around 15 tons of mineral extraction along with 5000 mj of energy and would generate around 095 tons of co2 equivalent in contrast ggbss global warming potential is at 6021 kg co2 equivalent among the lowest in the industry 5 use of ggbs in concrete generates less heat than cement it also helps reduce the hydration heat reducing shrinkage and temperature cracks 6 lesser void hence decreased permeability in concrete 7 increased resistance to sulphate attacks ggbs applications ggbs in combination with portland cement is used to make longlasting structures such as 1 concrete roads and flyovers 2 dams 3 residential houses 4 solution share book a visit now with jsw one homes home building should not be a nightmare for any query related to home building talk to our experts today sublime systems makes lowcarbon cement using electrochemistry instead of heat and combustion to transform minerals into the building material cement the binding ingredient in concrete is the most widely used manufactured materialand its responsible for 8 percent of the worlds carbon emissions to make cement limestone is put in a kiln and heated to 2500 degrees fahrenheit 1400 degrees celsius requiring a huge amount of energy and fossil fuel thats the first way cement production generates carbon dioxide then the heat causes the limestone to decompose emitting yet more of the greenhouse gas sublime has put an ecofriendly spin on the traditional method using an electrochemical approach powered by renewable electricity to break down the minerals the result is a cement powder that reacts with water to gel and harden into the same concrete that has been used for millennia the process can virtually eliminate the carbon dioxide output of cement production on a global scale sublimes technology can resolve the clash between ambitious climate goalsreducing greenhouse gas emissions to zero by 2050 a deadline set by the international energy agencyand the increasing rate of building construction were more urban than weve ever been and the amount of cement we need is staggering said cofounder and ceo leah ellis we dont just have to make green cement now were going to have to make green cement forever cement the binding ingredient in concrete is responsible for 8 percent of the worlds carbon emissions back in 2018 ellis was a postdoctoral fellow at mit studying with inventor and repeat entrepreneur yetming chiang kyocera professor in the department of materials science and engineering chiang got ellis thinking about the growing problem of cement production emissions and the opportunity to decarbonize the industry using increasingly abundant and lowcost renewable energy soon after she and another mit student began working backward from the notion of electrifying cement production to develop a sustainable material that could be costeffective easily scalable and just as durable as traditional cement with support from chiang and investors the idea of designing a zerocarbon cement became a reality and sublime systems was born swift and massive impact on global co2 emissions is the companys goal ellis said sublime raised more than 45 million in funds to accelerate production at its somerville massachusetts plant which can produce up to 250 tons of cement a year as the company scales up productionto 100 tons a day and beyondits looking to take its business international if you look at where the most cement is going to be used in the coming years its places of burgeoning urban populations like india africa and southeast asia green cement also known as sustainable cement is an ecofriendly alternative to traditional portland cement which is responsible for approximately 8 of global carbon dioxide emissions green cement is made from sustainable materials and uses less energy in the production process making it a more environmentally friendly option the use of traditional cement has been a significant contributor to climate change due to its high carbon footprint cement production is responsible for emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere which contributes to the greenhouse effect and global warming however the production of green cement uses up to 40 less energy and produces up to 80 fewer carbon dioxide emissions compared to traditional cement green cement is made from a variety of sustainable materials such as fly ash slag and recycled aggregates which are byproducts of other industries for example fly ash is a waste product of coalfired power plants and slag is a byproduct of iron and steel manufacturing using these materials in the production of green cement not only reduces waste but also reduces the amount of greenhouse gases produced green cement has several applications including use in construction road building and other infrastructure projects the properties of green cement are similar to those of traditional cement and it can be used in a range of applications in fact many of the worlds largest infrastructure projects such as highways bridges and dams have been built using green cement one of the benefits of using green cement is that it can contribute to leed certification for building projects the leadership in energy and environmental design leed certification is a rating system for green buildings and infrastructure projects using sustainable materials such as green cement can contribute to leed certification and help building projects to achieve higher ratings green cement is also costeffective as it is often cheaper to produce than traditional cement this is because the materials used in its production are often waste products from other industries making them readily available and less expensive in conclusion green cement is a sustainable alternative to traditional cement that has numerous benefits it has a lower carbon footprint is made from sustainable materials and is costeffective its applications are numerous and it can contribute to the leed certification of building projects as the world continues to move towards a more sustainable future the use of green cement is likely to increase and become more prevalent in the construction industry to view or industry definition and major segments green cement is an environmentally friendly substitute for conventional cement which is produced utilising industrial byproducts such fly ash blast furnace slag and recovered industrial waste although it is a vital raw material in the construction industry and a powerful binder cement production is one of the main sources of greenhouse gas emissions on the basis of producttypes the industry is classified into fly ashbased slagbased limestonebased silica fumebased based on enduse the market is segmented into residential nonresidential others key regions covered include brazil argentina mexico others market trends rising number of building codes and policies mandating energyefficient structures have led to the growth of green cement in the residential sector with increasing demand for sustainable products and enactment of stringent carbon emission regulations emphasis on developing zero waste regions is increasing furthermore growing awareness cement in the commercial segment is due to the increase in its application in commercial establishments such as office spaces shopping malls theaters and hospitals furthermore certain properties of consumption automated blinds motorised window treatments for light control and energy efficiency made from singlecrystal silicon these panels are known for their high efficiency and spaceefficiency they have a uniform black hue and a rounded edge appearance the best monocrystalline solar panels in india tend to perform better in lowlight conditions compared to other types created from multiple silicon crystals hence their name these solar panels in india for home are recognisable by their speckled blue appearance they are costeffective due to their manufacturing process which involves melting raw silicon while slightly less efficient than monocrystalline panels they offer a good balance between cost and performance thinfilm panels use various materials like amorphous silicon cadmium telluride or copper indium gallium selenide deposited in thin layers onto a substrate they are lighter and more flexible allowing for unique applications like curved surfaces or portable solar panels these panels are less efficient in terms of energy conversion but are more costeffective to produce the best solar panels in india for homes can convert sunlight into electricity higher efficiency panels generate more power per square metre when choosing solar panels for your home look for ones with higher efficiency ratings as they can maximise energy production especially if space for installation is limited the best monocrystalline solar panels in india generally offer higher efficiency compared to polycrystalline or thinfilm panels monocrystalline cells are made from single silicon crystals and are known for their efficiency and spacesaving design consider choosing solar panels for your home that have build quality and materials used panels with robust construction and highquality materials tend to last longer look for panels with durable frames tempered glass and weatherresistant coatings to withstand harsh weather conditions solar panels experience reduced efficiency as temperatures rise the temperature coefficient indicates how much the panels efficiency decreases with higher temperatures lower temperature coefficients imply better performance in hot climates create a list of appliancesmake a comprehensive list of all electrical appliances used in your household including lights fans refrigerators air conditioners televisions computers washing machines etc determine power ratingsfind the power ratings in watts or kilowatts of each appliance this information is usually labelled on the appliance itself or in the user manualfor appliances without clear ratings use averages or check the manufacturers website for specifications estimate daily usagenote down the average time each appliance is used daily some appliances like lights or fans may be used for several hours while others like washing machines or tvs might have specific usage durations calculate daily energy consumptionmultiply the power rating in kilowatts of each appliance by the number of hours it is used daily to calculate its daily energy consumption in kilowatthours kwhsum up the individual energy consumption values for all appliances to get the total daily energy consumption of your household seasonal variations and adjustmentsconsider seasonal variations in energy consumption especially for appliances like air conditioners or heaters that are used more during extreme weather conditionsfactor in any additional energy usage during holidays weekends or special occasions energy audit toolsutilise online energy consumption calculators or mobile apps specifically designed for estimating household energy usage some utilities or energy companies may also offer tools for this purpose measurements accurate measurements are crucial use a measuring tape or laser distance measurer to determine the length and width of each room measure from wall to wall including doorways and any protrusions like alcoves or closets scale understand the scale of the floor plan for example 14 inch might represent 1 foot use this scale to convert your measurements accurately onto paper or a digital platform room shapes identify the shape of each roomwhether rectangular square lshaped or irregular break down complex shapes into simpler ones for easier calculationsfeatures and details note any architectural features like columns fireplaces or builtin furniture these elements might impact the layout and need to be included in your floor plan vertical dimensions while floor plans focus on horizontal space understanding ceiling heights is also vital substructures asphalt shingles these are the most common and costeffective roofing materials check for the thickness and warranty offered by the manufacturer higherquality shingles typically have more extended warranties metal roofing look for materials like galvanised steel or aluminium which offer durability and resistance to rust gauge the thickness of the metal as thicker gauges tend to be more durable clay or concrete tiles these are durable and offer a distinct aesthetic inspect for cracks or chips in the tiles which may indicate poor quality vinyl siding ensure the vinyl is of good quality and thickness to withstand weather conditions and resist fading look for siding with uv protection to maintain colour over time fibre cement siding check for brands known for their durability rot insects and fire resistance wood siding opt for naturally rotresistant woods like cedar or redwood and ensure proper treatment and sealing to prevent decay fibreglass insulation look for insulation with a high rvalue per inch indicating better thermal resistance ensure it is correctly installed without gaps or compression spray foam insulation consider closedcell foam for better insulation and moisture resistance check for proper application thickness to achieve the desired rvalue cellulose insulation ensure it is made from recycled materials and treated for fire resistance verify proper installation density for effective thermal performance hardwood flooring check for hardwood species known for durability such as oak maple or cherry look for hardwood with a thick wear layer for longevity porcelain tile choose tiles with a high pei porcelain enamel institute rating for durability especially in hightraffic areas ensure proper installation to prevent cracking engineered wood flooring verify the plywood bases quality and the hardwood veneers thickness look for brands known for stability and resistance to warping vinyl windows look for multichambered frames for better insulation and durability ensure proper weatherstripping and energyefficient glazing wood windows check for solid wood construction with tight joints to prevent air leakage look for windows with lowemissivity lowe coatings for improved energy efficiency fibreglass windows choose thick frames and sashes for strength and durability knocking in tiles involves tapping the surface lightly to assess its quality a clear crisp sound indicates a wellfired and structurally sound tile dull thuds or hollow sounds suggest defects like air pockets or cracks visually inspect for any visible defects before installation to check if the cement is fresh visually inspect the packaging for damage and look for a uniform grey colour fresh cement feels powdery and freeflowing while stale cement may feel clumpy or have hardened chunks it should have a characteristic earthy smell conduct a small test batch of concrete to observe its setting time ensuring it meets expectations store cement in a cool dry place away from moisture for optimal freshness place a few drops of water on the surface of the wood if the water beads and remains on the surface the wood is likely wellsealed and protected from moisture if the water soaks into the wood quickly it may indicate that it lacks proper sealing and could be prone to rot or decay apply a strip of painters tape firmly onto the painted surface after letting it sit for a few minutes quickly peel off the tape if the paint comes off with the tape it suggests poor adhesion and may require sanding and priming before repainting place a level tool on various parts of the floor or surface to check for evenness if the bubble in the level rests within the marked lines the surface is level uneven surfaces may require additional levelling compounds or adjustments during construction use a voltage tester to ensure electrical outlets are wired correctly and safely check for proper grounding and polarity and ensure the outlets function correctly open and close windows and doors to ensure smooth operation and proper alignment look for any sticking or dragging which may indicate issues with installation or framing use a screwdriver to press against drywall lightly if the drywall feels firm and doesnt give easily its likely wellinstalled soft spots or areas that give easily may indicate improper installation or water damage bamboo construction coimbatore chennai kochi bamboo is a fastgrowing renewable resource that can be used as a structural material its lightweight strong and versatile making it suitable for various construction applications such as roofing flooring and wall panels bamboo construction also offers excellent thermal insulation properties which can help reduce energy consumption for heating and cooling fly ash bricks hyderabad chennai fly ash a byproduct of coal combustion can be used to manufacture bricks these bricks are lightweight durable and require less production energy than traditional clay bricks rapid urbanisation and population growth in cities like hyderabad and chennai have led to a high demand for affordable and sustainable building materials by using fly ash bricks builders can reduce the demand for clay and minimise the environmental impact of brick manufacturing rammed earth construction bangalore salem hubli rammed earth is an ancient building technique that involves compressing layers of earth within a frame to create walls this method utilises locally available soil reducing the need for transportation and minimising carbon emissions bangalore salem and hubli experience relatively dry climates with hot summers and mild winters they absorb heat during the day and release it slowly at night recycled materials all regions incorporating recycled materials into construction can significantly reduce waste and energy consumption for example recycled concrete aggregate can be used instead of virgin aggregate for concrete production reducing the demand for natural resources similarly recycled steel and reclaimed wood can be used for structural elements and interior finishes respectively offering both environmental and aesthetic benefits green roofs bangalore chennai consist of vegetation planted on a waterproof membrane installed atop a building they provide numerous environmental benefits including improved insulation reduced stormwater runoff carbono en cemento este artculo forma parte de una lista anual de las que a nuestro juicio son las 10 tecnologas emergentes ms importantes la lista completa se puede ver haciendo clic aqu la fabricacin de cemento para hormign consiste en calentar piedra caliza pulverizada arcilla y arena a 1450 c usando un combustible como el carbn o el gas natural el proceso genera una gran cantidad de dixido de carbono la fabricacin de una tonelada mtrica de cemento portland de uso general libera entre 650 y 920 kilogramos de dicho componente los 28 millones de toneladas mtricas de cemento producidas en todo el mundo en 2009 generaron alrededor del 5 por ciento de todas las emisiones de dixido de carbono nikolaos vlasopoulos cientfico jefe en la startup novacem con sede en londres est tratando de eliminar las emisiones con un cemento que absorba ms dixido de carbono del que libere durante su fabricacin logra retener hasta 100 kilogramos de gas de efecto invernadero por tonelada vlasopoulos descubri la receta del cemento de novacem cuando era estudiante de postgrado en el imperial college de londres estaba investigando cementos producidos por la mezcla de xidos de magnesio con cemento portland afirma no obstante al aadir agua a los compuestos de magnesio sin ningn tipo de portland en la mezcla descubri que an as poda hacer un tipo de cemento slido y que no estuviese basado en piedra caliza rica en carbono y a medida que se endureca el dixido de carbono en la atmsfera reaccionaba con el magnesio para crear carbonatos fortalecientes del cemento que al mismo tiempo ayudaban a la captura del gas novacem est en la actualidad refinando la frmula para que el rendimiento mecnico del producto sea igual al del cemento portland ese trabajo afirma vlasopoulos debera estar hecho de aqu a un ao otras nuevas empresas tambin estn tratando de reducir la huella de carbono del cemento incluyendo a calera en los gatos california que ha recibido cerca de 50 millones de dlares en inversiones de riesgo sin embargo los cementos de calera se encuentran actualmente destinados a ser aditivos para el cemento portland en lugar de ser un reemplazo como en el caso de novacem afirma franzjosef ulm director del centro de sostenibilidad del cemento en mit novacem podra as conseguir ventaja en la reduccin de emisiones aunque todas las startups se enfrentan al reto de escalar su tecnologa a niveles industriales sin embargo segn afirma ulm esto no significa que una empresa deba desplazar miles de millones de toneladas de cemento portland para tener xito se puede comenzar por la explotacin de nichos de mercado especializados dentro de la construccin si novacem es capaz de producir 500000 toneladas al ao segn cree vlasopoulos puede alcanzar el mismo precio del cemento portland incluso llegar hasta ese punto va a ser difcil ellos estn introduciendo un material muy nuevo en una industria muy conservadora seala hamlin jennings profesor en el departamento de ingeniera civil y ambiental de la universidad northwestern habr cuestiones que responder novacem comenzar a tratar de persuadir a la industria trabajando con laing orourke la mayor empresa constructora de propiedad privada en el reino unido en 2011 y con 15 millones de dlares en efectivo procedentes de la real sociedad y otras fuentes novacem tiene programado comenzar a construir una nueva planta piloto para fabricar su nueva formulacin de cemento los investigadores se basan en los anillos de los rboles los glaciares y los registros fsiles para situar el clima actual en su contexto por casey crownhart a medida que el aire se vuelve ms limpio el mundo tambin pierde un importante efecto refrigerante por james temple un parque nuclear envejecido an puede contribuir a reducir las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero por casey crownhart ms informacin sobre cambio climtico es un concreto con 3050 menos contenido de carbono incorporado esta solucin utiliza cemento reducido en co2 y tiene un diseo de mezcla optimizado para reducir su huella de carbono con un nivel de reduccin de co2 entre 5070 es un producto tcnicamente ms demandante que proporciona una reduccin significativamente mayor que el estndar general disponible en un mercado determinado con este concreto explotan las posibilidades tcnicas al mximo para ofrecer un producto de primera con una reduccin de co2 mayor al 70 es una combinacin de excelencia tecnolgica en concreto y accin climtica este producto otorga la oportunidad de eliminar hasta el 100 la huella de carbono del concreto y reducir en gran medida la huella de carbono general de las estructuras de concreto dos empresas argentinas lderes se han asociado para construirla primera planta productora de cemento basada en el bajo consumo de energa y en el cuidado del medio ambiente el emprendimiento ecocemento sa tiene adems un ingrediente econmicoambiental ms que interesante este cemento ecolgico tienecomo insumo esencial un residuo la escoria de consumo especfico de energa el proceso que se realiza en esta planta comprende el almacenaje transporte y dosificacin de materias primas como as tambin la molienda el embolsado y despacho del producto demanda y contribuir a la transicin hacia un futuro incluyente y net zero para afrontar este reto lanz ecoplanet la lnea ms amplia de cemento verde del mundo que permite reducir sus emisiones hasta un 50 por ciento es decir 38 kg de co2 por tonelada de material cementante con un desempeo igual o superior al del cemento tradicional marco maccarelli presidente ejecutivo de holcim colombia explica que ecoplanet ofrece ventajas circulares y de bajas emisiones de carbono al introducir un novedoso sistema de molienda separada reconocido por el ministerio de ciencia tecnologa e innovacin adems cuenta crecimiento ecolgico precis ecoplanet ofrece dos niveles ecoplanet con mnimo 30 por ciento de reduccin en huella de carbono y ecoplanet zero con una huella de carbono neutra basada en una formulacin complementan el portafolio de soluciones ecoinnovadoras que holcim desarrolla desde hace unos aos en 2020 introdujo en el mercado ecopact una amplia y avanzada gama de concreto ecolgico para crear de carbono desde 30 por ciento hasta ciento por ciento ms baja en comparacin con el concreto estndar su perfil de sostenibilidad est impulsado por materias primas bajas en emisiones al igual que ecoplanet por la descarbonizacin de sus operaciones incluido el uso de combustibles alternativos esta lnea de concretos cuenta con cuatro presentaciones segn el nivel de reduccin de co2 ecopact 3050 de cemento se obtiene con el aprovechamiento de la escoria arcilla separada del material ferroso de los altos hornos de las siderrgicas y la matriz energtica o la energa elctrica gastada en el proceso grupo del coppe indican la existencia de alrededor de 10 millones de t de residuos disponibles para la utilizacin por parte de la industria del cemento entre 15 y 2 millones son de cenizas de la quema del bagazo de caa que sobran de las calderas y los generadores para la produccin de energa elctrica para el abastecimiento de los propios centrales las cenizas del bagazo son ricas en slice amorfo desde 2017 cornare viene apoyando y supervisando el desarrollo del proyecto de la empresa argos presentado hoy en la maana en medelln con el que la compaa iniciar la fabricacin y distribucin de cemento verde en su planta roclaro proceso que cont con una inversin superior a los usd 78 millones se trata de una actividad en la cual se disminuye el uso del tradicional clnker material base para la elaboracin del cemento gracias a la incorporacin de arcillas activadas trmicamente puzolana artificial lo que hace que el cemento sea ms amigable con el medioambiente con este proyecto estamos siendo protagonistas de la industria y sembrando las semillas del argos del futuro que arranca hoy una nueva lnea de produccin en roclaro pero que tiene un potencial gigantesco de crecimiento en todas las geografas no solo desde el punto de vista del producto sino porque es una accin concreta por la sostenibilidad de nuestra industria explic juan esteban calle presidente de cementos argos por su parte javier parra bedoya director general de cornare manifest su complacencia por el proyecto y expres que se trata de una muestra del ejercicio de la gestin ambiental en la regin y en colombia esta iniciativa de argos hace que se disminuyan los indicadores de impacto en la generacin de energa necesaria para la produccin del cemento y los consumos de agua requeridos por eso felicitamos a la empresa por ese trabajo tan representativo en materia de crecimiento verde puntualiz segn manifest la compaa esta innovacin hace que durante el proceso de produccin se reduzcan hasta 38 las emisiones de co2 y 30 el consumo de energa en comparacin con el estndar de la industria para el tradicional cemento portland tambin indicaron que este nuevo producto mantiene la calidad y el desempeo que siempre los ha caracterizado la empresa argos especficamente la planta roclaro ha venido evidenciando un importante liderazgo en el uso de combustibles alternativos y bsqueda de sustitutos de sus materias primas con el fin de disminuir los impactos ambientales generados en el desarrollo de su actividad productiva y realizar un aporte a la sostenibilidad a travs de la disposicin final de algunos residuos slidos acciones que cornare como autoridad ambiental ha venido validando y controlando permanentemente esta y otras iniciativas de la empresa como el coprocesamiento de llantas es decir la sustitucin parcial del combustible convencional por un residuo llantas y el reciente licenciamiento ambiental para el coprocesamiento de residuos peligrosos en 2019 son para cornare motivo de satisfaccin y reconocimiento toda vez que su proceso productivo se desarrolla desde el cumplimiento de los estndares medioambientales ms exigentes con la implementacin de las tecnologas ms limpias e innovadoras y aportan al desarrollo socioeconmico de la regin a las urbes popularmente se les llama junglas de concreto pero de verde tienen poco hoy en da el desarrollo de cemento ecolgico podra reducir las emisiones del c02 y crear un entorno ms amable con el medio ambiente el concreto es el pilar de la industria de la construccin ya que es el material ms usado en el mundo para este sector 1 en una poca donde la urbanizacin avanza a pasos agigantados no podemos imaginar una ciudad sin ver gris por todas partes de ah el caracterstico sobrenombre que se les ha dado a las metrpolis la jungla de concreto sin embargo aunque es imprescindible el material tambin es uno de los mayores generadores de gases del efecto invernadero a nivel mundial ya que se estima que por s solo produce 4 del total de co lo cual representa niveles como los del sector de la minera o hierro y acero ante esta problemtica los profesionales de la construccin han optado por desarrollar y usar tecnologa que modifique el concreto comn a uno ms sustentable que tenga beneficios para el planeta pero tambin para el consumidor final el llamado concreto verde puede ser fabricado a partir de deshechos tales como cscara de arroz cenizas o micro silicatos entre otros adems de usar menos cemento en su composicin en un estimado por cada tonelada fabricada de cemento se producen 09 toneladas de co la ventaja del concreto sustentable es que utiliza solo la mitad del material contaminante de lo que comnmente se empleara 2 adems de su principal ventaja ecolgica el concreto verde tambin sirve mejor en el aislamiento trmico que los convencionales debido a los materiales que lo conforman con lo que tambin se pueden aminorar costos en la energa de calefaccin o enfriamiento este producto es reciclable en su totalidad por lo que no se desechan los residuos como con otros materiales de construccin lo cual contribuye a aminorar la huella ecolgica que deja la industria en el mundo dicha innovacin es prometedora es por ello que diversas empresas alrededor del mundo se han preocupado por desarrollar investigacin en este campo un caso destacable es el de la empresa cemex quien en 2021 puso a prueba en pars su concreto hecho con productos bajos en carbono al contribuir con este material para la edificacin de duo towers un proyecto residencial de rascacielos diseado por ateliers jean nouvel 3 segn voceros de la empresa el objetivo de este material es reducir la huella de carbono de los edificios por lo que tambin participaron en el reciclaje de residuos de la obra otra marca que apost por materiales ms sustentables es cementos argos ubicada en territorio colombiano la cual invirti 78 millones de dlares en varios aos de investigacin para crear materiales ms amigables con el medio ambiente 4 el cemento bajo en emisiones que cre la empresa latinoamericana promete hasta 38 de reduccin de emisiones de co y disminucin del 30 de consumo de energa lo cual los convirti en los pioneros en su pas en fabricar este material de tipo sustentable con acciones como estas las empresas buscan ayudar a llegar a la meta de alcanzar la neutralidad en carbono para el 2050 compromiso que adoptaron ms de 110 pases en el mundo para lograr que la cantidad de gases de efecto invernadero producido a nivel mundial sea igual al que la tierra puede absorber de manera natural 5 referencias compartir autor angel marn villaseca para la industria de la construccin el concreto es la materia prima por excelencia desde su invencin durante el periodo de la antigua roma hasta nuestros das el concreto se encuentra presente tanto en edificaciones de gran importancia histrica y arquitectnica como en construcciones simples y sencillas no obstante debemos ser conscientes que el concreto es considerado una de las fuentes principales de emisiones de carbono en la construccin ante esta situacin se debe pensar en nuevas estrategias que hagan de este popular material una opcin sustentable para la construccin por ello la opcin de un concreto verde suena como una alternativa viable para la construccin del maana pero qu es un concreto verde la industria cementera lo ha definido como un concreto que posee las caractersticas de fraguado y resistencia muy similares o incluso superiores a las de los concretos convencionales pero su proceso de elaboracin refleja una reduccin significativa en la cantidad de emisiones a la atmsfera para lograr este objetivo los procesos de elaboracin de concretos verdes se diferencian de los convencionales al cambiar la materia prima del cemento e incluso el cemento mismo por alternativas sostenibles de aglutinantes que no requieran de horneado a altas temperaturas adems de alterar su composicin qumica para reducir las reacciones qumicas que se producen durante el fraguado y de esta manera tambin reducir las emisiones en el proceso de produccin en mxico existen concreteras que han apostado fuertemente en las cadenas de produccin de los concretos verdes pues la meta es reducir las emisiones de ciertas marcas de concreto entre un 30 y hasta un 100 sin duda se trata de una misin ambiciosa que ya se esta volviendo tangible en algunas plantas de concreto alrededor del mundo adems el sector de la construccin ya ha vuelto a mirar otros productos que se requieren en obra que tambin resultan altamente contaminantes tales como adhesivos colorantes mamposteras entre otros y ya se ha comenzado a investigar cmo a partir del concreto verde se pueden generar soluciones similares para la diferente gama de materiales que se utilizan en la construccin el concreto verde se suma a la serie de esfuerzos para generar proyectos de construccin ms amigables con el ambiente y redefinir la manera en que construimos actividad se ha reducido a mnimos est formada atendiendo a los datos de oficemen la agrupacin de fabricantes de cementos de espaa por 9 grupos empresariales y ms de 30 factoras en las que se elabora esta mezcla de piedra caliza y arcilla la agenda sectorial del sector cementero espaol elaborada en 2018 indica que emplea a unas 4 000 personas de manera directa y 1 800 indirectas aunque su influencia como sector estratgico alcanza a otros 30 000 empleos ligados a sectores asociados como la explotacin de ridos hormign los prefabricados y otras reas de la construccin dos de estas instalaciones se ubican en galicia la fbrica de cementos cosmos en ourol sarria lugo perteneciente al grupo votorantim con una capacidad de produccin de 650 000 toneladas al ao de cementos y de 450 000 de clinker y la planta de molienda almacenamiento y expedicin de cemento situada en narn a corua de cementos tudela vegun propiedad del grupo empresarial masaveu con una capacidad de 600 000 toneladas de cemento al ao pero la importancia de la industria cementera va ms all de los datos del propio sector desde hace aos el cemento es uno de los principales indicadores del crecimiento de una economa seala el avance o retroceso de la obra pblica la apuesta de la iniciativa privada con inversiones y tambin la salud de la actividad exterior los datos recopilados por oficemen en 2020 reflejan con fidelidad lo ocurrido en el que ser recordado por uno de los peores aos econmicamente hablando a causa de la pandemia en el ao 2020 el consumo de cemento en nuestro pas retroceda algo ms de un 9 anual situndose en cifras similares a finales de los aos 60 la perspectiva en 2021 es algo ms positiva y ha enfilado el camino a recuperar los niveles prepandemia los de 2019 con cerca de 15 000 000 toneladas al igual que las exportaciones que podran volver a rondar los 6 millones de toneladas el proceso de fabricacin del cemento tradicional el denominado cemento portland y sus variantes tiene varios puntos crticos comienza en las canteras con la extraccin de ridos como calizas y pizarras principalmente contina por su trituracin y molienda para seguidamente llevarlo a coccin en hornos cuyas reacciones qumicas dan como resultado el clinker este es el componente clave del cemento y el responsable de que se endurezca con rapidez tras su mezcla con agua es precisamente la fase de obtencin del clinker la que ms energa necesita pues debe alcanzar una temperatura de 1500 grados pero tambin la que emite la mayor parte de co2 a la atmsfera teniendo en cuenta todo el proceso en este punto se han volcado universidades y empresas privadas que llevan investigando durante aos una de las lneas de trabajo es la sustitucin del tipo de combustibles utilizados en la coccin que alcancen una energa tan elevada pero con una menor afectacin a la atmsfera tradicionalmente se usaban combustibles fsiles como el carbn un recurso no renovable en ese sentido la industria cementera ha servido para valorizar algunos residuos que directamente solo ocuparan un espacio en vertedero valorizndolos energticamente una recuperacin que tambin alcanza a otros residuos minerales procedentes de diferentes industrias que pasan a formar parte de la materia prima del cemento que es otra de las reas a desarrollar de hecho se estudia con ahnco cmo reducir o sustituir el clnker con alto contenido en calcio derivado de las piedras calizas usadas por otros materiales como escoria de altos hornos entre otros el proceso de modernizacin de los hornos y la bsqueda de materias primas requerir sin duda un enorme esfuerzo inversor no hay ms que dar cuenta de algunos desembolsos realizados por ejemplo en multinacionales francesas y colombianas para obtener productos con una reduccin importante de emisiones y con nuevas mezclas dotndolas adems de declaraciones ambientales de producto en otros casos las administraciones pblicas como la unin europea estn aportando financiacin para ayudar a la industria en la bsqueda de materiales cementantes suplementarios con una baja emisin de dixido de carbono hablamos de cemshale cemtower desarrollado por la firma danesa cemgreen y cuyo proyecto de investigacin se extender hasta septiembre de 2022 o del proyecto eco binder que se prueba desde 2018 en italia espaa bulgaria y reino unido inversiones que tambin deben soportar al menos por el momento el elevado coste elctrico que sacude a buena parte de europa y la competencia de otras cementeras sobre todo de los grandes productores como china e india sin planes de reduccin de emisiones muy claros otra de las lneas de trabajo que no se puede entender de forma aislada sino en conjunto del resto de medidas es la captacin y almacenamiento del dixido de carbono generado el cembureau la asociacin europea de cemento indica en varias comunicaciones que el 42 de la reduccin de emisiones de la industria se realizar a travs de estas tcnicas de captacin y reutilizacin de co2 uno de los proyectos financiados por la ue cleanker ha dado buenos resultados evitando adems alterar la parte los hornos rotativos de las plantas todas estas medidas en mayor o menor medida estn en ciernes y por delante menos de 30 aos para desarrollar una hoja de ruta que ya ha sido trazada por la industria europea del cemento para alcanzar la descarbonizacin total y en la que recuerdan es necesario el apoyo institucional y polticas activas por parte de los diferentes gobiernos definitions and scopes from standards initiatives and policies around the world authors ali hasanbeigi and adam sibal the cement and concrete industry is one of the most energy and carbonintensive industries worldwide the cement industry accounts for around 7 of global co2 emissions with a global production volume of 41 billion tonnes of cement and 140 billion m3 of concrete produced in 2020 in the concrete production process the creation of cement is responsible for approximately 88 of the co2 emissions through the direct emissions in the calcination step and fuel combustion demand growth is anticipated in the sector globally despite a slowdown in many countries including china as demand in developing nations continues to grow since 2015 the emissions intensity of cement production has increased globally despite slowing slightly to a 1 increase in 2022 the iea estimates that the emissions intensity of cement production needs to reverse its current trend and see an annual emissions intensity decrease of 4 through 2030 to remain on track for the world to reach the target of the paris climate agreement in decarbonizing the global cement and concrete industry standards protocols initiatives and government policies have a significant role to play in recent years major growth has been seen in the number of standards protocols initiatives and policies focused on decreasing the emissions from cement and concrete production an additional level of complexity is introduced into the current efforts to decarbonize the cement and concrete industry whereby the standards protocols initiatives and policies tend to focus on either the producers of cement and concrete the demand side of cement and concrete procurement the finance and funding side or some combination thereof however through the sheer number of standards protocols initiatives and policies and the variation and complexity in features target audience assessment boundaries targets pathways requirements reporting certifications and validation procedures there has not yet been a cohesive report that compiles the information in one place to support industry government and other stakeholders in achieving the goal to decarbonize the cement and concrete industry in this report what are green cement and concrete we aim to address this information gap and bring together a summary of the current major standards protocols initiatives and government policies focused on reaching the goal of greenlowcarbon cement and concrete production and decarbonization of this sector additionally we provide a clear indication of whether a standard initiative or policy directs its focus on the cement and concrete producers the demand side of cement and concrete procurement andor the finance and funding sectors we assessed five different standards and protocols eg wris ghg protocols for cement climate bonds initiatives criteria for climate bonds for the cement and concrete industry fifteen different initiatives and benchmarks eg industrial deep decarbonization initiative iddi science based target initiative for cement sbti first movers coalition initiative and the concretezero initiative and several selected policies from some of the worlds largest cement and concrete producing countriesregions ie the eu us china india japan south korea and canada we also review the whole lifecycle building embodied carbon policies currently enacted in various countries us states and cities we additionally present a firstofitskind crosscomparison matrix that compiles the currently disaggregated standards protocols initiatives and policies key information into one table to aid industry government nongovernment organizations and academia in quickly comparing major standards protocols initiatives and policies that are currently in place or soontobereleased at the time of writing this report this indepth review of the global standards protocols and initiatives related to the decarbonization of the global cement and concrete industry also investigates the cement and concrete market focus areas table 1 each of these is discussed in detail in the body of this report table 1 summary of the focus of the current cement and concrete industry standards protocols and initiatives as can be seen in the table compared to other standards and initiatives for concrete the first movers coalition has set the most ambitious targets for lowcarbon concrete followed closely by the concretezero initiative the california buy clean program if formally signed into law will utilize the first movers coalitions definition and would be the most ambitious lowcarbon concrete emissions intensity requirement it should be noted however that the lowest definitions of lowcarbon concrete adopted by concrete zero targets 30 50 and 100 of concrete procurement under this threshold by 2025 2030 and 2050 respectively while the first movers coalition requires 10 of the procurement to fall under their target values while other requirements apply to all procurement additionally of the definitions of low carbon concrete all of the standards initiatives and policies have adopted a stepwise emissions intensity increase as compressive strength increases except for concretezero also shown in figure 1 many of the policy requirements for procurement of low carbon concrete set by the us general services administration and inflation reduction act ira requirements and those of many state and county levels policies follow closely with or exceed the us national average concrete emissions intensities additionally some standards protocols initiatives and policies have no set target number stated others such as the science based targets initiative climate action 100 and concrete sustainability council utilize a relative approach to an industry baseline some align closer with the paris agreements 15 c target while others do not there are also apparent differences in the disclosure requirements and verification processes across the board this report also finds that the policies of the worlds major cement and concreteproducing countries vary significantly for example the us canada and japan have stated targets of obtaining net zero cement and concrete production by 2050 and china by 2060 india has a goal to reach carbon neutrality in 2070 to obtain these goals individual nations can drive down their cement and concrete industry emissions by implementing green public procurement gpp programs with emissions intensity thresholds for the cement and concrete they procure as is being done currently in the us and many of its states california new york and colorado with planned gpp programs more broadly in development in canada for cement and concrete we find that in many of the nations assessed in this study the primary emissions reduction policies are being carried out through energy efficiency legislation as seen in india japan south korea and china nations can additionally implement other policies and regulations andor incentive programs to lower their cement and concrete production emissions intensities through the adoption of technologies and measures such as material efficiency fuel switching to lownocarbon fuels decreasing clinker ratios increased utilization of supplemental cementitious materials and ccus upon completing a thorough analysis of the various cement and concrete industry decarbonization standards protocols initiatives and policies the following four key focus areas were identified as crucial to meeting paris agreement goals and decarbonizing the cement and concrete industry 1 a standard protocol initiative or policy should be aligned with the paris agreement 15c target deep decarbonization of the cement and concrete industry is crucial to achieving the paris agreement target 2 standards protocols initiatives and policies should consider scope 1 2 and 3 emissions and provide clear boundary definitions for the calculation of their emissions guidelines this will allow the industry to move forward consistently in achieving the deep decarbonization targets 3 definitions of greenlow carbon cement and concrete should be harmonized to limit confusion for producers consumers and policymakers 4 the reliability and availability of product and plantlevel data should be increased which will be very important to continue to monitor the progress of the industry and help in the identification of areas for approvement to achieve deep decarbonization it should be noted that cement and concrete companies and plants and most governments collect and have all the data needed to comply with the requirements of the standards protocols initiatives and policies listed in this report although such data and information may not be publicly available our study shows that there are several standards and protocols and many initiatives and policies related to the decarbonization of the cement and concrete industry these standards protocols initiatives and government policies often serve different purposes and address different segments or aspects of the cement and concrete value chain some target the demand side while others target the supply side of the cement and concrete value chain some may be targeted toward the finance community while some are for green public procurement policies therefore it may not be possible to only have one standard for all purposes these initiatives and policies are trying to serve in addition given the different contexts in which the cement and concrete industry operates in different countries it is impractical to assume that a single standard would be used in all countries for all purposes around the world instead we may need a few highquality standards and protocols that are aligned with each other as much as possible it is imperative that these few standards and protocols communicate and coordinate with each other to align their requirement and reduce the burden on the cement and concrete industry and other stakeholders such as policy makers as much as possible also it is critical to bring developing countries perspectives into decarbonization standards and initiatives in chapter 2 of this report we present a firstofitskind crosscomparison matrix that compiles the currently disaggregated standards protocols initiatives and policies key information into one table to help industry government nongovernment organizations and other stakeholders quickly compare major publications grant quasha ceo of eco material technologies at one of the companys manufacturing facilities picture the pantheon in rome considering that it was built in ce 128 it has held together remarkably well under the footsteps of hundreds of millions of visitors over the centuries if the ancient romans could build something so longlasting why on earth do our modern roads have so many potholes the answer lies in the romans ingenious selfhealing concretethe science of which was recently revealed by researchers at mit now a team out of texas and utah eco material technologies is building on ancient romes knowhow with advances in modern material science to create a strong erosionresistant and quicksetting concrete that practically eliminates carbon emissions associated with what has always been known as a hardtoabate industry eco material technologies is a hightech cement companya combination of words that seems incongruous but is nonetheless completely appropriate the company has a goal of reducing and eventually eliminating the 8 of global carbon emissions stemming from the production of cement which acts as the key ingredient in our civilizations most important building material concrete eco material was cofounded by john t prestona respected leader from mits licensing officeis led by grant quashaa harvardeducated businessman with a deep history in materials businessesand received funding from a consortium of smartmoney private equity players the companys technology allows for what would otherwise be hazardous landfill materialthe ash waste of coalfired power plantsto be treated in such a way as to create a strong durable and quicksetting cement that has already proven itself on the sundrenched highways of texas the amazing thing about eco materials technology from a climate perspective is that it avoids virtually all the carbon emissions related to manufacturing cementa big win in the fight to restore our planets carbon cycle imbalance if this sounds like a company you would like to invest in hold on quasha expects the firm to ipo within the next few years eco material was formed in 2022 the product of a bold privateequity backed buyout of the north american assets of australian firm boral ltdan operation with decades of history in the statesby an innovative texas startup called green cement green cement had been developing low and zerocarbon cement technology for over a decade the private equity groups involved in the buyout are smart money playersone equity partners formerly part of jp morgan and global private equity giant warburg pincus green cements ceo at the time of eco materials founding grant quasha is a harvard grad twice over and is a seasoned executive with deep experience in materials and in infrastructure investing the boral assets that quashas venture acquired were focused on the management and harvesting of fly asha byproduct of the coal combustion process that has long been used as a component of many concrete blends borals history goes back decades and you can think of it as the old economy pillar of the eco material house the green cement side of the business was cofounded in 2010 by john t preston a venture capitalist and entrepreneur who previously ran technology licensing at mit and worked there as the interface between research and industry for 30 years preston has said that he has founded something like 300 companies and that he believed the concept and impact of green cement was so attractive he became ceo of the company at its founding the green cement part of the business forms eco materials hightech pillar the merger of green cement and borals north american assets was also partly funded by the issuance of a green bond based on eco material technologys ability to reduce cementrelated carbon emissions to appreciate the astounding breakthrough made by eco material its helpful to understand something about cement in general you can think of cement as something like powdered glue civil engineers call it a binding agent mix that powdered glue with sand and pebbles known as aggregates in the business and add water and you create a very handy synthetic stone that can be poured like gravy in any shape you like this moldable synthetic stone is so handy that it has its own name concrete concrete you might be surprised to learn is the second most widely used substance on earth after h2o the most widely used binding material for concrete today is something known as ordinary portland cement opc there are two important things to know about opc first it is a very old technologyit was first invented around the time george washington was cutting down cherry trees second it is a very dirty technology from a carbon footprint perspective for reasons i discuss in the climate impact section below eco material has discovered an improved way to manufacture a lowcarbon pozzolanic cement that is similar but better than the pozzolanic cement the ancient romans used pozzolans are a broad class of materials containing silica and alumina the most commonly available commercial source of pozzolans is the fly ash that borals business specialized in by themselves and without special treatment pozzolans like fly ash possess almost no value as a cement component however one of the waste byproducts of the opc manufacturing process is a compound that turns fly ash into a strong durable cement when mixed with water as such fly ash has long been mixed with opc to increase the durability of concrete produced with it the carbon footprint of the pozzolanic portion of opc is zero so if you add 10 fly ash to opc you decrease the opcs carbon footprint by 10 one problem with adding fly ash is that there is only so much waste within opc to react with so the maximum amount of zerocarbon pozzolans able to be added to opc was typically around 20 percent old roman cement used 100 pozzolans mined from volcanoes using a different manufacturing process the problem with that type of pozzolanic cement is that it takes a long time to curethat might have been okay for people without cars or email like emperor octavian but is not great for modern builders the big innovation pioneered by green cement and taken up now by eco material is a proprietary physical and chemical pretreatment of fly ash that turns it into an excellent powdered glue and thus allows it to make up a much larger proportion of cement the company says that using its special process the proportion of fly ash in cement can increase to between 50 and 100 percent increasing the proportion of fly ash in cement mixtures by this much generates an enormous reduction of the carbon footprint of infrastructure projects using concretehighways airports buildings docks etc as the amount of fly ash increases the concrete created with it is less water permeable making it more durable and resistant to road salt and other erosive chemicals in an industry not usually associated with technological innovation eco materials product represents nothing less than a stepchange revolution eco materials innovation with regards to reduced carbon footprints should be obvious from the discussion above but its fly ash harvesting business also enables impressive environmental benefits as well on the climate side roughly 8 of global carbon dioxide emissions come from cement manufacturing opc is created by superheating limestone caco3usually by burning coaluntil its chemical bonds crack and the resultant chemicals combine with other compounds to form the powdered glue we know as cement burning coal to heat the limestone actually generates only about half the carbon dioxide that cracking the limestone does as such even if heating the limestone could be done by a cleaner fuel which is something like impossible the very process of creating opc would still create huge amounts of carbon dioxide currently opc manufacturing results in approximately one ton of co2 emissions for every ton of cement produced no heating is involved in the manufacturing of eco materials green cement so no coal or other fossil fuels need to be burned the use of fly ash as a feedstock eliminates the need to use limestone at all let alone to superheat it the result of eco materials innovation is that the company can manufacture a cement for use in strong durable concrete that can reduce the carbon footprint associated with its production by an amazing 99 considering the large footprint of cement manufacturing and the ubiquity of concrete in building projects the world over this large of a reductionif the process could be scaled and propagated globally as an industry best practicewould have a four times greater carbon footprint effect than the complete abolition of air travel eco materials technology also confers some impressive ecological and public safety benefits as well eco material is mining ash that otherwise would simply sit in landfills until the end of time and putting it to productive use as such it is turning a linear industrial revolution paradigm model into a circular one coalfueled power plants burn coal and create electricity co2 and ash more than 2 billion tons of ash have been disposed in the united states in landfills sometimes these ash reservoirs burst as happened disastrously in tennessee in 2008 so communities do not like them in their backyards electricity generators are under steadily increasing regulatory scrutiny regarding these ash ponds and landfills which means steadily increasing operating costs for them eco materials boral acquisition gives it the ability to source fly ash from existing coalfueled power plants and to harvest previously disposed ash at utility sites for instance eco material just announced an expanded partnership with georgia power to remove millions of tons of fly ash from two of their landfills for use in concrete thereby permanently removing the ash from a disposal setting to manufacture the most important building material of the modern age this arrangement is good for georgia power good for the health of the communities near the disposal sites and once the ash is turned into green cement good for the planet as well eco materials main product line is a legacy of the boral purchase that supplies fly ash from coalfueled power plants to concrete producers nationwide through this activity eco material calculates that it has brought about carbon reductions in the concrete sector on the order of 6 million tons per year for decades the green cement part of the business adds significant intellectual property to the process and allows for fly ash to be processed in a way that paves the way to a 100 opc replacement eco material has been bringing the cost of production down with years of research and development so now a cement that is 50 comprised of fly ash which the company calls pozzoslag is priced the same as unalloyed opc because of the greenhouse gas reduction discussed above projects that eco material has already done with the department of transportation in my old home state of texashave generated half the carbon footprint they would have 20 years ago simply because they used pozzoslag as a cement the 100 fly ash mixturewhich the company calls pozzocemis a premium product costing a little more than three times what opc costs while that price compares favorably to competitors products quasha believes that pozzocem will become costcompetitive with opc over time the companys new premium product cures so quickly and is so erosion resistant and safe it is currently being used to create 3dprinted houses near austin texas eco material technologies pozzocem product sets so quickly it is being used to 3d print new houses in a subdivision in round rock texas there has been a lot of money flowing into low carbon footprint cement manufacturers lately but the elegance of eco materials solution awes me especially when i consider the case of the developing worldheavy reliance on coalfired power plants coupled with huge infrastructure building projectseco materials solution looks like it has the potential to provide a huge win on multiple fronts the fact that eco material provides a product that is superior to legacy offerings in every wayin terms of functionality price and reduced carbon footprintmakes its solution very attractive teslas are greatthey accelerate like formula 1 racersuntil the batteries run out when youre between cities in contrast eco materials products offer nothing but positives as far as i can see quasha and his team know as i know that we need to start radically rethinking our approach to infrastructure and radically reducing our carbon footprint if we are to continue building highways into the next century
