explore all categories blending traditional and modern styles in indian home construction going green and sustainability have become more than just buzzwords its a way of business that pays off climate change and pollution are exerting an overarching impact on the earths socioeconomic and ecosystems but what does it mean to go green or ecofriendly and how important is the sustainability quotient when using construction materials for home construction these days sustainability is essentially making something that lasts long it improves the quality of life protects the ecosystem and is a key to a better future the primary idea behind using sustainable building materials is to construct a structure that lasts a longerlasting structure or home means lower maintenance costs the idea of sustainable construction integrates a variety of strategies during the design construction and operation of the building concrete is a building material that is used the most in any construction most of the infrastructure in the world has been built using concrete in some or the other form the chemical processes that convert limestone into calcium oxide are the major cause of the co2 emissions as per the reports traditional cement production of 42 billion tons amounts to about 8 of the global co2 emissions this number can be reduced to a significant extent by replacing the traditional cement with green cement roughly 60 less thermal energy is consumed in green cement production than the ordinary portland cement it also reduces the urban heat island effect by increasing the concrete reflectivity green cement uses a carbonnegative process of manufacturing the major raw materials used to produce green cement include mostly the discarded waste from the industry the slag from the blast furnace and fly ash are the chief materials used in the manufacturing of green cement this is also the reason why the cost of green cement is way less than traditional cement want to know more about selecting the right materials get an expert consultation with jsw one homes types of green cement geopolymer cement also called alkaliactivated cement geopolymer cement is made by reacting aluminate and silicatebearing materials with activators like fly ash or slag from iron and metal production it is the most suitable substitute for ordinary portland cement opc and emits 95 less co2 calcium sulfoaluminate cement csa this cement is produced by burning csa clinker from limestone bauxite and calcium sulfate at around 1250 degrees celsius and blending the clinker with 1525 gypsum because of its early strength development the setting time of this kind of cement is rapid it is known for its remarkable performance in aggressive exposure conditions magnesium oxychloride cement sorel cement or magnesium oxychloride cement is manufactured from the aqueous reaction between the two byproducts of magnesium mining namely magnesium oxide powder and a concentrated solution of magnesium chloride although moc has excellent mechanical properties its poor water resistance reduces its strength however that can be offset by using additives like fly ash sequestrated carbon cement this cement is made by using seawater and brine compounded with co2 in the manufacturing process the gases that consist of co2 are filtered through seawater the compressive strength of concrete with sequestration of co2 gas is higher than that of concrete without sequestration ekkomaxx cement ekkomaxx cement is a rigorously engineered cement with better durability corrosion resistance higher early strength development improved volume stability and low retained moisture as per the united states green building council this cement has nearly zero carbon footprint ferrocrete ferrocrete or ferrocement is a relatively thin structural composite material made by switching layers of welded steel wire meshes and cement mortar ferrocement is a widely used cement alternative in the construction industry due to low selfweight lack of skilled workers and no need for a framework cement is largely the most essential resource for constructing homes however cement manufacturing is extremely energy intensive and contributes significantly to the global warning which needs immediate cutback in this endeavor the implementation of green production practices and technologies in the cement sector is imperative for india because the country is the second biggest producer worldwide when choosing building materials it is also important to consider the lifespan of the material a good design is achievable only with quality materials and hence materials are the solution to a good functioning building at jsw cement is produced from the slag produced during the steelmaking process slag is extremely effective in reducing permeability and adds to the concrete durability this can replace 7080 of ordinary portland cement in most constructions jsw green cement is indias first cement to receive the coveted green pro certification for portland slag cement from the confederation of indian industry indian green building council construction is responsible for a substantial amount of material and energy consumption there are so many ecofriendly materials in construction available these days long dismissed for being costlier the myth has finally started to bust and green materials are seeing a surge in popularity if youre planning to build a home make sure to incorporate the use of sustainable and ecofriendly materials like green cement and in the long run you will certainly save a lot of money owing to lesser maintenance and more durability besides enjoying better health and conserving the environment for both current and future generations share india a land steeped in sustainable energy solutions importance of choosing the right solar panels for optimal efficiency and costeffectiveness efficiency different types of solar panels for home have varying efficiencies in converting sunlight into electricity higher efficiency panels generate more electricity per square metre and are ideal for homes with limited roof space durability and longevity when it comes to solar panel manufacturers in india highquality panels are built to last and withstand various weather conditions choosing reputable solar panel companies in india with longer warranties ensures longevity and reliability costeffectiveness while higher efficiency solar panels often come with a higher initial cost they can result in greater longterm savings by producing more electricity over their lifespan its essential to consider the balance between upfront cost and longterm savings adaptability and aesthetics some types of solar panels are designed for specific roof or aesthetic preferences choosing panels that suit your roof structure and design preferences can enhance the overall appeal of your home installation and maintenance choosing solar panels for home that are easier to install and require minimal maintenance can save you time and additional costs in the long run how solar panels work photon absorption sunlight consists of tiny particles called photons when sunlight hits different types of solar panels the panels photovoltaic cells typically made of silicon absorb these photons electron excitation when the photons are absorbed they transfer their energy to the electrons in the silicon atoms of the solar cells this energy absorption excites the electrons causing them to break free from their atoms electric field generation the structure of the best solar panels in india for homes has an electric field across the layers of silicon this field acts as a force that drives the loose electrons towards a particular direction creating a flow of electricity electrical conductors conductive metal plates within different types of solar panels capture these moving electrons forming an electric current this current is then drawn out of the solar panel via metal conductors to be used as electricity inverter conversion the electricity generated by the solar panels is in direct current dc form which is converted into alternating current ac by an inverter ac is the standard form of electricity used in homes and businesses utilisation or storage the converted ac electricity can be used to power devices and appliances in the home or can be stored in batteries for later use especially when sunlight is not available such as during nighttime different types of solar panels available in the indian market monocrystalline solar panels polycrystalline also known as multicrystalline solar panels thinfilm solar panels factors to consider when buying solar panels efficiency rating type of solar cells durability and build quality temperature coefficient contact us for the best consultation warranty and performance guaranteepay attention to warranties offered by manufacturers a longer warranty especially for performance indicates the manufacturers confidence in their products durabilityperformance warranties ensure that the panel will produce a certain percentage of its rated power over time testing and certificationlook for certifications and testing compliance such as iec international electrotechnical commission certifications ul underwriters laboratories listings or certifications from local regulatory bodiescertified panels often undergo rigorous testing for performance and safety standards degradation ratesolar panels degrade over time losing efficiency gradually the degradation rate indicates how much efficiency is lost per yearlower degradation rates mean the panels will maintain higher efficiency levels for a longer period compatibility and system designensure that the panels you choose are compatible with your existing or planned solar system components inverters batteries etcoptimal system design and component compatibility can significantly impact overall system efficiency estimating your households energy consumption and determining the size of the solar panel system required keep in mind that these calculations provide a general guideline factors like future energy needs changes in lifestyle or selecting construction materials its essential to understand the climate of the region where the home will be built india experiences a range of climates from hot and humid in coastal areas to hot and dry in desert regions and temperate in hilly areas materials should be tailored to the specific environment to optimise thermal comfort insulation materials insulation is crucial in keeping homes cool in hot climates by minimising heat transfer from outside to inside consider materials with high thermal resistance rvalue such as expanded polystyrene eps foam extruded polystyrene xps foam or mineral wool these materials can be installed in walls roofs and floors to reduce heat gain and loss have queries get a consultation from our experts reflective roofing materials roofs can absorb significant solar heat in hot climates making the interior spaces uncomfortably warm opt for reflective roofing materials such as white tiles cool roof coatings or metal sheets with reflective coatings these materials reflect solar radiation instead of absorbing it keeping the roof surface and the interior cooler natural ventilation incorporate materials and design features that promote natural ventilation allowing cool air to flow through the home and flush out hot air use breathable wall finishes operable windows louvres and ventilated facades to facilitate cross ventilation and promote air circulation high thermal mass materials materials with high thermal mass such as concrete stone or clay can help regulate indoor temperatures by absorbing heat during the day and releasing it slowly at night incorporate these materials strategically in the building envelope such as in walls or floors to stabilise indoor temperatures and reduce the need for mechanical cooling green building materials consider using ecofriendly and sustainable materials with natural insulating properties and low embodied energy examples include bamboo straw bales rammed earth and compressed earth blocks these materials help keep homes more relaxed contribute to environmental conservation and reduce carbon footprint shading devices use shading devices such as overhangs pergolas awnings and trellises to block direct sunlight from entering windows and doors especially on the south and westfacing facades choose materials for shading devices that provide adequate solar protection while allowing diffused natural light to enter the interior spaces centrally placed courtyards position courtyards centrally within the home layout to maximise cross ventilation and airflow courtyards act as natural air wells drawing in cool air from the surrounding spaces and facilitating air movement throughout the interior design the home with taller openings or skylights around the courtyard to encourage the stack effect where warm air rises and escapes through vents or openings at higher levels creating a natural cooling effect and improving air circulation proper siting and orientation consider the homes orientation and relationship to the suns path throughout the day orient the building to maximise natural shading and ventilation opportunities use landscaping elements such as trees shrubs and green roofs to provide additional shading and improve microclimate conditions around the home integrating water bodies thoughtful landscaping and centrally placed courtyards into home design allows individual builders to create cooler more comfortable living environments that promote passive cooling energy efficiency and connection with nature these design strategies enhance thermal comfort and contribute to sustainable and resilient homes that harmonise with their surroundings make the smart choice for your next construction project contact jsw one homes today to learn more about our soft sulfate mineral composed of calcium sulfate dihydrate with the chemical formula caso42h2o gypsum is abundant worldwide and it is mined and processed to create a wide range of products used in construction including drywall plaster and cement gypsum has several unique properties that make it an ideal material for use in construction here are some of the main reasons why gypsum is used in your home construction fire resistance one of the essential properties of gypsum is its fire resistance gypsum contains water molecules in its crystal structure which helps it to resist high temperatures and prevent the spread of flames this makes gypsum an ideal material for walls and ceilings where fire resistance is a critical factor sound insulation gypsum is also an excellent sound insulator its porous structure helps to absorb sound waves and reduce noise levels making it an ideal material for use in walls and ceilings to create a quieter and more comfortable living environment durability gypsum is a very durable material that can withstand much wear and tear it is resistant to mould mildew and pests making it less likely to require repairs or replacements this makes it a costeffective and longlasting material for use in construction versatility gypsum is a very versatile material that can be used in various applications it can be moulded into different shapes and sizes to create custom designs and painted or textured to create different finishes this makes it a popular choice for residential and commercial construction sustainability gypsum is a natural material that can be recycled and reused it is also nontoxic and safe for human use which makes it a sustainable and ecofriendly choice for use in construction want to know more about selecting the right materials get an expert consultation with jsw one homes now that we have covered some of the reasons why gypsum is used in home construction lets take a closer look at some of the specific products made from gypsum drywall drywall also known as gypsum board or plasterboard is one of the most common building materials made from gypsum it is a flat panel made from a core of gypsum sandwiched between two layers of paper or fibreglass drywall creates interior walls and ceilings in homes offices and other buildings drywall is easy to install and can be cut to fit any size or shape it is also very costeffective making it a popular choice for use in construction in addition to its fireresistant and soundinsulating properties drywall is also an effective barrier against moisture which helps prevent mould and mildew growth plaster plaster is another popular building material made from gypsum it is a mixture of gypsum powder and water applied to walls and ceilings to create a smooth surface plaster is typically applied in several layers and can be sanded and painted to create a finished look plaster is a very versatile material that can be used to create custom designs and finishes it is also very durable and resistant to wear and tear making it a popular choice in hightraffic areas like hallways and staircases cement gypsum is also used in the production of cement cement is a binding agent used in construction to hold materials like bricks and stones together it is made from a mixture of limestone clay and gypsum which is ground into a fine powder and heated to high temperatures to create a chemical reaction that forms the cement gypsum is used in cement production because it helps regulate the cements setting time making it easier to work with in conclusion gypsum is an essential material in the construction industry due to its numerous unique properties such as fire resistance sound insulation durability versatility and sustainability it is used in various products such as drywall plaster and cement which are commonly used in homes offices and other buildings the use of gypsum in construction has contributed to the creation of safer more promoting strong cement as a discerning user you should have some knowledge of cement especially if you are planning to construct a new house mentioned below are some facts that will help you in selecting the best cement for house construction which cement is best for house construction there are three primary types of cement that are generally used for residential house construction 1 ordinary portland cement opc and 2 portland pozzolana cement ppc and 3 portland slag cement psc opc it is one of the most common types of cement that is used to construct houses it is manufactured via a chemical combination of calcium iron aluminium silicon and other ingredients in highly controlled conditions opc cement that is used in residential construction is available in three different grades 33 grade 43 grade and 53 grade 33 grade this grade of opc cement is predominantly used for smallscale construction wherein the strength of concrete does not really matter for example smallhouse construction 43 grade this grade of cement is used in mediumscaled construction activities wherein strength is needed and the concrete must take loads of weight above it for instance a threefloor house 53 grade this cement grade is used in construction activities wherein an enormous strength of concrete is needed this grade of opc cement is primarily used in mass constructions or special projects rather than house construction let the experts help you select the right material ppc the use of ppc is increasing in present times in house construction because it contains pozzolana materials as its active constituents which successfully impart enhanced properties to this type of cement it is manufactured by using pozzolanic materials as one of the primary constituents the percentage of this material should lie in the range of 1030 in contrast to opc cement ppc cement does not have different grades the eventual strength of ppc cement can be compared to opc 43 grade cement ppc is ideal for house construction because it offers a much better performance in the long term in comparison with opc cement psc portland slag cement or psc is a type of blended cement slag is basically a nonmetallic product that is comprised of more than 90 glass along with silicates as well as aluminosilicates of lime psc is produced with a combination of approximately 4550 of slag 4550 of clinker and 35 of gypsum the chemical composition of psc offers numerous advantages over other types of cement besides being ecofriendly it possesses ultimate compressive strength while offering phenomenal resistance to sulphate and chloride attacks this specific feature improves workability while significantly lowering the risks of cracking it is known for its superior finish and minimised shrinkage cracks psc can be successfully used for all types of residential as well as commercial projects it complements the construction of dams and other waterretaining structures because of its high resistance to alkalisilica reactions and amazingly fewer shrinkage cracks it is also used in special structures such as prestressed concrete because of its excellent resistance power to corrosion it is widely used in coastal regions to summarise when it comes to cement required for house construction both opc and ppc are efficient the only factors that play a definitive role while choosing between the two are the setting time and durability while opc has a low setting time ppc requires more setting time so if you want to get rid of the scaffolding in a lesser time then you should opt for opc 43 or 53 grade cement that said if you are ready and willing to extend this setting time ppc would be your ideal bet the sole advantage that ppc has in comparison with opc is durability home construction executed with ppc cement is much more durable than that with opc cement the final word always remember that the cement you select is of utmost significance because it will eventually determine your homes quality life durability and structural integrity if you require expert guidance you can contact jsw one homes share tiles continue to be one of the most desirable natural stone porcelain ceramic or glass they are available in glazed and unglazed varieties and are an excellent way to add colour to your rooms without making them appear fuzzy they are typically installed in bathrooms and kitchens 3 natural stone tiles these tiles include marble granite and limestone among others the durability of these tiles varies based on the material materials such as granite and marble can be used for kitchen counters bathrooms or living rooms 4 vitrified tiles they are processed to ensure durability and resistance to stains scratches and acid they are comparatively cheaper than other variants and are available in a wide range of colours they are ideal for any room 5 quarry tiles these unglazed tiles are highly durable and can be used both indoors and outdoors they are perfect for the kitchen floor tiles for the exterior 1 cement or concrete tiles these tiles are extremely strong and sturdy making them ideal for exterior floors or driveways because they lack a smooth finish they offer an excellent grip even when wet 2 terracotta tiles these are manufactured from natural clay they are highly durable and waterresistant they may be glazed to obtain a wide range of colours and extra durability they are ideal for walls and floors while some variants may be used for your homes roof 3 porcelain tiles these tiles are formulated using claybased materials at an extremely high temperature this process makes these tiles dense highly durable moisture resistant hard and ideal for outdoor tiling 4 slate tiles slate is a natural stone that is formed under extreme heat and pressure this natural formation makes it highly durable and extremely hard which is ideal for outdoor tiling choosing tiles according to the space bathroom for your bathroom ceramic tiles are more preferable glazed ceramic tiles are ideal for bathroom walls but not for the flooring because they get slippery when wet instead antiskid tiles as they offer a nice grip and are safer to walk on even when wet you can add a colour element with the addition of borders to your bathroom tiles to select the right tiles for your home living room when it comes to so its important to choose wisely share a wide array of tests is conducted on bricks to ascertain their quality for the purpose of construction brick testing is carried out in the laboratory as well as at the construction site bricks are arguably one of the oldest and most vital construction materials due to their strength reliability and durability the tests that are needed to determine the suitability of bricks for construction work are discussed below 1 absorption test this test is conducted on bricks to know the total amount of moisture that is absorbed by the brick under extreme conditions during this test a dry brick is taken and weighed post weighing the brick is placed in water for 24 hours after this the wet brick is weighed the difference in the weight of the dry brick and the wet brick is calculated which gives the amount of water absorption for a highquality brick the amount of water absorption must not exceed 20 of the dry brick weight 2 crushing or compressive strength test the crushing strength is determined by placing a brick in a compression testing machine that applies pressure on the brick until it breaks the pressure at which the brick shatters should exceed a minimum of 350 nmm2 any value lower than that indicates that the brick is not suitable for construction get an expert consultation on brick selection for your home 3 hardness test the ideal brick must be able to resist any scratches induced by sharp objects so for this specific test a sharp tool or fingernail is used to create scratches on bricks if there are no impressions of any scratches then the brick is considered to be a hard brick 4 shape and size test all bricks used for the purpose of construction must be of identical size when it comes to shape each brick should be rectangular with distinct sharp edges to carry out this test 20 bricks are selected randomly and stacked along their dimensions for comparison if all bricks are of the same size then they are suitable for construction activity 5 soundness test this is another way of testing bricks this test demonstrates the nature of bricks during sudden impact to perform this test two bricks are chosen randomly and struck against each other the bricks should not crack or break and the sound that is produced must be a clear bellringing sound learn how to select the right brick from experts 6 structure of bricks to successfully determine a bricks structure one brick is randomly picked from a group and is broken close attention is paid to the inner portion of the brick the brick must be smooth and free from lumps the final word bricks are the building blocks of any structure there are specific tests that you can subject the bricks to in order to determine if they are fit or unfit for house building a new home or undertaking a renovation project one of the most important decisions youll have to make is what type of cement to use while traditional portland cement is the most widely used option blended cement is quickly becoming a popular choice among builders and homeowners alike this blog will look at blended cement and explain why its the best choice for your home construction 1 blended cement has an improved strength and durability adding materials such as fly ash and slag to the cement mixture increases its compressive and tensile strength making it more resistant to cracking and damage over time this means that buildings constructed with blended cement are less likely to experience structural issues and will have a longer lifespan this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more durable and last longer saving you money in the long run 2 blended cement is also a more costeffective option than traditional portland cement including materials such as fly ash and slag in the cement mixture means that less portland cement is required reducing the cements overall cost additionally blended cement is often more readily available than traditional portland cement which can further reduce costs this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more affordable and costeffective 3 blended cement is a more sustainable and environmentallyfriendly option than traditional portland cement the production of portland cement is a significant contributor to greenhouse gas emissions as it requires high temperatures to produce and releases carbon dioxide blended cement on the other hand is made by mixing traditional portland cement with other materials such as fly ash slag or limestone this reduces the energy required to produce the cement and its carbon footprint by using blended cement youll make a more sustainable choice for your home construction which is better for the environment and future generations 4 in terms of versatility blended cement is a better choice than traditional portland cement blended cement can be tailored to specific needs by adjusting the proportions of the materials used this allows for a broader range of applications this means that blended cement can be used for various construction projects including foundations walls floors and more this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it is more versatile and can be used for many applications want to know more about selecting the right materials get an expert consultation with jsw one homes 5 finally blended cement is also a better choice for the indian construction industry because it is more resistant to the weathering effects of the indian climate the indian climate is characterized by high humidity and extreme temperature fluctuations which can cause traditional portland cement to crack and degrade over time blended cement however is less affected by these weathering effects and is better able to withstand the rigors of the indian climate this makes blended cement a better choice for your home construction because it will be more resistant to the weathering effects of the indian climate making your home more durable and longlasting in conclusion blended cement is more sustainable durable costeffective versatile and weatherresistant than traditional portland cement using blended cement in your home construction can ensure that your building will be stronger more energyefficient and more environmentally friendly with blended cement youll be able to enjoy a home that is built to last and that will stand up to the challenges of the indian climate blended cement is the way to go if youre looking for a the most heavily used surfaces in a home so choosing materials that are durable easy to maintain and look great is important with so many options available deciding which countertop materials are right for your custom home can be overwhelming in this blog post well look at some of the most popular countertop materials and their pros and cons 1 granite countertops for a good reason granite is one of the most popular countertop materials it is durable scratchresistant and can withstand heat granite is also available in various colours and patterns so you can choose a style that complements your homes decor 2 marble countertops marble is a luxurious and timeless option for countertops it has a unique veining pattern adds character to any kitchen or bathroom like granite marble is also heatresistant but more susceptible to scratches and staining therefore it is recommended that you stick with white marble for kitchen coutertops since scratches are more noticeable on colored marble than on white marble 3 quartz countertops quartz countertops are made from engineered stone and are a popular choice for homeowners who want a lowmaintenance option quartz is durable stainresistant and available in various colors and patterns however quartz can be expensive and may have a different visual appeal than natural stone let the experts help you select the right material 4 solid surface countertops solid surface countertops are made from a mixture of polyester or acrylic resins and natural minerals they are available in various colours and patterns and can be customised to fit any space solid surface countertops are nonporous and resist staining but they can scratch easily and are not heatresistant 5 laminate countertops laminate countertops are affordable for homeowners on a budget they are made from a thin layer of plastic laminate material that is glued to a particleboard base laminate countertops come in a wide range of colours and patterns and are easy to clean however they are less durable than other countertop materials and can be easily scratched or damaged 6 concrete countertops concrete countertops are popular for homeowners who want a modern industrial look they are durable heatresistant and can be customised to fit any space concrete countertops can be stained or stamped to create unique patterns and designs however they require higher maintenance to prevent staining and can be prone to cracking over time 6 concrete countertops concrete countertops are popular for homeowners who want a modern industrial look they are durable heatresistant and can be customised to fit any space concrete countertops can be stained or stamped to create unique patterns and designs however they require higher maintenance to prevent staining and can be prone to cracking over time 7tile countertops tile countertops are costeffective for homeowners who want a customised look they are available in a wide range of colours and patterns and can be customised to fit any space tile countertops are durable and heatresistant but can be prone to cracking and chipping over time choosing the right countertop materials for your custom home depends on your personal preferences budget and the maintenance you are willing to do granite and quartz countertops are durable and lowmaintenance while marble and concrete countertops require more upkeep laminate and tile countertops are affordable options but may have a different visual appeal than natural stone butcher block countertops offer a warm natural look but require regular oiling solid surface countertops are customisable and stainresistant but can scratch easily we hope that this article will be helpful to you while making a choice of a kitchen countertop material during your next ingredients which are not only expensive but also scarce concrete manufacturing emits a considerable amount of carbon dioxide co2 the pursuit of an alternate material which is economical and sustainable ended with the discovery of ground granulated blastfurnace slag ggbs ggbs is a nonmetallic product obtained as a byproduct from the blast furnaces used to make iron it consists of silicates and aluminates of bases such as calcium blast furnace varies in physical structure and composition depending on the cooling method of the slag it is obtained by the rapid chilling of the molten ash with the help of water the slag is transformed into the glass during this process and eventually refined to the required fineness for the uninformed ggbs is identifiable by its colour conventional portland cement is grey while the ggbs is white in colour there are two methods of using ggbs in concrete you can integrand the ggbs with the cement clinker and gypsum or mix the blast furnace with cement separately apart from that ggbs can also be used as the direct replacement of ordinary portland cement the replacement may vary between 3080 of cement in india generally ggbs is used by adding it to batching plants along with the portland cement water and aggregates uses of ggbs producing portland blast furnace cement pbfc and high slag blast furnace cement hsbfc producing concrete mixes enhances the structural performance in terms of strength and durability 2 the reactivity of ggbs with cement offers an increase in the compressive strength for different concrete mixes made with partial replacement of cement by ggbs 3 reduction in the energy consumption in cement manufacturing 4 one tonne of portland cement manufacturing requires around 15 tons of mineral extraction solution share book a visit now with jsw one homes home building should not be a nightmare for any query related to home building talk to our experts today sublime systems makes lowcarbon cement using electrochemistry instead of heat and combustion to transform minerals into the building material cement the binding ingredient in concrete is the most widely used manufactured materialand its responsible for 8 percent of the worlds carbon emissions to make cement limestone is put in a kiln and heated to 2500 degrees fahrenheit 1400 degrees celsius requiring a huge amount of energy and fossil fuel thats the first way cement production generates carbon dioxide then the heat causes the limestone to decompose emitting yet more of the greenhouse gas sublime has put an ecofriendly spin on the traditional method using an electrochemical approach powered by renewable electricity to break down the minerals the result is a cement powder that reacts with water to gel and harden into the same concrete that has been used for millennia the process can virtually eliminate the carbon dioxide output of cement production on a global scale sublimes technology can resolve the clash between ambitious climate goalsreducing greenhouse gas emissions to zero by 2050 a deadline set by the international energy agencyand the increasing rate of building construction were more urban than weve ever been and the amount of cement we need is staggering said cofounder and ceo leah ellis we dont just have to make green cement now were going to have to make green cement forever cement the binding ingredient in concrete is responsible for 8 percent of the worlds carbon emissions back in 2018 ellis was a postdoctoral fellow at mit studying with inventor and repeat entrepreneur yetming chiang kyocera professor in the department of materials science and engineering chiang got ellis thinking about the growing problem of cement production emissions and the opportunity to decarbonize the industry using increasingly abundant and lowcost renewable energy soon after she and another mit student began working backward from the notion of electrifying cement production to develop a sustainable material that could be costeffective easily scalable and just as durable as traditional cement with support from chiang and investors the idea of designing a zerocarbon cement became a reality and sublime systems was born swift and massive impact on global co2 emissions is the companys goal ellis said sublime raised more than 45 million in funds to accelerate production at its somerville massachusetts plant which can produce up to 250 tons of cement a year as the company scales up productionto 100 tons a day and beyondits looking to take its business international if you look at where the most cement is going to be used in the coming years its places of burgeoning urban populations like india africa and southeast asia green cement also known as sustainable cement is an ecofriendly alternative to traditional portland cement which is responsible for approximately 8 of global carbon dioxide emissions green cement is made from sustainable materials and uses less energy in the production process making it a more environmentally friendly option the use of traditional cement has been a significant contributor to climate change due to its high carbon footprint cement production is responsible for emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere which contributes to the greenhouse effect and global warming however the production of green cement uses up to 40 less energy and produces up to 80 fewer carbon dioxide emissions compared to traditional cement green cement is made from a variety of sustainable materials such as fly ash slag and recycled aggregates which are byproducts of other industries for example fly ash is a waste product of coalfired power plants and slag is a byproduct of iron and steel manufacturing using these materials in the production of green cement not only reduces waste but also reduces the amount of greenhouse gases produced green cement has several applications including use in construction road building and other infrastructure projects the properties of green cement are similar to those of traditional cement and it can be used in a range of applications in fact many of the worlds largest infrastructure projects such as highways bridges and dams have been built using green cement one of the benefits of using green cement is that it can contribute to leed certification for building projects the leadership in energy and environmental design leed certification is a rating system for green buildings and infrastructure projects using sustainable materials such as green cement can contribute to leed certification and help building projects to achieve higher ratings green cement is also costeffective as it is often cheaper to produce than traditional cement this is because the materials used in its production are often waste products from other industries making them readily available and less expensive in conclusion green cement is a sustainable alternative to traditional cement that has numerous benefits it has a lower carbon footprint is made from sustainable materials and is costeffective its applications are numerous and it can contribute to the leed certification of building projects as the world continues to move towards a more sustainable future the use of green cement is likely to increase and become more prevalent in the construction industry to view or cement in the commercial segment is due to the increase in its application in commercial establishments such as office spaces shopping malls theaters and hospitals furthermore certain properties of ecofriendly cement is to make the transition from grey2green cement manufacturing our green polysius cement plants will produce less co2 emissions and greenhouse gases this is an advantage and competitive edge for our customers our plants will be able to meet strict local regulations and requirements for cement factories in the future so you are not only reducing your cement productions carbon footprint you are also increasing the longevity and strengthening the position of your cement company in the highly competitive cement industry by choosing the green polysius solutions at thyssenkrupp polysius we are a strong partner for our customers and offer everything from the construction to the delivery of our green polysius solutions for your cement plants from a single source we accompany our customers every step of the way of the cement plant implementation by joining our vision of green polysius cement plants your cement plants not only emit fewer emissions they also consume less energy and save resources which provides your cement production with an economic advantage with our polysius solutions you also take a step towards the digitalization of the cement industry because not only do we use more ecofriendly components in binders we also put digital technologies and big data to use to increase the efficiency of our green cement plants we have the technology to be more sustainable in cement production with over 160 years of expertise and experience in the construction of bigscale industrial plants we know that when it comes to upgrading or extending a cement production our customers need solutions that are easy to implement and also take every step of the cement production process into consideration ensuring coherent and measurable improvement our solutions for a green polysius plant range from polysius activated clay for a more sustainable clinker production with calcined clay and polysius fuel substitutions as alternative fuel solutions to polysius oxyfuel to drive climateneutrality and reduce the carbon footprint of the cement industry and last but not least the nox reduction solution by cemcat ecoplanet cement reinforces our leadership in sustainable and innovative building solutions that contribute to decarbonizing cities this lowcarbon cement portfolio delivers 100 performance with a co2 reduction of at least 30 compared to ordinary gu cement and with no compromise in performance its stringent quality controls mean it can handle the most demanding infrastructure applications like highways and bridges ecoplanets strength profile is the same as traditional portland cement but weve decreased co2 emissions from the manufacturing process by 35 ecoplanetlike all cementsis also used for mining and soil stabilization ecoplanet is the global brand applied to lowcarbon cements that show a reduction in co2 per ton greater than 30 compared to standard portland cements the impact is significant and reinforces our global leadership in sustainable and innovative building solutions that make sustainable cities a reality with lafarges industryleading formulation expertise ecoplanets sustainability profile is driven by innovative lowemission raw materials including calcined clay and recycled construction and demolition waste its lower carbon footprint is further enhanced by decarbonizing its production process led by the use of alternative fuels ecoplanet green cement enables lowcarbon construction at scale contact one of our experts to learn more produced by the cement industry is one of the worlds largest emitters of carbon dioxide michael milnermomentgetty the cement industry annually produces around 35 billion tonnes of general portland cement the most common form with emissions from the sector accounting for about 7 of total global anthropogenic ghg emissions if the cement industry were a country it would be the third largest emitter of carbon dioxide in the world with up to 28 billion tonnes produced annually now a team led by ahn jiwhan director of the carbon mineralization flagship center at the korea institute of geoscience and mineral resources kigam has developed a green cement production method that partially replaces limestone a major component of cement and a raw material for carbon dioxide emissions with industrial byproducts in addition the team was able to produce this cement at a temperature about 200c lower than the industry standard moving past portland to produce portland cement limestone is mixed with raw materials such as siliceous stone and clay and is heated to about 1450 c during this process an intermediate product called clinker is produced and about 44 weight percent of the limestone is emitted as carbon dioxide the new green cement production technology however synthesizes a calcium sulfoaluminate csa clinker by mixing a part of limestone into raw materials such as coal ash and alumina byproduct generated from thermal power plants the thermal energy required to produce 1 kilogram of green cement clinker is about 570 kilocalories which is less than the general portland cement heat energy of about 720 kilocalories this reduces energy consumption by 20 and carbon dioxide emissions by 2 explains ahn moreover our green cement performs twice as well as portland cement for high early strength concrete on a 3day strength basis the compressive strength of portland cement was 125 mpa whereas green cement was 25 mpa and expandability portland cement was 001 whereas green cement was 003 so it can be applied to construction fields such as buildings and bridges and thanks to its improved waterrepellent characteristics green cement will be able to be used as a fill material for abandoned mines waste gas fields and waste oil fields in the future she adds improving international standards in october 2021 representatives from the south korean government and leaders from nearly 200 nations met at the 26th meeting of the conference of the parties cop26 to the unfccc in glasgow uk cop26 was intended to accelerate actions towards achieving the 2015 paris agreement which aims to limit average global temperature increases to below 2 c by 2050 from preindustrial levels at the meeting south korea committed to reducing ghg emissions by at least 40 by 2030 from 2018 levels and committed to achieving carbon neutrality by 2050 ahn jiwhan at the korea institute of geoscience and mineral resources kigam kigam kigams green cement technology not only reduces greenhouse gases but also meets one of the cop26 sustainable development mechanism goals to reduce the use of limestone a natural resource mineral and overcome the deviation and harmfulness of industrial byproducts about 887 of domestic mineral resource reserves are nonmetallic ore of which limestone accounts for nearly 72 and most of these minerals are used in the cement industry explains ahn ahn jiwhan at the korea institute of geoscience and mineral resources kigam kigam in addition to the green cement technology ahn developed a new clean development mechanism cdm methodology for use in the cement industry which has many restrictions on carbon credits the new cdm methodology is an international standard for estimating the greenhouse gas emissions that are reduced by specific activities and it is necessary to certify the greenhouse gas reduction performance of our green cement production technology she explains the most challenging aspect of registering the technology under the cdm methodology was estimating the amount of carbon dioxide reduced by the cement production technology recalls ahn she estimates that the cement developed with this technology releases 0281 carbon dioxide emissions tco2 per tonne of produced cement fewer than that produced via general portland cement take 2019 figures for example if green cement comprised 5 2912710 tons of the total cement production in 2019 about 820000 tco2 of total greenhouse gas could have been reduced the cdm methodology was approved and announced in october 2020 by the united nations framework convention on climate change unfccc this means our methodology has been recognized as an international greenhouse gas reduction technology standard for cement production she says and its this recognition as an international standard that ahn believes will lead to greater impact green cement technology not only has the potential to reduce domestic emissions from the cement industry in south korea but to also reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the cement industry through technology transfer at home and abroad based on the registration of a new cdm methodology the results of our greenvantage value por david bradley traducido por francisco reyes consumption automated blinds motorised window treatments for light control and energy efficiency made from singlecrystal silicon these panels are known for their high efficiency and spaceefficiency they have a uniform black hue and a rounded edge appearance the best monocrystalline solar panels in india tend to perform better in lowlight conditions compared to other types created from multiple silicon crystals hence their name these solar panels in india for home are recognisable by their speckled blue appearance they are costeffective due to their manufacturing process which involves melting raw silicon while slightly less efficient than monocrystalline panels they offer a good balance between cost and performance thinfilm panels use various materials like amorphous silicon cadmium telluride or copper indium gallium selenide deposited in thin layers onto a substrate they are lighter and more flexible allowing for unique applications like curved surfaces or portable solar panels these panels are less efficient in terms of energy conversion but are more costeffective to produce the best solar panels in india for homes can convert sunlight into electricity higher efficiency panels generate more power per square metre when choosing solar panels for your home look for ones with higher efficiency ratings as they can maximise energy production especially if space for installation is limited the best monocrystalline solar panels in india generally offer higher efficiency compared to polycrystalline or thinfilm panels monocrystalline cells are made from single silicon crystals and are known for their efficiency and spacesaving design consider choosing solar panels for your home that have build quality and materials used panels with robust construction and highquality materials tend to last longer look for panels with durable frames tempered glass and weatherresistant coatings to withstand harsh weather conditions solar panels experience reduced efficiency as temperatures rise the temperature coefficient indicates how much the panels efficiency decreases with higher temperatures lower temperature coefficients imply better performance in hot climates create a list of appliancesmake a comprehensive list of all electrical appliances used in your household including lights fans refrigerators air conditioners televisions computers washing machines etc determine power ratingsfind the power ratings in watts or kilowatts of each appliance this information is usually labelled on the appliance itself or in the user manualfor appliances without clear ratings use averages or check the manufacturers website for specifications estimate daily usagenote down the average time each appliance is used daily some appliances like lights or fans may be used for several hours while others like washing machines or tvs might have specific usage durations calculate daily energy consumptionmultiply the power rating in kilowatts of each appliance by the number of hours it is used daily to calculate its daily energy consumption in kilowatthours kwhsum up the individual energy consumption values for all appliances to get the total daily energy consumption of your household seasonal variations and adjustmentsconsider seasonal variations in energy consumption especially for appliances like air conditioners or heaters that are used more during extreme weather conditionsfactor in any additional energy usage during holidays weekends or special occasions energy audit toolsutilise online energy consumption calculators or mobile apps specifically designed for estimating household energy usage some utilities or energy companies may also offer tools for this purpose measurements accurate measurements are crucial use a measuring tape or laser distance measurer to determine the length and width of each room measure from wall to wall including doorways and any protrusions like alcoves or closets scale understand the scale of the floor plan for example 14 inch might represent 1 foot use this scale to convert your measurements accurately onto paper or a digital platform room shapes identify the shape of each roomwhether rectangular square lshaped or irregular break down complex shapes into simpler ones for easier calculationsfeatures and details note any architectural features like columns fireplaces or builtin furniture these elements might impact the layout and need to be included in your floor plan vertical dimensions while floor plans focus on horizontal space understanding ceiling heights is also vital assess its quality a clear crisp sound indicates a wellfired and structurally sound tile dull thuds or hollow sounds suggest defects like air pockets or cracks visually inspect for any visible defects before installation to check if the cement is fresh visually inspect the packaging for damage and look for a uniform grey colour fresh cement feels powdery and freeflowing while stale cement may feel clumpy or have hardened chunks it should have a characteristic earthy smell conduct a small test batch of concrete to observe its setting time ensuring it meets expectations store cement in a cool dry place away from moisture for optimal freshness place a few drops of water on the surface of the wood if the water beads and remains on the surface the wood is likely wellsealed and protected from moisture if the water soaks into the wood quickly it may indicate that it lacks proper sealing and could be prone to rot or decay apply a strip of painters tape firmly onto the painted surface after letting it sit for a few minutes quickly peel off the tape if the paint comes off with the tape it suggests poor adhesion and may require sanding and priming before repainting place a level tool on various parts of the floor or surface to check for evenness if the bubble in the level rests within the marked lines the surface is level uneven surfaces may require additional levelling compounds or adjustments during construction use a voltage tester to ensure electrical outlets are wired correctly and safely check for proper grounding and polarity and ensure the outlets function correctly open and close windows and doors to ensure smooth operation and proper alignment look for any sticking or dragging which may indicate issues with installation or framing use a screwdriver to press against drywall lightly if the drywall feels firm and doesnt give easily its likely wellinstalled soft spots or areas that give easily may indicate improper installation or water damage bamboo construction coimbatore chennai kochi bamboo is a fastgrowing renewable resource that can be used as a structural material its lightweight strong and versatile making it suitable for various construction layers of earth within a frame to create walls this method utilises locally available soil reducing the need for transportation and minimising carbon emissions bangalore salem and hubli experience relatively dry climates with hot summers and mild winters they absorb heat during the day and release it slowly at night recycled materials all regions incorporating recycled materials into carbono en cemento este artculo forma parte de una lista anual de las que a nuestro juicio son las 10 tecnologas emergentes ms importantes la lista completa se puede ver haciendo clic aqu la fabricacin de cemento para hormign consiste en calentar piedra caliza pulverizada arcilla y arena a 1450 c usando un combustible como el carbn o el gas natural el proceso genera una gran cantidad de dixido de carbono la fabricacin de una tonelada mtrica de cemento portland de uso general libera entre 650 y 920 kilogramos de dicho componente los 28 millones de toneladas mtricas de cemento producidas en todo el mundo en 2009 generaron alrededor del 5 por ciento de todas las emisiones de dixido de carbono nikolaos vlasopoulos cientfico jefe en la startup novacem con sede en londres est tratando de eliminar las emisiones con un cemento que absorba ms dixido de carbono del que libere durante su fabricacin logra retener hasta 100 kilogramos de gas de efecto invernadero por tonelada vlasopoulos descubri la receta del cemento de novacem cuando era estudiante de postgrado en el imperial college de londres estaba investigando cementos producidos por la mezcla de xidos de magnesio con cemento portland afirma no obstante al aadir agua a los compuestos de magnesio sin ningn tipo de portland en la mezcla descubri que an as poda hacer un tipo de cemento slido y que no estuviese basado en piedra caliza rica en carbono y a medida que se endureca el dixido de carbono en la atmsfera reaccionaba con el magnesio para crear carbonatos fortalecientes del cemento que al mismo tiempo ayudaban a la captura del gas novacem est en la actualidad refinando la frmula para que el rendimiento mecnico del producto sea igual al del cemento portland ese trabajo afirma vlasopoulos debera estar hecho de aqu a un ao otras nuevas empresas tambin estn tratando de reducir la huella de carbono del cemento incluyendo a calera en los gatos california que ha recibido cerca de 50 millones de dlares en inversiones de riesgo sin embargo los cementos de calera se encuentran actualmente destinados a ser aditivos para el cemento portland en lugar de ser un reemplazo como en el caso de novacem afirma franzjosef ulm director del centro de sostenibilidad del cemento en mit novacem podra as conseguir ventaja en la reduccin de emisiones aunque todas las startups se enfrentan al reto de escalar su tecnologa a niveles industriales sin embargo segn afirma ulm esto no significa que una empresa deba desplazar miles de millones de toneladas de cemento portland para tener xito se puede comenzar por la explotacin de nichos de mercado especializados dentro de la construccin si novacem es capaz de producir 500000 toneladas al ao segn cree vlasopoulos puede alcanzar el mismo precio del cemento portland incluso llegar hasta ese punto va a ser difcil ellos estn introduciendo un material muy nuevo en una industria muy conservadora seala hamlin jennings profesor en el departamento de ingeniera civil y ambiental de la universidad northwestern habr cuestiones que responder novacem comenzar a tratar de persuadir a la industria trabajando con laing orourke la mayor empresa constructora de propiedad privada en el reino unido en 2011 y con 15 millones de dlares en efectivo procedentes de la real sociedad y otras fuentes novacem tiene programado comenzar a construir una nueva planta piloto para fabricar su nueva formulacin de cemento los investigadores se basan en los anillos de los rboles los glaciares y los registros fsiles para situar el clima actual en su contexto por casey crownhart a medida que el aire se vuelve ms limpio el mundo tambin pierde un importante efecto refrigerante por james temple un parque nuclear envejecido an puede contribuir a reducir las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero por casey crownhart ms informacin sobre cambio climtico es un concreto con 3050 menos contenido de carbono incorporado esta solucin utiliza cemento reducido en co2 y tiene un diseo de mezcla optimizado para reducir su huella de carbono con un nivel de reduccin de co2 entre 5070 es un producto tcnicamente ms demandante que proporciona una reduccin significativamente mayor que el estndar general disponible en un mercado determinado con este concreto explotan las posibilidades tcnicas al mximo para ofrecer un producto de primera con una reduccin de co2 mayor al 70 es una combinacin de excelencia tecnolgica en concreto y accin climtica este producto otorga la oportunidad de eliminar hasta el 100 la huella de carbono del concreto y reducir en gran medida la huella de carbono general de las estructuras de concreto dos empresas argentinas lderes se han asociado para construirla primera planta productora de cemento basada en el bajo consumo de energa y en el cuidado del medio ambiente el emprendimiento ecocemento sa tiene adems un ingrediente econmicoambiental ms que interesante este cemento ecolgico tienecomo insumo esencial un residuo la escoria de la industria siderrgicay los resultados de su uso son muy satisfactorios en relacin a otros cementos la nueva planta con capacidad inicial para producir 300000 toneladas anuales demand una inversin de 25 millones de dlares y ocupa un predio de 335 hectreas ubicado en las cercanas de las ciudades de ramallo y san nicols en la provincia de buenos aires uno de sus propietarios es la principal empresa del grupo fortabat loma negra en un 85 el 15 restante pertenece a siderar del grupo techint quien adems estuvo a cargo de la obra el suministro de equipamiento tecnolgico correspondi a la firma dinamarquesa f l smidth loma negra aporta su experiencia en tecnologa de produccin su capacidad de distribucin y la principal materia prima del cemento el clinker que llega a la planta en ferrocarril proveniente de sus fbricas en olavarra y barker provincia de buenos aires por su parte siderar suministra desde su planta lindante con ecocemento la escoria de alto horno un subproducto de la industria siderrgica disminuyendo de este modo la utilizacin de los recursos no renovables y del consumo de energa en relacin al cemento comn el cemento elaborado con escoria de alto horno tiene excelentes caractersticas ya que posee mayor resistencia final y gran durabilidad lo que lo constituye en el producto ms indicado para aquellas obras en las que el hormign puede verse sometido a condiciones agresivas como son los pavimentos las fundaciones los emprendimientos hidrulicos y las estructuras portuarias entre otras cuando se construy el aeropuerto de ushuaia ejemplificaron en ecocemento el cemento debi ser traido desde alemania en el futuro obras deese estilo podrn desarrollarse con cemento argentino otra ventaja es el menor calor de hidratacin con lo cual se evita la fisura por causas de origen trmico aseste cemento resulta ideal para obras masivas por su mayor resistencia a aguas sulfatadas aguas de mar o ataques de cidos ecocemento sa cuenta con el primer molino vertical para la mezcla de cemento de amrica del sur especialmente diseado para la molienda de cementos con y de escoria aplicando tecnologa de punta y logrando con este tipo de equipamiento un menor consumo especfico de energa el proceso que se realiza en esta planta comprende el almacenaje transporte y dosificacin de materias primas como as tambin la molienda el embolsado y despacho del producto final desde loma negra se asegura que el nuevo producto posee un nivel de calidad que excede con holgura los requisitos de la norma iram 1636 superando en muchos aspectos las caractersticas del cemento normal de esta manera afirman loma negra empresa lder en el mercado de cementos de argentina se mantiene a la vanguardia de los procesos productivos de cemento con especiales ventajas competitivas en consumo energtico y proteccin ambiental la presidente de loma negra amalia lacroze de fortabat seal durante el acto de inauguracin de la planta este proyecto se enmarca dentro de una poltica que ha mantenido nuestra empresa cuidar el medio ambiente dentro de los avances tecnolgicos es necesario respetar al hombre las fbricas son algo bello porque crean para el hombre pero no deben medio de esta innovadora iniciativa la empresa suiza holcim busca contribuir a la transicin hacia un futuro incluyente sostenible y net zero se estima que para el ao 2050 el 80 por ciento de la poblacin mundial podra vivir en zonas urbanas y en ese trnsito el mundo necesitar construir el equivalente a la ciudad de nueva york cada mes empresas como holcim vienen innovando para responder a esa demanda y contribuir a la transicin hacia un futuro incluyente y net zero para afrontar este reto lanz ecoplanet la lnea ms amplia de cemento verde del mundo que permite reducir sus emisiones hasta un 50 por ciento es decir 38 kg de co2 por tonelada de material cementante con un desempeo igual o superior al del cemento tradicional marco maccarelli presidente ejecutivo de holcim colombia explica que ecoplanet ofrece ventajas circulares y de bajas emisiones de carbono al introducir un novedoso sistema de molienda separada reconocido por el ministerio de ciencia tecnologa e innovacin adems cuenta con la descarbonizacin en su proceso de produccin al hacer uso de combustibles alternativos mediante estas acciones damos pasos firmes en nuestra estrategia 2025 acelerando de forma contundente el crecimiento ecolgico precis ecoplanet ofrece dos niveles ecoplanet con mnimo 30 por ciento de reduccin en huella de carbono y ecoplanet zero con una huella de carbono neutra basada en una formulacin baja en carbono complementada con compensaciones certificadas por expertos medioambientales independientes la empresa asegura que en ningn caso se compromete el desempeo del producto estos cementos complementan el portafolio de soluciones ecoinnovadoras que holcim desarrolla desde hace unos aos en 2020 introdujo en el mercado ecopact una amplia y avanzada gama de concreto ecolgico para crear edificaciones sostenibles y de alto desempeo esta lnea con propiedades iguales o superiores a los concretos convencionales aporta a la construccin sostenible y circular ecopact cuenta con una huella de carbono desde 30 por ciento hasta ciento por ciento ms baja en comparacin con el concreto estndar su perfil de sostenibilidad est impulsado por materias primas bajas en emisiones al igual que ecoplanet por la descarbonizacin de sus operaciones incluido el uso de combustibles alternativos esta lnea de concretos cuenta con cuatro presentaciones segn el nivel de reduccin de co2 ecopact 3050 por ciento menos ecopact prime disminucin del 5070 por ciento menos ecopact max reduccin mayor al 70 por ciento menos y ecopact zero elimina hasta el ciento por ciento la huella de carbono contenido de cemento se obtiene con el aprovechamiento de la escoria arcilla separada del material ferroso de los altos hornos de las siderrgicas y la matriz energtica o la energa elctrica gastada en el proceso grupo del coppe indican la existencia de alrededor de 10 millones de t de residuos disponibles para la utilizacin por parte de la industria del cemento entre 15 y 2 millones son de cenizas de la quema del bagazo de caa que sobran de las calderas y los generadores para la produccin de energa elctrica para el abastecimiento de los propios centrales las cenizas del bagazo son ricas en slice amorfo diferente de la forma cristalina encontrada por ejemplo en la arena en la forma amorfa puede reaccionar a temperatura ambiente con el hidrxido de calcio uno de los productos de hidratacin del cemento el material es reducido a partculas mucho menores lo ramosla industria brasilea de cermica produce aproximadamente de 5 a 6 millones de t de residuos en la produccin de tejas ladrillos y pisos ese coppe y presentado en la edicin de septiembre de 2007 de la revista cientfica cement and concrete research otro producto no aprovechable que surge como alternativa pero alcanza un ndice menor de sustitucin del cemento de un 5 a 10 son las cenizas resultantes del lodo sanitario quemado obtenidas de las estaciones de tratamiento de basura slida urbana el concreto de desarrollo sostenible es mundo principalmente en china que utiliza un 43 del cemento mundial clculos de investigadores del rea basados en el crecimiento de los grandes pases emergentes indican que si el consumo de cemento es de 25 mil millones de t por ao l saltar para 65 mil millones de t en 50 aos porque es y continuar siendo el material ms usado del mundo en infraestructura dice toledo elemento vinculante el principal desde 2017 cornare viene apoyando y supervisando el desarrollo del proyecto de la empresa argos presentado hoy en la maana en medelln con el que la compaa iniciar la fabricacin y distribucin de cemento verde en su planta roclaro proceso que cont con una inversin superior a los usd 78 millones se trata de una actividad en la cual se disminuye el uso del tradicional clnker material base para la elaboracin del cemento gracias a la incorporacin de arcillas activadas trmicamente puzolana artificial lo que hace que el cemento sea ms amigable con el medioambiente con este proyecto estamos siendo protagonistas de la industria y sembrando las semillas del argos del futuro que arranca hoy una nueva lnea de produccin en roclaro pero que tiene un potencial gigantesco de crecimiento en todas las geografas no solo desde el punto de vista del producto sino porque es una accin concreta por la sostenibilidad de nuestra industria explic juan esteban calle presidente de cementos argos por su parte javier parra bedoya director general de cornare manifest su complacencia por el proyecto y expres que se trata de una muestra del ejercicio de la gestin ambiental en la regin y en colombia esta iniciativa de argos hace que se disminuyan los indicadores de impacto en la generacin de energa necesaria para la produccin del cemento y los consumos de agua requeridos por eso felicitamos a la empresa por ese trabajo tan representativo en materia de crecimiento verde puntualiz segn manifest la compaa esta innovacin hace que durante el proceso de produccin se reduzcan hasta 38 las emisiones de co2 y 30 el consumo de energa en comparacin con el estndar de la industria para el tradicional cemento portland tambin indicaron que este nuevo producto mantiene la calidad y el desempeo que siempre los ha caracterizado la empresa argos especficamente la planta roclaro ha venido evidenciando un importante liderazgo en el uso de combustibles alternativos y bsqueda de sustitutos de sus materias primas con el fin de disminuir los impactos ambientales generados en el desarrollo de su actividad productiva y realizar un aporte a la sostenibilidad a travs de la disposicin final de algunos residuos slidos acciones que cornare como autoridad ambiental ha venido validando y controlando permanentemente esta y otras iniciativas de la empresa como el coprocesamiento de llantas es decir la sustitucin parcial del combustible convencional por un residuo llantas y el reciente licenciamiento ambiental para el coprocesamiento de residuos peligrosos en 2019 son para cornare motivo de satisfaccin y reconocimiento toda vez que su proceso productivo se desarrolla desde el cumplimiento de los estndares medioambientales ms exigentes con la implementacin de las tecnologas ms limpias e innovadoras y aportan al desarrollo socioeconmico de la regin a las urbes popularmente se les llama junglas de concreto pero de verde tienen poco hoy en da el desarrollo de cemento ecolgico podra reducir las emisiones del c02 y crear un entorno ms amable con el medio ambiente el concreto es el pilar de la industria de la construccin ya que es el material ms usado en el mundo para este sector 1 en una poca donde la urbanizacin avanza a pasos agigantados no podemos imaginar una ciudad sin ver gris por todas partes de ah el caracterstico sobrenombre que se les ha dado a las metrpolis la jungla de concreto sin embargo aunque es imprescindible el material tambin es uno de los mayores generadores de gases del efecto invernadero a nivel mundial ya que se estima que por s solo produce 4 del total de co lo cual representa niveles como los del sector de la minera o hierro y acero ante esta problemtica los profesionales de la construccin han optado por desarrollar y usar tecnologa que modifique el concreto comn a uno ms sustentable que tenga beneficios para el planeta pero tambin para el consumidor final el llamado concreto verde puede ser fabricado a partir de deshechos tales como cscara de arroz cenizas o micro silicatos entre otros adems de usar menos cemento en su composicin en un estimado por cada tonelada fabricada de cemento se producen 09 toneladas de co la ventaja del concreto sustentable es que utiliza solo la mitad del material contaminante de lo que comnmente se empleara 2 adems de su principal ventaja ecolgica el concreto verde tambin sirve mejor en el aislamiento trmico que los convencionales debido a los materiales que lo conforman con lo que tambin se pueden aminorar costos en la energa de calefaccin o enfriamiento este producto es reciclable en su totalidad por lo que no se desechan los residuos como con otros materiales de construccin lo cual contribuye a aminorar la huella ecolgica que deja la industria en el mundo dicha innovacin es prometedora es por ello que diversas empresas alrededor del mundo se han preocupado por desarrollar investigacin en este campo un caso destacable es el de la empresa cemex quien en 2021 puso a prueba en pars su concreto hecho con productos bajos en carbono al contribuir con este material para la edificacin de duo towers un proyecto residencial de rascacielos diseado por ateliers jean nouvel 3 segn voceros de la empresa el objetivo de este material es reducir la huella de carbono de los edificios por lo que tambin participaron en el reciclaje de residuos de la obra otra marca que apost por materiales ms sustentables es cementos argos ubicada en territorio colombiano la cual invirti 78 millones de dlares en varios aos de investigacin para crear materiales ms amigables con el medio ambiente 4 el cemento bajo en emisiones que cre la empresa latinoamericana promete hasta 38 de reduccin de emisiones de co y disminucin del 30 de consumo de energa lo cual los convirti en los pioneros en su pas en fabricar este material de tipo sustentable con acciones como estas las empresas buscan ayudar a llegar a la meta de alcanzar la neutralidad en carbono para el 2050 compromiso que adoptaron ms de 110 pases en el mundo para lograr que la cantidad de gases de efecto invernadero producido a nivel mundial sea igual al que la tierra puede absorber de manera natural 5 referencias compartir autor angel marn villaseca para la industria de la construccin el concreto es la materia prima por excelencia desde su invencin durante el periodo de la antigua roma hasta nuestros das el concreto se encuentra presente tanto en edificaciones de gran importancia histrica y arquitectnica como en construcciones simples y sencillas no obstante debemos ser conscientes que el concreto es considerado una de las fuentes principales de emisiones de carbono en la construccin ante esta situacin se debe pensar en nuevas estrategias que hagan de este popular material una opcin sustentable para la construccin por ello la opcin de un concreto verde suena como una alternativa viable para la construccin del maana pero qu es un concreto verde la industria cementera lo ha definido como un concreto que posee las caractersticas de fraguado y resistencia muy similares o incluso superiores a las de los concretos convencionales pero su proceso de elaboracin refleja una reduccin significativa en la cantidad de emisiones a la atmsfera para lograr este objetivo los procesos de elaboracin de concretos verdes se diferencian de los convencionales al cambiar la materia prima del cemento e incluso el cemento mismo por alternativas sostenibles de aglutinantes que no requieran de horneado a altas temperaturas adems de alterar su composicin qumica para reducir las reacciones qumicas que se producen durante el fraguado y de esta manera tambin reducir las emisiones en el proceso de produccin en mxico existen concreteras que han apostado fuertemente en las cadenas de produccin de los concretos verdes pues la meta es reducir las emisiones de ciertas marcas de concreto entre un 30 y hasta un 100 sin duda se trata de una misin ambiciosa que ya se esta volviendo tangible en algunas plantas de concreto alrededor del mundo adems el sector de la construccin ya ha vuelto a mirar otros productos que se requieren en obra que tambin resultan altamente contaminantes tales como adhesivos colorantes mamposteras entre otros y ya se ha comenzado a investigar cmo a partir del concreto verde se pueden generar soluciones similares para la diferente gama de materiales
